loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta qui porte le drapeau de myAgro au cou sur la photo,  est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sanankorobougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, âgée de 30 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 15 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Fanta à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Fanta cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de main d'œuvre. Fanta entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Fanta cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Fanta planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Fanta espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Fanta, wearing the myAgro scarf around her neck in the photo, is a member of a group of eight farmers registered at myAgro, all living and working in the village of Sanankorobougou in southeastern Bamako, Mali.
Fanta is 30 years old and the mother of five children aged from 2 to 15, four of whom currently attend school. A family tradition for agriculture - the main source of income and food security for the family - has led Fanta to work in the sector for the last ten years. She grows peanuts on her plot, but as a farmer she has to cope with problems such as a lack of labour.
Fanta is into her first season with my Agro, having registered due to the payment system. This year she is making payments to buy a myAgro seed and fertiliser package for growing peanuts, in order to increase the yield on her 625m2 piece of land. Fanta has been growing peanuts for ten years for its crop yield and its marketability.
Fanta is planning to be able to trade with her increased yield and higher income. Finally, she hopes to be able to build a home for her family.

loans.use: pour s'offrir un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide

loans.name: Neymie Group

texts.es: El grupo solidaria Neymie está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que Solicitan por segundo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, el grupo está coordinado por la señora Mariela de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, por los que trabaja día a día para darles un futuro mejor, se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyería de plata desde hace ocho años, con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su casa, una de sus metas es aumentar el negocio, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de Blusas, pantalones, chores y faldas, la segunda socia es paulina de 32 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y la tercer socia es doña Quinnette de 36 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Neymie is integrated by 3 entrepreneurial women who are requesting a second financing cycle in ADIM.  The group is coordinated by Mrs. Mariela who is 33 years old, married and with 3 children for whom she works day after day to give them a better future.
She's been selling clothes and silver jewelry for the last 8 years.  With the previous loan she was able to improve her house.  One of her goals is to grow her business which is why she is requesting a loan to buy blouses, pants, shorts, and skirts.
The second partner is Paulina who's 32 years old and has a convenience store at her house and the third partner is Mrs. Quinnette, 36 years old, who has been selling new clothes for the last 5 years.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shorts, and skirts.

loans.name: Pampa

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Pampa is a housewife from Falakata who is a proud mother of two little kids. She lives with her husband and children in Jogendrapur village, in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Pampa's children are studying in school.

They have a plot of land where her husband grows different vegetables and sells the produce in the market. He finds joy in harvesting his own produce for consumption and selling it for income generation.

Pampa is a multi-tasking woman who manages the household responsibilities, including cooking and household chores, and also helps her husband in cultivation for sustenance. They live in a small village where most of the inhabitants are engaged in cultivation. So, they have to face tough business competition. Now, Pampa and her husband aspire to do pumpkin cultivation.

So, Pampa has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase good-quality pumpkin seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary supplies for cultivation. Pampa hopes that the profit she will make from the business will upgrade their present financial condition and ensure that her family members, especially her children, lead a decent life. She also hopes to upgrade their mud house in the future.

She expresses her gratitude to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for pumpkin cultivation.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Ratna is an enterprising woman who lives in a remote village named Singijani in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal with her family. Together with her husband, she is raising one daughter who reads in class 9. Ratna could not continue her schooling after sixth grade due to the financial constraints of her family, but she dreams of providing a good education to her only daughter.

Her business is her only hope to make this dream come true. Ratna's husband is a mason who has no regular income. So, Ratna has been running an animal husbandry. She rears cows and sells milk in her neighborhood. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Now she wants to bring more financial stability to her family. Hence, she is planning to purchase one more cow and serve more customers. In this way, she can generate more income from her business, but she needs financial help for that.

Ratna is requesting an enterprise loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. With the loan, she will be able to buy one cow for her business. She hopes that this will increase her business to give a decent and financially strong lifestyle to her family. In the future, she wants to increase her business with more cows.

Ratna is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Joevelien

texts.en:
Joevelien is 36 years old, married with two children.

Joevelien works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joevelien has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Joevelien aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store so as to expand her business

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselinda is 37 years old and has three children are still in school.

Roselinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Roselinda requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Roselinda has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business so as to save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Melyn

texts.en:
Melyn is 36 years old, married with two children who are attending in school.

Melyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, to be able to continue to send her children to school

loans.name: Ruzel

texts.en:
Ruzel is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, Ruzel works very hard to provide for them.

Ruzel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ruzel has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell and save for her children's college education

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 37-year-old rural housewife. She resides in Falakata with her family of five members. She has a family comprising her husband and four daughters. All her daughters are students in different grades. Sabitri is illiterate (only can sign her name), but understands the value of education. Her greatest motivation in life is her children's education. She has taken a great role to improve her family's livelihood.

Sabitri's husband Swapan has been engaged with the fish business. He purchases varieties of fishes from the wholesale market and sells them in the local market and in her neighborhood. This is the only source of income for maintaining the family of six, and Sabitri assists her husband in all respects. But, the business income is not sufficient to maintain her family properly; with sufficient investment in the business, she will be able to materialize her dreams.

So, to generate more income, she planned to improve their business. Thus she wants to take a loan from Kiva via BJS. The loan amount will help her husband to purchase a huge quantity of varieties of fishes.

She and her husband hope to elevate their business in the future.

Sabitri is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her husband's fish vending business.

loans.name: Lassana's Group

texts.fr: Lassana qui se trouve sur la photo assis juste devant dans la chaise, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Gueleba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Lassana, âgé de 55 ans, est le père de 15 enfants âgés de 3 à 30 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Lassana à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Lassana cultive l'arachide, le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité . Lassana entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Lassana effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Lassana cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Lassana planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de gagner plus pour que les autres puissent s’en profiter aussi. Enfin Lassana espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille. Il a exprimé que, " je compte élargir ma parcelle pour l'an prochain."
texts.en:
Lassana, sitting in a chair right in front in the photo, is a member of a group of eleven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Gueleba, south of Bamako, in Mali. He is 55 years old and the father of fifteen children, aged 3 to 30, of whom two are currently in school. 

Lassana’s love of farming has encouraged him to do this work for 20 years now. He grows peanuts, corn, and rice on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of quality fertilizer. 

Lassana is starting his first year with myAgro and signed up with the aim of increasing his crop yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase his yields on his 0.25-hectare parcel of land. He has been growing peanuts for 20 years for their productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Lassana is planning on earning more, so that the others may benefit too. Ultimately, he also hopes to ensure the family’s self-sufficiency in food. He said, “I plan on expanding my parcel of land for next year.”

loans.use: to get a packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts and to benefit from myAgro training and farming techniques

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a rural and energetic woman from Falakata. She is 41 years old and married with one son. Now her son is pursuing his B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) in education. Namita is a homemaker who looks after her family and does all the household work. She lives with her family in Dakshin Parengerpar village in Alipurduar district.

Namita’s husband, 46-year-old Kanu, is a cycle van puller; he rents the cycle van from a local owner. Thus their income is very inconsistent to meet all the household expenses along with their son’s education cost. From the beginning, they have faced many problems to run the family. Then Namita came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase a cycle van of their own.

Now Namita hopes her husband’s income will increase. Like a rickshaw and auto, a cycle van is also one kind of transport that carries people and goods from one place to another, especially in remote areas. She hopes their family’s condition will improve from the earlier situation and that she can give her best to her son for his further education.

Her dream is to purchase a Toto van (a kind of transport) in the future.

Namita thanks her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle van to earn more money.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.en:
Sayda is an active and energetic woman who always works hard with the objective of developing her family's existing business. She is 23 years old, married, and lives at Baganbari village in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a mother of one infant son. 

By trade, her husband is a farmer. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Sayda assists her husband in this activity. Now they wish to cultivate bottle gourds on their own land to generate more income. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field; this is the reason for choosing this business. 

Sayda is confident that she will be able to grow her business, so she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to cultivate bottle gourds. She hopes she can improve her family’s financial status with the profit that would be generated by this new cultivation. She dreams of buying a tractor later for her family with the outcome profit she would gain.

Sayda is thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping her to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for bottle gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a married woman, 32 years old, from Falakata. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) at a small village Dakshin Parengerpar in Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their name only. But they send their children to school; they are in grade 10 and 11 respectively.

Namita is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who has a plot of agricultural land where he grows various vegetables and sells those in the local markets. Namita assists him in his work, especially at the time of harvesting. Now they have decided to cultivate maize on their farm land for an additional income.

Namita is a tenacious woman who is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as good quality maize seeds, fertilizers etc.  Her long-term goal is to go ahead with maize cultivation as it is profitable, being the most popular food for the people of their remote region. Her dream is to harvest the crop in abundance.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating maize.

loans.name: Dilaram

texts.ru: Диларам,52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Диларам- среднее образование, занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Диларам, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 27 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Диларам обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Dilaram is 52 years old, married, and raises two children with her husband. Dilaram has a secondary education, and she started rearing animals 34 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, Dilaram now has two cows and 27 sheep. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Dilaram has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock, and plans to save up to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to increase her herd.

loans.name: Karen Nathaly

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad en la cual las personas se dedican a sus actividades para salir adelante.
En este lugar vive la señora Karen, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 3  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja como conserje.
Doña Karen realiza varias actividades, trabaja para una empresa que prepara alimentos para un hospital en la ciudad por lo cual recibe un pago mensual por sus servicios, pero en sus ratos libres ella también realiza trabajos de belleza como tinturados,  pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, trabajos que realiza ya sea en su casa o a domicilio, lleva más 9 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo, ella espera de a poco ir adecuando un lugar para instalar un salón de belleza y así brindar un servicio más adecuado a su clientes y mejorar sus ingresos a través de su trabajo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar herramientas y materiales que utiliza en sus trabajos de belleza. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The "Santa Rosa Del Cielo" (Saint Rosa of the Heavens) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo's citadel, El Progreso.  It is a very populated, marginal urban area whose citizens dedicate their time to their businesses so they can get ahead. 
This is where señora Karen lives.  She is 25-years old, married and has two children, who are 9- and 3-years old respectively.  Her eldest child goes to school.  Doña Karen's husband works as a custodian.  
Doña Karen works in a couple jobs.  She works for a company that prepares food for a city hospital.  She receives a monthly salary for that work.  In her free time, doña Karen also offer beauty services, such as hair coloring, nail painting and other services.  She works in her own home or in her clients' homes.  She has been offering these services for more than nine years, and she earns her own money that way.  Little by little, doña Karen hopes to set up a space to open a beauty salon.  Then she would be able to offer more suitable services to her customers and improve her income through her work. 
This loan will be used to purchase tools and materials that doña Karen uses for her beauty services.  
She has been in the communal bank since it's start.  She likes it because of the help and the earnings she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials for beauty services.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata hails from Harinathpur village in Alipurduar, West Bengal. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son. Mamata does not have a formal education, but she can sign her name. Her husband works in a local sweetmeat shop. Mamata has been doing a goat-rearing business from her own home. 

Mamata's husband's income does not provide a decent lifestyle for the family or cover all the needs of his family. So, Mamata is involved in the livestock business. She purchases goat kids and sells them after rearing when they grow up. She also sells goats to the meat suppliers at the market. She is a hardworking, optimistic woman and wants to get ahead in her life. She manages her livestock business after taking care of her child and husband and doing all the household jobs. Mamata says, although she is earning a handsome income, it is not sufficient to maintain the family, invest in the business, and materialize her dreams. 

To get more income from her business she needs expansion of her business, so she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. Mamata has planned to purchase more goats with the present loan amount. She hopes to save money from the profit of her business for enhancing her family's livelihood and to provide a better education to her son. She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing goats for raising and reselling later on

loans.name: Nakhamchuang Group

texts.en:
Sai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Sai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Sai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Sai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Marjina is a homemaker. She lives with her husband and two daughters. One of her daughters is in grade 10, while the other one is too small to go to school. They live in Jogendrapur village in Alipurduar of West Bengal.

At present, Marjina's husband deals with a cow dung manure business. Cow dung is used as farm manure by the cultivators in their village. As he does not have any cows, he had to purchase bulk cow dung from village cow owners; he then stores the cow dung in a pit in the ground for avoiding any damage or loss. Then he supplies this to his customers as per their demand. Marjina also assists her husband in this work.

According to Marjina, in the context of the present market situation, the income from this business is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of the future development. Although there is potential market for her husband's business, investment was a hindrance for them. After the involvement of BJS (Kiva’s partner) in her village, she saw a ray of hope and she applied for a loan for the development of the business.

With this, she has planned to purchase more cow dung to expand the existing business. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of a better lifestyle for her family.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cow dung in bulk for her farm manure business.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Толгонай занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес 6 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Толгонай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади. На 0,11 Га собственной и 0,30 Га арендованной земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). Толгонай решила развивать свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян картофеля для выращивания органических овощей. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Толгонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en: Tolgonai is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Tolgonai rears animals and grows crops as the main income for her family, having started her business six years ago. Thanks to her hard work, today Tolgonai has two cows and two horses. She grows potatoes for sale on 0.11 hectares of her own and 0.3 hectares of rented land. The monthly income is about 13,000 som (KGS). Tolgonai has decided to develop her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and potato seeds to grow organic vegetables. Tolgonai plans to invest the proceeds she receives from the business in further increasing the number of her livestock and saving up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to grow organic potatoes.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a meticulous, energetic, and hardworking woman of 41 years, living in the village of Chuakhola of Alipurduar district in West Bengal. She is residing with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Both are continuing their schooling.

The main source of income of Arati's husband is vegetable cultivation. He produces different types of vegetables like eggplants, cauliflower, cabbages, chilly, ladies' fingers (okra) etc., in his land with the help of Arati. 

She sadly expressed that their present monthly income is not at all sufficient to manage all their expenses and plan for future development. So she took a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. Now she and her husband have decided to cultivate bitter gourds which is a summer crop and very popular with regional people. 

From this loan, she will purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for bitter gourd cultivation. She is very positive that this loan must help her fulfill her dream of constructing a house and educating her children. She is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Veronidia

texts.en:
Veronidia is 45 years old and has seven children. Veronidia is married and has three children are currently in school.

Veronidia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronidia  requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Veronidia has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs and to save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Antonia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonia has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products of ready to wear to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец, лошадь. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). Салтанат  вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Салтанат развить ее бизнес, улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Saltanat successfully repaid her loan, and she is grateful to the Kiva Fund and to everyone who helped her in financing it. Thanks to her hard work, Saltanat now has two cows, five sheep, and a horse. Each day she sells organic milk. The monthly income is 14,000 som (KGS). Saltanat has applied once more to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. The proceeds of the loan will enable Saltanat to develop her business and to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Patriocinia

texts.en:
Patriocinia is 53 years old, widow and has three children. 

Patriocinia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Patriocinia requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Patriocinia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a widow with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vicenta is 48 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Vicenta has a gravel and sand business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional gravel and sand to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gravel and sand to sell and save for to send her children to college

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
31-year-old Mithu is an active and energetic rural woman. She lives in the village Parengerpar at Falakata with her husband and one son. She and her husband both have completed education up to grade 10. Her son is a student of grade 6.

Mithu is a responsible mother and housewife as well. Her husband Swapan runs a small business selling turmeric powder to local villagers and neighbors. With the assistance of his skilled and dedicated wife, he offers a quality-assured range of turmeric powder with good packaging at most affordable rates. They purchase turmeric fingers from the wholesale market and then send those to a nearby mill for grinding into fine powder. Turmeric serves as a key ingredient in most dishes and provides them with flavor and color. It is also used in medicines, foods, and dyeing processes. As per customer demand, Mithu wants to enhance her family-run business for more income. Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase turmeric fingers in bulk so that she can satisfy her customers and earn more profit.  

Mithu hopes this will help to improve her family’s well-being as well as financial condition. Her future dream is to expand the business for her son so that he is not affected by any hindrance.

She thanks her lenders, BJS, and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase turmeric fingers in bulk to enhance her existing business.

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Runa lives at a small village of Falakata in West Bengal. She is 29 years old, a hard-working mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is an illiterate homemaker, can sign her name only. Her husband's occupation is farming and he works hard to meet the family needs. Her daughter is studying in grade 8 and her son works as a mason.

Runa's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Runa also helps her husband in cultivation during busy seasons. The crops they grow are sold in the market and are their main source of income. The income generated by this agricultural business is almost all spent on household expenses and payment of other fees. 

Now they have decide to grow pointed gourd which is very popular as a summer crop. Runa wants to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the summer season. So she wants to buy the necessary farm supplies and applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. She will purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for pointed gourd cultivation. She hopes this will improve her family’s financial condition and she will be able to purchase more farmland in future with the profit generated by this cultivation.

Runa is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for pointed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en:
Raychenga is a small village in Alipurduar. This village is surrounded by hills and forest. It helps the villagers to cut and prepare plywood’s raw materials from the tender wood of the forest and sell it to the plywood manufacturing mills to earn their livelihood.

Sayra is an inhabitant of this village. She is a 25-year-old young lady surviving with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her children are studying in grades 1 and 4 respectively. She and her husband have received education up to grade 5 and were not able to study further.

The main source of income for Sayra's family is the business of supplying the raw materials for plywood manufacturing. Her husband purchases wood and cuts it into thin sheets and supplies it to the plywood manufacturing mills. All is done by him with the active support of Sayra. They have been doing this business for many years.

In spite of regular earnings, she is not able to improve her living conditions. So, she wants to overcome this situation by expanding the supply of raw materials; that is why she needs capital. So, Sayra has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS to purchase more wood and other necessary materials for running the business smoothly.

She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of giving a better life to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials of plywood for expanding their existing business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo has a piece of land in Tambulig. He is a farmer who plants a variety of commodities. For this cropping season, he focuses on rice farming. 

He has requested another loan to pay for land preparation. 

Domingo has big dreams for his children all to have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a 41-year-old married woman with three children who are presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cleofe has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

Cleofe requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and to purchase more materials for her business.

Cleofe has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Awa qui se trouve assit au premier rang sur la photo, elle tiens le drapeau de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de N'Tentoukoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Awa, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 15 à 25 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Awa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 27 ans. Awa cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, de terres cultivables et d'herbicides. Awa entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Awa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 25 ans que Awa cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Awa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Awa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Awa, who is sitting in the first row in the photo, holding the myAgro banner, is a member of a group of 10 farmers registered with myAgro who live and work in the village of N'Tentoukoro in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Awa is 40 years old and is the mother of seven children aged between 15 and 25, of whom two are presently in school. 

The anchor of family tradition in agriculture, principal source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, but also the love of agriculture itself, has caused Awa to practice agriculture for 27 years now. She grows peanuts and rice on her plot, but as a farmer she has to face difficulties such as lacking agricultural supplies, arable land, and herbicides. 

Awa is beginning her second year with myAgro and signed up again because of the system of payment and the perspective of being able to increase her yield using the services proposed by myAgro. This year Awa is making payments to buy a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to increase the yield on her plot of  0.125 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 25 years for their nutritional value, explaining that peanuts are directly edible for the family and are used as a base for sauces in cooking. 

With the growth of her yield and of her revenue, Awa plans to expand her arable land and buy farming supplies. Finally, Awa also hopes to cover school fees for her children as well as paying for their weddings.

loans.use: to buy herself a package of fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Nabanita

texts.en:
Nabanita is a young rural lady of 27 years. She is married and a responsible mother of one daughter. She lives in a small village, New Town, in Alipurduar with her family in their own semi-concrete house. She is a homemaker who looks after her family members and does household work.

Nabanita's husband is 33-year-old Sajal. He is the main earner for the family and generates all his income by driving a mini truck (locally known as Chhota Hathi) and has been providing transportation facilities in the rural area. He carries goods in his mini truck from one place to another. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

The mini truck requires proper maintenance and servicing regularly to keep it in its functional routine. Now the truck needs maintenance due to some damage. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, as it is the main income-generating source for their family. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing. Therefore, Nabanita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

With the help of this loan, Nabanita can afford the repair cost for her husband’s Chhota Hathi to provide better transport facilities so that he can earn a profitable income. Nabanita also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's future needs and set aside some money for her daughter's future education.

Nabanita is thanking BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to pay for the repair cost for the mini truck for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Marjina lives in a small village, Jogendrapur, in Falakata. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She has received education up to grade 6. Her daughter reads in college, and her son is associated with farming activities. She helps her family of four members by rearing cattle. Her children are her greatest motivation for whom she works tirelessly.

Marjina's husband works in a shop, which has no fixed income. This was the reason that Marjina started livestock breeding to provide her children with food, health, and education. She rears dairy cows and sells the milk in her locality. The money she earns is spent for the food expenses. Hence, she feels the need for a better income and thereby more savings, to stabilize her financial independence.

Thus she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow’s milk, and she believes her monthly income will increase. This will enable Marjina to have a secure and dignified life for her family and better education for her children.

She is thankful to the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 43 года, замужем, мать 5 детей, супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. У Гульмиры среднее образование, она  вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Гульмира на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 7 овец. На участке мерою 0,90 Га собственной и 13,30 Га арендованной земли она выращивает дыни, морковь, перец, хлопок, клевер и прочие экологически-чистые овощи для реализации. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян огурцов, для обработки почвы и выращивания органической продукции, часть средств Гульмира направит на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также хочет исполнить свою давнюю мечту- открыть швейный цех.
texts.en: Gulmira is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husband and children help her with her work. Gulmira has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops together with her husband, having started many years ago. Thanks to her hard work, today Gulmira has three cows and seven sheep. She grows melons, carrots, peppers, cotton, clover and other organic vegetables for sale on a plot of 0.9 hectares of her own and 13.3 hectares of rented land. Her monthly profit is around 19,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulmira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cucumber seeds and develop her land and grow organic produce, and Gulmira will direct part of the funds to buy some livestock. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business, and also wants to fulfill her long-standing dream of opening a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds, to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables, and to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming inputs

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 40 years old, a rural housewife living in a small village Chuakhola in Alipurduar district.  She is married and her husband cultivates different types of vegetables with her help. They have two sons who study in different grades in the local schools. 

Anjali and her husband work in the fields, planting seeds, applying fertilizer, weeding, and doing other tasks that are carried out to get a good harvest. They have no other source of income other than their agricultural business. They have progressed and managed to overcome the various problems that occur in their field such as price increase for the inputs they use, the instability of prices that allow them to buy and sell in the markets, crop diseases, and more. Now to diversify their agricultural business they want to grow teasel gourd which is a profitable crop.

Anjali is requesting a loan from BJS, Kiva’s partner, that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure. She believes that though this financial support they may improve the new crop this year. Anjali wants to expand their cultivable land with the profit from the business.

Anjali and her husband are hoping to be supported by lenders on the Kiva platform so that they can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is an energetic woman of 25 years. She lives in a small mud house with her family in a small village, Bada Sholmari, of Falakata. She is the mother of two sons, and they read in a local village school. Sabitri is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Sabitri's husband Bibeka is engaged in jute farming. This village has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers, making cultivation possible. They give their hard toil to grow good-quality products to satisfy their customers, and at the same time earn for the family.

They want to grow their agribusiness, but the main obstacle is capital. Sabitri has come to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them. She will invest this new loan in buying high-yield jute seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

She also wishes to increase her farm area. She hopes the profit generated from this business will help her be able to give a better living to her family, provide better education to her sons, and at the same time save money for the future to construct a concrete house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 4 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Huệ has a retail business selling scrap. She is applying for a loan to purchase scrap to resell. 

Huệ is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 4 Quảng Giao solidarity group. Huệ lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase scrap to resell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ASUNTA DE CALCA, la socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de artesanía como chompas, polos, sombreros y guantes, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas de alpaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the communal bank Virgen Asunta de Calca. She continues working in the business of selling handicrafts such as sweaters, shirts, hats, and gloves. She has been in this business for many years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to her work as this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy alpaca sweaters.

She is thankful for the loan and she promises to make her payments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Trung Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed fish to resell.

Thu is 26 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Trung Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members and she lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.
The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase processed fish to resell, so as to provide for her children and for the family to be healthy and happy

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a dried fish business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Nena requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish and other materials for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Mailene

texts.en:
Mailene is 25 years old and has one child with her partner. She works very hard to provide for them. Mailene operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Mailene requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, coffee, sugar, vinegar, beers, etc., to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, candies, coffee, sugar, vinegar, beers, etc.

loans.name: Deditha

texts.en:
Deditha is 48, a married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Deditha has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

Deditha has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials to help her business and to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a single woman with two children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 41 years old.

Jocelyn has a dried fish business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and to purchase materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and more materials for  her business and to hope to send her children to college

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old and has five children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies and to continue to send her children to school

loans.name: John Camilo

texts.es:
John Camilo un joven de 24 años de edad, que se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, siempre fue muy atraído por todo lo relacionado con la sala de belleza, pero no tuvo oportunidad de emplearse en alguna y la falta de capital no le permitía montar un negocio para trabajarlo. 
Esto fue la principal razón por la que John comenzó con la venta de cosméticos y producto de uso personal, ya que su objetivo era juntar capital e ir comprando los  insumos y herramientas que necesita para la peluquería.

Hablando un poco de la vida personal de John es un hombre soltero, vive con sus padres, en un barrio humilde, sus sueños son poder comprar una vivienda propia y en ella tener una sala de belleza, ser popular y consolidarse en el gremio de los estilistas.

John quiere solicitar un préstamo, esto ayudara a iniciar su tan anhelado sueño de tener un salón de belleza puesto que junto con el préstamo y unos ahorros comprara un silla para motilar, máquina de motilar, plancha para cabello, secador, rizador y el resto lo invertirá en tinturas, tratamientos, cuchillas, gel, etc.
texts.en:
John Camilo, a youth of 24 years of age, is currently dedicated to selling cosmetics. He was always very attracted to everything related to beauty salons. But he lacked the opportunity of being employed in one, plus he lacked the capital that would permit him to start his own salon to work in.

This was the principal reason why John began to sell cosmetics and personal use products. His objective was to gather capital and begin purchasing the equipment and tools he needed to start a barber shop. 

Speaking a little of his personal life, John is a single man who lives with his parents in a humble barrio. His dreams are to be able to purchase his own house and, in it, to have his beauty salon, and to become popular and join the guild of stylists.

John wishes to request a loan to help initiate his much desired dream of opening a beauty salon. With  the loan and some personal savings, he will purchase a hair-cutting chair, electric shears, a hair iron, a dryer, and a curling iron. The remainder of the money will be invested in hair coloring, hair treatments, scissors, gel, etc.

loans.use: fulfill his dream of having his own beauty salon; he wishes to buy a hair-cutting chair, electric shears, a hair iron, a dryer, and a curling iron.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 38-year-old lady who lives in a village at Alipurduar, West Bengal. She has two children (one daughter and one son). Both Pratima and her husband did not complete their secondary education due to financial problems.  But her first priority is to educate her children and so their children are pursuing a B.A (Bachelor in Arts) and an M.A (Master in Arts) respectively.

Pratima is a homemaker who looks after her children and manages her household jobs.   Her husband Pradip is an auto mechanic and has been running an auto repair business. He repairs three-wheeler auto rickshaws to meet the family’s expenses and sometimes sells auto spare parts also. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to invest in this business. Therefore, as a member of BJS, Pratima decided to help her husband and requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more modernized auto mechanic's tools and spare parts of good quality to satisfy the customers.   

In spite of the competitive market, this loan will help Pratima's husband to continue his business smoothly and fulfill his customers’ demand. She dreams of giving a quality education and a secure life to her children.

Pratima is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more auto spare parts and necessary tools for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas un sonriente hombre, trabajador innato del campo, padre de 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, vive junto a ellos y su pareja y se desempeña como agricultor, donde vende sus productos en el mercado.

El nacimiento de su negocio se remonta al año 1995, en una época que se encontraba sin empleo, pero con la ayuda de un amigo quien le explico conceptos básicos de la agricultura, tomo unas semillas, uso el patio de su casa y comenzó con su carrera como agricultor.

Hoy en día fue esas semillas que planto en el patio de su casa son las que le están generando el sustento para su familia, se ha ido ampliando y podría hacerlo aún más tiene un espacio pero le falta capital para aprovecharlo de la mejor manera.

Es por esta razón que Tomas quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abono y semillas. tú puedes apoyar a esta persona del campo, tu préstamo significara progreso para un agricultor que busca mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y convertirse en el principal proveedor de verduras de la plaza de mercado de momil.
texts.en:
Tomas, a smiling man, a natural hard-worker from the country, and the father of five children who are already adults, lives with them and with his wife. He works as a farmer, and he sells his products in the market.

The birth of his business dates back to the year 1995, to a time when he found himself without a job. But with the help of a friend who explained basic concepts of agriculture to him, he took some seeds, used the patio of his house, and began his career as a farmer.

Now, those seeds that he planted on the patio are the ones that are generating sustenance for his family. He has been expanding, and he will be able to do it even more. He has a space, but he lacks capital to take advantage of it in the best way.

It is for this reason that Tomas wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of compost and seeds. You can support Tomas' project. Your loan will mean progress for a farmer who seeks to improve the living conditions of his family and become the principal provider of vegetables in the market plaza of Momil.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost and to extend his plantings

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
43-year-old Anita is an adept seamstress from Millroad, a small village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal.  She is married and a mother of one son who is a student of grade 1. She sews blouses, trousers, shirts, frocks which require a great deal of skill to cut and sew, so they are a perfect fit for her customers. She also stitches sari petticoats and pretty dresses for local women and their little daughters, who are satisfied customers and contribute to the success of her sewing micro-enterprise. 

A diligent housekeeper, she manages to pay for their living expenses, her son's schooling, and to buy raw materials like thread, buttons, etc. for her micro-enterprise with their monthly income. She needs to ensure there are more savings for her son's future. She also wants to set aside enough to deal with medical expenses. She wants to grow the capacity of her sewing business. To begin with, she needs to buy a new sewing machine, which will help her improve productivity and take on more sewing orders both from local women and small retail customers. 

To access the funds to buy this new sewing machine, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan will help Anita to take the necessary steps and realize the full earning potential of her micro-enterprise. 

She is grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To buy a better quality sewing machine and improve the output of her sewing microenterprise.

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma is a 31-year-old rural, married woman and the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Amongst them, two go to a nearby village school, and the other works as a mason with his father. She lives with her family in a small village, Dalimpur, in Falakata of Alipurduar district.

Her husband Haripada is a mason by profession, engaged with a business of centering works on houses. Centering is a temporary structure upon which bamboo, rods, and planks are laid during construction.

Ruma is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She is active and energetic to go ahead and can overcome all the financial hurdles. Now she needs to expand the family business in order to strengthen the family's economic condition. Her husband wants to buy some wood, tools, and iron accessories for this business. So, Ruma has decided to help her husband and has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva'spartner).

With the help of the loan, Ruma will be able to contribute in buying all the necessary raw materials for the foundations of many rural houses. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and increase her family’s financial status.

Ruma is thankful to BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials for her husband's centering business.

loans.name: Aleides Del Carmen

texts.es:
Siempre sonriente, muy entusiasta, con el ánimo de llenar estómagos sale a trabajar la señora Aleides, ella se siente feliz realizando está actividad donde prepara almuerzos porque sabe que con los ingresos ha ayudado a mejorar considerablemente la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su esposo y dos hijas.

Aleides busca apoyo para seguir aportando crecimiento al hogar, con el impulso económica comprara utensilios e insumos para la preparaciones de  bandeja paisa, sancocho, sancocho de pescado y sudado.
texts.en:
Always smiling and enthusiastic, Aleides goes out to work with the goal of filling stomachs. She feels happy doing this work where she makes lunches because she knows that the income from her work has helped her to improve her family’s quality of life considerably. Her family consists of her husband and her two daughters.

Aleides is looking for support so she can continue helping her family. She will use the finances to buy utensils and supplies for making bandeja paisa (large platter of several types of food), soups, fish soup, and stew.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and supplies for making traditional Colombian dishes, such as platters, soups, and stews

loans.name: Kelly Natalia

texts.es:
Kelly es una mujer joven cabeza de familia, tiene 26 años de edad y su mayor preocupación es generar el sustento para sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, se separó de su esposo por ciertos inconvenientes pero con su negocio de cría de ganado porcino y lechones supo suplir esa ausencia por lo menos monetariamente.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y guerrera todo lo que tiene lo ha logrado por méritos propios nadie le ha regalado nada, pero agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron a ser lo que es y a consolidar su negocio pues gracias a ellos tiene una manera de vivir.

Kelly quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de lechones, pollos y cuidado para alimentarlos y engordarlos, el préstamo le permitirá abastecer sus cocheras que como ven en la foto se encuentra vacías ya que vendió lo que tenía, el dinero que gana en el negocio  lo destina a mejoras locativas, a su familia y a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y sean siempre felices y desde lo personal, ser lo suficiente como madre y padre que le toca ejercer para darles una buena educación a sus hijos
texts.en:
Kelly is a young female householder, 26 years old, and her main concern is to generate support for her two children, 6 and 4 years old. She separated from her husband because of certain problems but she found a way to replace that absence at least momentarily with her business of raising pigs and piglets. 

She is a fighter and a very hard-working woman. Everything that she has, she has achieved on her own. Nobody has gifted her anything, but she thanks everyone who has helped her to be who she is and to strengthen her business because thanks to them, she has a way of life. 

Kelly wants to ask for a loan to buy pigs, chickens and food to feed them and fatten them. The loan will allow her to supply her chicken coops, as you can see in the picture they appear to be empty since she already sold what she had. The money that she earns in the business goes towards making improvements, to her family, and to improving her living conditions. 

Her dream is to continue growing in her business, that her children go to school and are always happy, and from a personal standpoint, to be enough as mother and father that is up to her to act as to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to supply her business with pigs, chickens and feed for her animals. She is head of household.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is an energetic and hardworking woman of 34 years. She has a primary education up to grade 5. She is the mother of 2 children who are students in grades 10 and 3.  Rita lives in the small village of Sobhagunj in Alipurduar.

Rita's husband, 35-year-old Ajit, is runnig a small tea stall.  His inadequate income is insufficient for the family.  Rita always strives to provide her children with all things necessary for daily life. She dreams that her children will receive a higher education.

Rita is associated with a clothing business. She purchases varieties of ladies garments, mainly sarees from the wholesale market and sells them in her locality. Saree is an Indian traditional dress. She sells other clothing also like petticoats, blouses, readymade garments as per seasonal demand. She has been working with this business for many years and has long experience in this area of business.  Now with the growing demand of her valuable customers, she would like to expand her business. She would like to restore her collection of clothing and with this aim she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more women's clothing according to seasonal demand. In festival seasons she needs more stock of clothing to satisfy her customers. 

She hopes the expansion of business will earn more profit to provide her family with good financial sustenance.  She wants to get ahead with the business for a secured future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a water pump, a fumigation pump, galvanized wire, barbed wire, manure, seeds, and other items

loans.name: 03.01.02 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Phượng is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling sweet rice, which she has been doing for eight years. The main hardship Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Phượng is the group leader of the 03.01.02 Quảng Hưng Group, which consists of three members. She is requesting her sixth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase more sticky rice and peanuts to cook. In 2008, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa to improve her  business. With her business profit, she hopes that her family is healthy and happy, her business does well, and her children do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more sticky rice and peanuts to cook

loans.name: Thôn Điền 19 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung has a retail business selling dry foods. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell.

Nhung is 59 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Thôn Điền 19 - Quảng Nham solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, cake, sweets, sugar,  to resell. She wants to build a new house.

loans.name: Hector Alonso

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven de 22 años de edad, soltero y con muchas ganas de trabajar, él tiene un cultivo que trabaja, es de su padre pero se lo está pagando por cuotas, su propósito es trabajar muy duro para finalizar de comprar el terreno y construir una finca, su gran sueño, desde muy pequeño ha estado involucrado en las labores del campo trabajando siempre de la mano de su padre, ya que es un mayor de edad se independizo, pero busca estar siempre cerca de ellos.

Su principal dificultad para realizar su negocio son los altos costos de insumos, en el momento no cuenta con capital para asumirlo ya que tiene otras obligaciones, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la comprar de bombillas y semillas para expandir cultivos.

El propósito de este préstamo es expandir sus cultivos y tener una buena iluminación.
texts.en:
Héctor is a single 22 year old with a lot of desire to work. He has land he grows on that is his father's that he is paying for by installments. His goal is to work very hard to finish buying the land. His great dream, since he was young, was to be involved in the labors of the field working hand in hand with his father. As he is now an adult he has gone out on his own but he always looks to be close to his parents.

His main problem in carrying out his business is the high cost of inputs. At the moment he does not have the capital to pay for them as he has other obligations. So he is requesting a loan to invest in buying light bulbs and seeds to expand his crops. The purpose of this loan is to expand his crops and have good lighting.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs and seeds to light up and expand his crops.

loans.name: Walter De Jesus

texts.es:
Con un firme propósito de comprar casa inicio el señor Walter en el año 2007 su negocio de cultivo de flores, una actividad que aprendió trabajando en otros cultivos y que sin experiencia alguna como empresario decidió emprender, porque tenía hambre de gloria, de progresar, de ser alguien, de demostrar todas las cualidad que tenía, hoy en día tiene 25 años de edad, un buen campo y el tema de casa va por buen camino, está algo lejos de lograrlo pero al idea sigue muy firme.

Es padre de un hijo de 3 años y una pequeña de 10 meses de edad son su motor de vida, sus sonrisas, sus gestos, todo esto es esencial para la felicidad de él, pues dice que la mayor bendición que pudo obtener es al de ser padre.

Pensando y anticipando a los perjuicios del cambio climático Walter quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra bombillos, riegos y semillas, los bombillos será para mantener la temperatura ideal en la que se deben tener las flores, los demás son insumos para la plantación y mantenimiento de cultivo.
texts.en:
With a firm goal of buying a house Walter began growing flowers in 2007. He learned this activity working with other crops and with no experience whatsoever as a businessperson he decided to start. He was hungry for glory to progress, to be someone and demonstrate his qualities.

Today he is 25 years old, with good fields and the house theme is going strong. He is somewhat distant from achieving it but the idea is still firm. He is the father of a 3 year old son and a 10 month old daughter who are their driving force in his life. Their smiles, their gestures are the essence of happiness for him. Thus he says the greatest blessing is being a father.

Thinking about and anticipating damage from climate change Walter wants to request a loan to buy light bulbs, irrigation supplies and seeds. The lights are to maintain an ideal temperature that the flowers need and the other supplies are for his plantation and to maintain his crops.

loans.use: to invest in light bulbs, manure and irrigation supplies for his plantation and to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Frenalyn

texts.en:
Frenalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Frenalyn is 45 years old and has two children still in school.

Frenalyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Frenalyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business..

Frenalyn has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business and to save for her children's advanced education

loans.name: Anilda Alcida

texts.es:
Anilda es una mujer de 43 años de edad, ella vive junto con su esposo con el cual tiene dos hijos adolescentes, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona muy amigable, amorosa, servicial,  siempre había sido ama de casa, ella atendía su pareja e hijos, el tiempo paso y ahora ellos están grandes, tienen deseos, sueños, quieren salir del campo, estudiar, profesionalizarse y devolverles a sus padres todo lo que han hecho por ellos.

Pensando en este humilde y hermoso sueño Anilda quiere ser de ayuda para sus hijos y junto con su esposo se comprometió a cumplir este sueño por ello realizaron un pacto el esposo pagara la matrícula de los muchachos y Anilda se encargara de mantenerlos mientras encuentra un trabajo, y una vez lo encuentre mandarles ropa, alimento o dinero para apoyarlos.

Para realizar este sueño Anilda quiere convertirse en  emprendedora, tener un negocio, ser exitosa y cumplir su parte del pacto, por ello solicita un préstamo para iniciar su negocio de gallinas ponedoras, que en otras palabras será venta de  huevos, con el dinero comprara 50 gallinas y construirá bebederos para ellas.
texts.en:
Anilda is a 43 year old woman. She lives with her husband, with whom she has two teenage children. She is known to be a very friendly, loving, helpful person. She has always been a housewife, taking care of her husband and children. Time passed and they are now grown. 
They have wishes and dreams: they want to leave the countryside, study, become professionals and give back to their parents all they have done for them. Thinking about this humble and beautiful dream, Anilda wants to help her children. 
Together with her husband she promised to fulfill this dream, so they made a deal where the husband will pay for their sons' tuition and Anilda will take care of supporting them while she finds a job. Once she finds it, she will send them clothes, food or money to support them. Her husband asked her how she was planning to do this. With a smile on her face, she answered: "I will become a businesswoman. I will have a business, I will be successful and fulfill my promise". For this reason, she is requesting a loan to start her business of laying hens, which in other words will be the sale of eggs. With the money she will buy 50 hens and will build water troughs for them.

loans.use: to start a business of laying hens and sell eggs.

loans.name: Denis Isabel

texts.es:
Denis es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en la vereda del Congo, ella es una persona humilde, con conocimientos empíricos de la cría de aves, esta profesión es la que ha ejercido a lo largo de su vida, está actividad la inicio por necesidad económica ya que en su familia escaseaban los recursos.

Ella quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, ser competitiva, vender mucho ser una gran empresaria ella tiene esa meta y la describe con rabia ya que le dolió la situación que pasaron en algún momento y gracias a su negocio ha ido mejorando y su calidad de vida junto a la de su familia se encuentra estable.

En este momento ella está muy feliz y alegre ya que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprara pollos y alimentos de engorde.
texts.en:
Denis is a 40 year-old-woman who lives with her husband and their four children in the village of Congo. She is a humble person with an extensive knowledge of raising birds. She has been in this profession her whole life, and she started this business out of economic necessity as her family was lacking resources. 

She wants to improve her sales, increase her customers, be competitive and sell a lot to be a great entrepreneur. She has this goal and describes it with a vengeance because there was a situation in the past that hurt her and thanks to her business she has improved – and her family and quality of life are now stable. 

Currently, she is very happy because she is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy chickens and feed for fattening.

loans.use: to invest in her business and buy chickens and feed for fattening.

loans.name: Ingri Paola

texts.es:
Ingri es tan solo una joven de 22 años de edad, ella reside en el retiro una zona rural, vive junto con su pareja con la cual tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, su pareja trabaja en el campo, pero ella no quería esto para su vida, no le gusto la agricultura ni la crianza de animales por ello busco la manera de generar recursos, ahorro capital y viajo hasta Medellín para lograr su cometido y hoy en día es la profesión que realiza. 

Ingri es un ejemplo de persona, ella humilde pero no se resignó a realizar una profesión que fuera en contra de sus principios, ella vende productos como dulces, chocolates, accesorios, cosméticos, pijamas, ropa para mujer, hombre y niña, lociones y productos para el hogar todos por encargo.

La perseverancia ha sido fundamental para sobrevivir en este negocio, ya que vender a personas del campo es complicado, su deseo de tener un local y pagar la educación de sus hijos es la que la hace levantar todas las mañanas a trabajar.

Ingri quiere solicitar un préstamo, para pagar un pedido de productos que tiene actualmente, la razón es que ella ofrece comodidad de pagos, pero algunos clientes retrasados en los pagos tampoco le ayudan por lo que su última opción es refugiarse en un préstamo y con este apoyaras a una empresaria del campo a seguir realizando la profesión que la hace feliz y con la que apoya en la mejora de calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Ingri is only 22 years old.  She lives in a rural area with her partner.  They have a 3 year old daughter. Her partner works in the fields but she did not want that life.  She didn't like agriculture or raising animals so she looked for a way to generate income.  She saved money and traveled to Medellín to complete her commission and today it is the profession she works in.

Ingri is an exemplary person. She is humble but not resigned to working in a profession that goes against her principles. She sells products such as candies, chocolates, accessories, cosmetics, lotions, household products, pajamas and clothing for women, men and children which she orders. Her perseverance has been fundamental to her survival in this business as selling to rural people is complicated. Her desire to have a place and pay for her children's education is what gets her up to work every morning.

Ingri would like a loan to pay for a current order of products. The reason is that she offers the convenience of payments but some clients are behind on their payments and that's not helping.  Her last option is to fall back on a loan.
