With it you will be helping a rural businesswoman to continue working in the profession that makes her happy and help her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for an order of candy, chocolates, accessories, cosmetics, lotions, household products, pajamas and clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, sus tres hijos y un nieto; su nieto aún estudia y tiene 13 años de edad.

Adela, tiene una lancha para pescar, con lo cual mantiene a su familia, ella vende pescado.

Adela, está solicitando el crédito para comprar dos redes para pescar, porque las que tenía ya no dan abasto.

El sueño de Adela, es poder darles una buena educación a su hijo y a su nieto para que logren graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Adela is 45 years old.  She lives with her husband, her three children and one grandchild.  Her grandson is 13 years old and still in school.

Adela has a fishing boat that belongs to her family. She sells fish. She is applying for a loan to buy 2 fishing nets, because the ones that she has now aren't providing her with her catch anymore.  

Adela's dream is to provide her son and grandson with a good education so that they can graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to buy two nets for fishing

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Teresa una residente de la zona de Sincelejo una zona donde La corporación Interactuar está incursionando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta zona que es considera humilde y escasa de recursos.
Teresa es madre de 5 hijos 4 hijas adolescentes y un hombre de 14 años de edad, en su hogar nunca se les había pasado por la cabeza poder pagar una educación universitaria ya que el presupuesto no les alcanzaba, pero con la ayuda de su negocio ha podido mejorar considerablemente las condiciones de vida de su familia y darles esperanzas, se dedica a la venta de su helados, Sincelejo es una zona calurosa y los clientes han aceptado el negocio de muy buena manera, paralelo a helados vende frituras de papas en bolsa.

Al ver que sus ventas están creciendo Teresa encuentra una muy buena oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y hacer que este crezca, la falta de capital es su principal impedimento por ello acude a un apoyo crediticio con la intención de comprar surtido de sabores de helados, paletas, y frituras de papas en bolsa, tu préstamo ayudara a una empresaria a mejorar sus ingresos y creer en que puede pagar la educación universitaria de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This is Teresa, a resident of the city of Sincelejo, which is an area where the institution Interactuar is making an effort to improve the quality of life. This area is considered to be humble and to have scarce resources. 

Teresa is the mother of 5 children: 4 teenage daughters and a 14-year-old son. She and her family have never thought about paying for university educations, since the cost is completely out of their budget. However, with the help that she has requested, she will be able to improve her living conditions, and give her family hope. She has an ice cream shop. Sincelejo is a hot area, and customers have accepted her business very well. In addition to ice cream, she sells bags of fried potatoes.

Seeing that her sales are increasing, Teresa has found a very good opportunity to invest in her business and to ensure that it continues to grow. A lack of capital is her main obstacle. For this reason, she is requesting help through a loan, which she will use to buy an assortment of ice cream flavors, popsicles, and bags of fried potatoes. Your loan will help a businesswoman to improve her income and to believe that she can pay for her children's university educations.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of ice cream flavors, popsicles, and bags of fried potatoes.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Lina es una mujer de 37 años de edad cuyo sueño está iniciando.
Crear una empresa siempre ha sido su ambición, gran parte de su vida al desarrollo como trabajadora en empresas de confección gracias a esos trabajos no solo pudo generar el sustento para su familia que ahora la conforman dos hijos menores de edad sino que también adquirió mucha experiencia y aprendizaje del tema.

Lina se encuentra solicitando formalmente un préstamo para iniciar su propio taller de confección, necesita el apoyo para comprar toda la maquinaria e insumos que se pueden ver en la foto, quiera aprovechar esta oportunidad y tratar de buscar su sueño.

Con su empresa se trazó unos objetivos a corto plazo que es mejorar sus ingresos y generar empleo, ya si todo marcha bien y su negocio tiene éxito en un futuro comprar una vivienda.

El monto del préstamo es a razón de que no cuenta con un ahorro pero se cansó de ser empleada y busca por todos los medios posibles montar su negocio, apóyala, se testigo de la construcción de una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Lina is 37 year old woman whose dream is beginning. To start a business has always been her ambition and for a large part of her life she has developed her skills in manufacturing businesses.  Thanks to these businesses she was not only able to earn income for her family, which is now made up of two young children, but also gained a lot of experience and knowledge. 

Lina is formally applying for a loan in order to start her own tailoring workshop.  She needs help to buy all the equipment and supplies that can be seen in the photo. She wants to take advantage of this opportunity and try to achieve her dream.

She has set the short term business objectives of improving her income and  generating work.  If everything goes according to plan and the business is successful she would like to buy a home in the future.

The size of the loan is due to the fact that she has no savings. She is tired of being an employee and is looking at all the possible options in order to start her business. Support her and witness the building of a great business.

loans.use: to start her own tailoring workshop and buy a tabletop sewing machine, overlock sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema is a 25-year-old woman. She is married with two children (one son and one daughter). She and her husband are raising their children. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Alema gives financial support to her family by rearing cows.

She rears dairy cows and sells the milk in her locality.  She, hence, feels the need to have a better income and thereby higher savings, to stabilize her financial condition.

She applied to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow milk and she believes her monthly income will increase through this purchase. The loan will enable Alema and her family to have a secure and dignified life and the best education for her children.

She is thankful to the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Emely Pamela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Emely, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y está embarazada de su primer bebé. El marido es maestro albañil. 
Doña Emely se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi  todos los días a realizar sus recorridos, no tiene horario fijos para salir aunque prefiere salir  en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que ella les da muchas facilidades de pagos a sus clientes, ya son 3 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones y ropa de niños. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Credito Dinamicas y Talentosas (Credit Group of the Dynamic and Talented) meets every fifteen days in the San Pedro neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which attract visitors throughout the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 
Emely sells all types of clothing door-to-door. She goes out almost every day to make her rounds, she does not have a fixed schedule although she prefers to go out in the morning since she gets better results at that time. She has very good sales because she offers her customers many easy payment options. She has been working at this business for three years, which helps out her husband, since he does not earn very much at his job. 
This loan will be used for buying shirts, pants and children's clothing. She has been in the Grupo de Credito for two years, and she likes it because she stocks her business with the loans. her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 31, a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school.. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur

Lorena has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials to her business..

Lorena has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials to her business and to save for her children's education

loans.name: Jymy Jose

texts.es:
El progreso e un hombre emprendedor se logra ver en la historia de Jymy, un joven de 27 años, que hace no más de un año estaba vendiendo en las calles de forma ambulante accesorios para celulares y que ahora tiene su propio espacio estable para comercializar sus productos y agregar nuevos. Él cuenta que este avance lo pudo lograr gracias a un préstamo anterior, con el cual pudo comprar mercadería variada para celulares y pudo aumentar sus ingresos para estar donde está ahora. Por eso agradece a todas las personas que lo apoyaron con ese préstamo. 
Ahora el tramo de Jymy cumple más de dos años en el mercado, por eso siente que necesita seguir invirtiendo para seguir avanzando. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar protectores de celulares, audífonos, calcomanías, baterías, controles de televisión, como nueva venta, entre otros accesorios tecnológicos y para celulares. Con esto podrá seguir ofreciendo productos de calidad y variados para salir adelante con su negocio y ampliarlo como tanto lo desea.
texts.en:
The progress of an entrepreneurial man can be seen in Jymy's story, a young man of 27 who less than a year ago was selling mobile phone accessories on the streets as a peddler, but who now has his own stable space to market his products and add new ones to his inventory.

He says that this breakthrough was all due to his previous loan, with which he was able to buy varied merchandise for mobile phones and increase his income to reach the point at where he is right now. It is for this reason that he thanks all the people who supported him with that previous loan.

Now, Jymy's stand has been over 2 years in the market, and this is why he feels he needs to continue investing so that he can continue advancing. For this reason, he requests a loan so that he may buy mobile phone cases, earphones, stickers, batteries, T.V. remote controls (as a new addition to his inventory), among other mobile phone and technology accessories.

With this loan, he would be able to continue offering a variety of quality products so that he can get ahead with his business and expand it as much as he would like to.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cases, earphones, stickers, batteries, T.V. remote controls, among other things

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran ese grupo, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren un futuro mejor, es por ello que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maricel, quien se dedica a la venta de Ropas, debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere mejorar y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Seventeen women make up this group. They are very hardworking women who want a better future. This is why they have come together to be able to help their families.  The work of Fundación Paraguaya must be emphasized: they perform ongoing follow-ups on training and check-ups.

One of the members is Maricel, who makes her living selling clothing. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to improve and get ahead to be able to help her family. 

She's requesting this loan for the purchase of assorted articles of clothing so that she can continue with her sales the way she has been doing. She's thankful for this opportunity, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy various garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to replace the roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a rice retailer and has a stall at the market. She takes pride in both her business and her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

Elsie is thankful that all her capitalization has been supported by PMPC. She has taken a loan to buy sacks of rice to resell. 

Elsie deeply wishes to open another stall so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Herme

texts.en:
Herme is 28 years old, and she is married with 3 children who all attend school.

Herme is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Herme has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Herme would like to save enough money to be able to both expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Adalberto Gerberth

texts.es:
Adalberto es un joven de 26 años, nació en la ciudad de La Paz, es el mayor de cuatro hijos, él comenta que desde los 15 años ayudo a su papá en trabajos de fontanería y albañilería, dos años más adelante su papá al ver que los ingresos que percibía ya no alcanzaban para los gastos del hogar decidió salir del país para encontrar un mejor trabajo sin embargo nunca más se comunicó, dejándolos desamparados, por lo que su madre se hizo cargo del sustento de toda la familia. Adalberto con mucho esfuerzo y empeño logró obtener su bachillerato, posteriormente gracias a sus convicciones, salió del país como misionero de la iglesia, la cual según menciona fue una experiencia que marcó su vida; al retornar al país decidió casarse e ingresar a la universidad. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería Petrolera por lo que solicita un crédito educativo. Adalberto menciona que al concluir sus estudios, contará con las herramientas necesarias para enfrentar un mercado laboral competitivo, y tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Su sueño es ser el mejor profesional de su área.  
Adalberto agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán seguir estudiando y cumplir sus sueños de superación.
texts.en: Adalberto is a 26 year old young man. He was born in the city of La Paz. He is the oldest of four children. He comments that since he was 15 years old he helped his father in plumbing and masonry jobs. Two years later, his father, seeing that the income he was earning was not enough for household expenses, decided to leave the country to find a better job. However, he never contacted them again and left them on their own, so that his mother was left to support the whole family. With great effort and hard work, Adalberto obtained his high school degree. Later, thanks to his convictions, he left the country as a missionary of the church. He comments that his was an experience that marked him for life. When he returned he decided to get married and enter college. Currently, he is studying his last year of the career of Petroleum Engineering, for what he is requesting an educational loan. Adalberto mentions that after finishing his studies, he will have the necessary tools to face the competitive labor market and will have an opportunity to improve his quality of life and that of his family. His dream is to be the best professional in his area. Adalberto is grateful to the people who, through his financial resources, will allow him to keep on studying his dreams of progress.

loans.use: to pay for the career of Petroleum Engineering.

loans.name: Edgarson

texts.en:
Edgarson is a farmer from Tambulig. He has a piece of land that he cultivate producing rice. He has been in this business for almost a decade. As a father of 2, he wants to provide well for their needs. 

He is getting ready for the next cropping season. He accessed a loan to pay labor costs on plowing and leveling of dikes. He deeply wishes to see all his children earn their diploma and have stable careers. With that coming, Edgarson has fulfilled his dreams.

loans.use: to pay labor costs on plowing and leveling of dikes to prepare for the new season

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 42 years old and has a live-in partner with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Teresa has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester busies her time managing her farm in Molave. She is a mother of 2, both in school. Ester has availed her 4th loan to pay for land preparation. She wants to have higher yield so that she can save more for her children.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation for the new season

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Violita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Violita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Violita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old with five children.  

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 21 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Neolita

texts.en:
Neolita is 50 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Neolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Neolita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Neolita has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Neolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs and to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Petronila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Petronila is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her fishing/fish vending business.

Petronila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nhóm 9 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Ly is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture raising cattle.

Ly is 59 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 9 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Ly joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Ly has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ly hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future, for the well being of her family

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Milagros has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Milagros has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business and so she can send her children to college

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and has a live-in partner with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maribel is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maribel has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her pigs to be able to afford to send her children to college

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods and personal care products.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like a food-vending business.

Angela dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a market stall in which she sells rice. She has requested a loan to restock bags of rice to sell. 

Nancy hopes to sustain her business and hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of inventories.

loans.use: to restock bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Phoebe has a candy-making business in the Philippines. Phoebe requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

Phoebe has been in this business for four years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 8 años de edad, todos están estudiando.

Sonia, trabaja en la agricultura y se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde muy pequeña, cuando aprendió con sus padres; además cuida unos terneros y vacas que posee.- Los cultivos  los tienen a una distancia de 60 metros y llegan hasta ahí caminando, sus hijos cuando no están en la escuela les ayudan a cuidar  de los cultivos y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. para después ir a hacer los quehaceres del hogar.

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar doce sacos de fertilizante, también foleares y pagar para que preparen el terreno para sembrar.

Su sueño es tener un terreno para cultivar y poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Sonia, 42 years old, studied until high school. Due to a lack of resources, she was not able to continue studying. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. She has three children, 18, 15, and 8 years old, all of whom are in school.

Sonia works in agriculture, and has since a very young age, when she learned from her parents. She also takes care of some calves and cows that she has.

Her crops are about 60 meters away, and they get there by walking. When her children are not in school, they help them tend to the crops. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., so that she can do the housekeeping afterwards.

Sonia needs the loan to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and also foliar fertilizers, and to pay for her land to be prepared for planting.

Her dream is to have land to farm and to be able to get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and also foliar fertilizers, and to pay for the land to be prepared for planting.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is a 25-year-old married mother of two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cristine has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Cristine requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her-food vending business.

Cristine has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Garelou

texts.en: Garelou is 26 years old from Molave. She has found opening a sari-sari (variety) store interesting and challenging. She takes care of her business to support her parents who are elderly. Garelou has taken out a loan to purchase additional inventory for her business. She wants to restock items like soap, canned goods, milk and sugar. In the future, she wants to open a bigger space to accommodate her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: 0109 0001Thôn 4 _ Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Mrs Uyên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Uyên is 53 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 0109 0001Thôn 4 _ Hoằng Đôngg solidarity group. 
Uyên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Uyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Uyên has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Uyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Uyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future and to help her children do well in school

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Al is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Al has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Al requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Al has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Al would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and save to build a house for her family

loans.name: Joevel

texts.en:
Joevel is a 44-year-old married mother of seven children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Joevel has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Joevel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Joevel has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a Married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 36 years old and has two children still in school.

Lorna has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business..

Lorna has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials to her business and also save enough to send her children to college.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fe Maura

texts.en:
Fe Maura is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Fe Maura has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Fe Maura requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal care products to sell.

Fe Maura has been in this business for two years. In the future, Fe Maura would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old, married and has four children who are all in school.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luzviminda has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hector Alirio

texts.es: A  sus 35 años de edad Alirio esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, Alirio  se dedica a la elaboracion de ventanas, puertas, rejas y mas objetos de hierro, en su  puesto tambien arregla carros y los pinta. Alirio tiene 3 hijos que estan en las edades de 4,6 y 13 año mismos que estan estudiando. Alirio se gana la vida mediante su negocio y comenta que le gusta cantar y que hay personas que le contratan para que cante en localidades de su pueblo y es asi como se gana un dinero extra. Alirio crecio con su madre y sus 4 hermanos y siempre con limitaciones economicas. Alirio solicita el dinero del credito para comprar hierro, pintura y otros accesorios para realizar su trabajo y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Alirio tiene la aspiracion de comprar material,  mejorar su negocio y de este modo obtener mas ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 35 years of age, Alirio is married and has 3 children. He works making windows, doors, bars, and other iron objects. He also fixes and paints cars.

Alirio has 3 children who are 4, 6, and 13 years old, and all of whom are in school. Alirio makes his living with his business. He says that he likes to sing, and that people will hire him to sing in different places in his town, so he earns a little extra money this way.

Alirio grew up with his mother and 4 siblings, and always had financial constraints.

Alirio is applying for the loan to buy iron, paint, and other accessories to be able to do his work and give his customers good service.

Alirio's goal is to buy materials, improve his business, and in this way, earn more money to improve his children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: 03.08.04 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hướng works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Hướng is 47 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Hướng is the group leader of the 03.08.04 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hướng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Hướng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hướng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hướng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future and to provide the capital needed for her business

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is 46 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, Ma. Nita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Ma. Nita has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha and wife (both in the picture standing in front of their house) are farmers with 2 children.  They live in Taing Khsach village, that is far from the power grid. Expanding their business and making their family living in comfortable conditions is always their goal. 

However, they are facing some problems because of the remote area. Their house has no reliable energy source. They have to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage, which reduces their working time and money. Sometime because of busyness Sokha doesn’t have time to charge the battery, the whole family is in a pitch black condition for the whole day. 

Seeing the difficulty, Sokha found out that solar home system is a clean and reliable energy sources that can help reduce time and utility fee. As a result, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality home solar energy panel. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system which will save time and money for the family

location.town: Taing Khsach Village, Kbal Toek Commune, Toek Phos

loans.name: Sergio Andres

texts.es:
Sergio es un joven de 26 años de edad, que con un deseo y una determinación inquebrantable de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ofrecer a su pareja y a su hija de 5 años de edad la mejor calidad de vida que este a su alcance, inicio con un negocio de venta frutas informal, vendiendo en unidades o paquetes a gente que pasaba del barrio, pero las ventas apenas si alcanzaban para pagar lo más elemental, por ello salió y miró la manera de ganar contratos, llego a varias legumbreras, tiendas, almacenes y consiguió contratos y desde entonces vende en cantidades algo que cambio su vida drásticamente, ya que vendía por cantidades y generaba buena utilidad.

Ahora Sergio cuenta con un local y dos empleados y quiere seguir por ese camino buscando mas contratos, quiere expandir su local y lograr que su negocio se transforme en una plaza de frutas.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de frutas en cantidades, principalmente papaya, limones, sandia, aguacates y mangos, que son sus productos estrellas.

Tú puedes apoyar un empresario que con conocimientos empíricos pero con muchas ganas de progresar montó un negocio y ha sido tanto el empeño que coloca en este que ya cuenta con dos empleados y espera seguir generando muchos más empleos.
texts.en:
Sergio is a young man aged 26, whose dream and unswerving determination to improve his living conditions and offer his  partner and 5 years old daughter a better quality of life than was in their reach, set up an informal fruit business, selling units or packets to local people. However, he hardly sold enough to pay for the basics, which is why he went out and found out how to win contracts. He visited various greengrocers, shops and stores, and won contracts. Since then, he has sold large quantities. This changed his life drastically, as he sold in large quantities and made a good profit.

Sergio now has a premises and employs two people. He wants to continue down this road, seeking more contracts, and to expand his premises and transform his business into a fruit market.

Sergio is requesting a loan to buy large amounts of fruit, including papaya, lemons, watermelon, avocados and mangos, which are his star products.

You can support an entrepreneur who, with empirical knowledge but a great desire to progress, set up a business. He puts a great deal of effort into this and has two employees. He hopes to continue creating many more jobs.

loans.use: to buy large amounts of fruit to distribute to his sales channels, including watermelon, mangos and papaya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and re-bar to finish constructing the wall of her house.

loans.name: Jinnie

texts.en:
Jinnie is 37 years old and is married. She is known in their area for her direct-selling business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the PMPC offers. 

She hopes to expand her resources, for which reason she applied for a loan to pay for more stock to sell. She wants to restock cosmetics, food supplements, bath soap and shampoo to sell. 

Jinnie hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. 

She is very thankful when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to restock cosmetics, food supplements, bath soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles and other groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Nancy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to continue sending her children to school

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, noodles and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle passenger in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Adelaida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle and so that she can continue to send her children to school

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is single and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Maylyn has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 24 años es comerciante de calzado para damas exclusivamente, negocio que inició desde el año 2005, por la necesidad de genera ingresos y las pocas posibilidades de trabajo existentes en ese momento. Al iniciar, un amigo suyo le recomendó a una mujer propietaria de una zapatería  y desde ese momento establecieron relaciones comerciales que apoyaron su incursión en el mercado. Él trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 4 de la tarde diariamente, vendiendo a crédito y de contado entre su clientela, conformada por empleados, referidos y vecinos, mientras compra a  mayoristas y almacenes especializados con los que obtiene precios especiales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   calzado clásicos y deportivos con lo cual tendrá más inventarios que impacten la decisión de compra de su clientela, para ganar un poco más y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jorge, 24 years old, is a seller of shoes exclusively for women, a business that he began in the year 2005 because of the necessity of making an income and the few possibilities for work that existed at that time. When he began it, a friend of his recommended him to a woman who owned a shoe store, and from that moment they established a commercial relationship that supported his incursion into the market. 

He works from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon every day, selling for credit or cash among his clientele, made up of employees, referrals, and neighbors, while purchasing from wholesalers and specialty markets from which he obtains special prices. 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has made, through which he will purchase classic and sports footwear, with which he will have more inventory that impacts the purchasing decisions of his clientele, to make a little more money, and to make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy classic and sports footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frames, accessories, advertising material and to have capital to fill the orders that she generates.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es: Alquilar lavadoras, es el dia a dia de Buenaventura, un hombre de 65 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos adultos. Elp tambien es comerciante de productos variados, como calzado, ropa, accesorios femeninos etc. Su actividad emprendedora, la inició hace 35 años, cuando con sus ahorros, desarroollo la idea de vender mercancia a crédito y por encargo entre sus amistades. Hoy es un hecho que ha crecido y tiene muchos mas sueños de prosperidad, como el de tener un gran almacen y continuar apoyando a sus hijos y nietos. Su mayor desafio, es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para invertir; aun así se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, con el cual comprará, por un lado mercancia variada para aprovechar la temporada venidera a proposito del dia internacional de las madres, que impulsa sus ventas y tambien invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus lavadoras, y comprará repuestos para ellas. Con esta inversión espera incrementar sus ventas haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Renting washing machines is the day to day activity of Buenaventura, a 65-year-old man, married, and father of three adult children. He also is a salesman of various products such as shoes, clothing, women's accessories, etc. He began his enterprise 35 years ago when, with his savings, developing the idea of selling merchandise on credit and by order among friends. Today it is a fact that he has grown and he has many more dreams of prosperity such as having a big store and continuing to support his children and grandchildren. His greatest challenge is the insufficient working capital to invest. So, he has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for a Kiva loan, his first financing from this organization, with which he will purchase on one hand a variety of merchandise to take advantage of the upcoming season of International Mothers' Day which boosts sales, and also he will invest in maintaining his washing machines and will purchase spare parts for them. With this investment, he expects to increase his sales, making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise, to purchase spare parts for washing machines.

loans.name: Dora Ines

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer muy simpática de 51 años de edad, ella con un capital bajo y con una estantería que le hizo su esposo inicio con un negocio de tienda general, una alternativa que surgió de la necesidad económica por apoyar la situación que vivían en su casa, ella es madre de 3 hijos gracias a su negocio pudo pagarle sus estudios y hoy ellos tienen una familia.

En la foto esta ella junto aquella estantería que le realizo su marido, recordando aquel día mítico para ella.

Dora se enfrenta a diferentes dificultades, la competencia, la inseguridad en la zona, el alza en los costos de la canasta familiar, pero a pesar de ella, se mantiene y persevera con su negocio, ya ella a su edad le es muy difícil conseguir empleo y se debe aferrar a lo que tiene y tratar de mejorarlo

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido en víveres, abarrotes, y verduras, esto le mejoraría sus ventas, dará sostenibilidad, e inventario para trabajar por un mes
texts.en:
Dora is a very nice woman who is 51 years old.  With a small amount of capital and a display case that her husband made for her, she started up a general store.  She decided to do this because she needed to support her family financially. She is the mother of 3 children.  Thanks to her business, she was able to pay for their education, and now they have their own families. 

In the photo she is standing by the shelves that her husband made, a reminder of those legendary days.  

Dora faces a number of difficulties, including the competition, the lack of public safety in her area, and the high costs of consumer staples.  However, in spite of these, she perseveres and keeps the business running, because at her age it is very difficult to get work and she must hold onto what she has and try to improve it.  

Dora is requesting a loan to stock up on groceries and vegetables.  This will allow her to increase her sales, making her business sustainable by giving her a month of inventory.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries

loans.name: Tonya

texts.en:
Tonya is a disabled single woman who struggles to remain independent. After her accident, Tonya is left with severe pain and several serious health conditions related to her injuries. Tonya will undergo three additional surgeries within the next few years in order to relieve her pain and increase her mobility. While Tonya is a financially responsible woman, she experienced multiple financial setbacks after her injury due to no longer being able to work, and having to pay for at-home care out of pocket. Her monthly living expenses and the price of in-home care quickly drained her savings, and she was left with multiple unpaid medical bills due to not having health insurance after her injury. Tonya is now able to receive the care she requires, but her credit is severely damaged after some of her medical bills were placed in collections. For this reason, Tonya has been unable to obtain financing to replace her inoperable air conditioner. For some time now, Tonya’s old air conditioner has been unable to cool her home properly, and has been much more costly to operate in comparison to a new high efficiency air conditioner. Tonya came to SELF in hopes that she will be able to finance a new high efficiency air conditioner that will save her money on her energy bills and improve the livability of her home during the hot Florida summer. 

Tonya will use her KIVA loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life and make her long recovery at home much more bearable.

loans.use: to buy a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life and make her long recovery at home much more bearable.

loans.name: Triffany

texts.en:
Triffany (pictured center) is a hardworking and devoted mother of five children (her two oldest children are pictured left and right). Triffany’s children are her pride and joy, and she is determined to give them the best life she possibly can. She strives to teach her children that hard work and determination are key to reaching their goals in life. Triffany has recently suffered many setbacks including multiple health issues that have resulted in missed time at work and costly hospital bills that have severely damaged her credit. Although these setbacks have caused her financial distress, she remains positive and believes that through her hard work, she will overcome these hardships and set a positive example for her children. Triffany has already managed to pay off her medical bills and is working towards providing a better living environment at home for her family. Both Triffany and her daughter have a health condition that is exacerbated by Florida’s heat which is why she is seeking to replace her air-conditioner which is inoperable, before the summer months hit and impact their health. After multiple failed attempts to obtain financing for this purpose, Triffany found SELF and is hoping that she can financing a new high efficiency air conditioner to improve the living environment and air quality in her home for her family. 

Triffany will use her KIVA loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living environment and air quality of her home for her family.
.

loans.use: to pay for a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living environment and air quality of her home for her family.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a devoted wife and loving mother of two children. Anna and her family have suffered many setbacks related to health issues which resulted in financial distress for the family.  A few years ago, Anna underwent a surgery that did not go as planned and she was ultimately left with chronic pain that she will have to endure for the rest of her life. That same year, Anna had another life-threatening condition that left her in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) for days. Through these difficult times, Anna was resilient and kept a positive attitude during her recovery; however, her husband who had been her emotional and financial support also became critically ill shortly after she was released from the hospital. These series of events caused severe financial damage and called for sacrifices, which include giving up the family car to be able to pay for their living expenses. Despite a turbulent time, the family has worked hard to recover from these setbacks, and they have paid off much of the medical debt incurred during the time of Anna and her husband’s illnesses. Anna was inspired by her son to pursue her dream of helping special needs children obtain assistance through a non-profit program she created. She hopes to one day open a school for special needs children so that they will be able to receive care and education tailored to their needs. 

Due to her multiple medical issues, Anna’s credit has been damaged, and this is preventing her from obtaining financing.  Their current air conditioner contains mold and is malfunctioning. Anna’s chronic pain is greatly affected by Florida’s heat and humidity and installing a new high efficiency air conditioner would help provide Anna and her family positive health impacts and a better quality of life with. 

Anna hopes that SELF and KIVA can help her finance a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help improve the livability of their home and improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to finance a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help improve the livability of her home and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine is a proud United States Navy Veteran and a loving mother to her five children. Sadly, Ernestine’s husband lost his life while serving our country twenty nine years ago. This has greatly affected Ernestine as well as her children who were forced to grow up without their father. Over the years, as a single mother, Ernestine has raised and set a positive example for their children through her determination and strength. Ernestine has always managed to run her household smoothly, but she has recently experienced a few unforeseen setbacks. When Ernestine’s mother passed away, Ernestine had to use every penny she had saved in order to pay for her final expenses. Ernestine was able to recover from this setback, but two months ago Ernestine’s daughter was forced to move back home due to a disability. Ernestine’s limited credit history has hindered her from being able to make repairs to her home, and she is currently in desperate need of a new air conditioner to replace her broken unit. Ernestine wishes to make her home more comfortable and healthy for her disabled daughter and the rest of her children as the summer heat has arrived. She does not want her children to suffer through Florida’s hot summer months without a working air conditioner. Not only will Ernestine and her children improve the livability of their home by installing a high efficiency air conditioner, but Ernestine will also build a positive credit history as she repays her loan. 

Ernestine will use her KIVA loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the livability of her home for herself as well as her children.

loans.use: to buy a new high-efficiency air conditioner that will improve her quality of life and make her long recovery at home much more bearable.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Don Jacinto de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo y también a la crianza de ganado bovino en ambas actividades tiene muy buena experiencia, cliente tiene mas de 35 años de dedicarse a ese rubro el cual inicio con capital propio, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, productos para el control de plaga entre otras cosas que necesita para la siembra y así poder le dar a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 60 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his two daughters. He makes a living by growing corn and sorghum and also raising cattle. He has very good experience in both jobs. He has worked in this business for more than 35 years, which he started with his own money. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and disease controlling products, among other things that he needs for planting. This way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, disease controlling products among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, Ana  vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia, Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 22 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Ana solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and is a hardworking and responsible person who works full time in her business.  Ana lives together with her family in their own home. She has owned a fruit and vegetable stall for 22 years, located in the municipal market which is close to her residence. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale, to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven de 20 años de edad que se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas en un terreno que su padre le presto, inicio el trabajo con el propósito de volverse independiente y tener su propio medio de sostenimiento.

Inicio esta actividad con el claro propósito de generar recursos para tener sus propias tierras pero de momento se preocupa por darle sostenibilidad a su negocio e ir adquiriendo clientes. 

Oscar quiere demostrarle a su padre que clase de persona es, que se sienta orgulloso y por ello tomo la iniciativa propia de acudir a una entidad financiera con el ánimo de solicitar un préstamo que desea invertir en la compra de abonos y riegos insumos principales del sostenimiento de tierras.

Apoya la juventud, presta ya, Oscar te espera, ayúdalo a desarrollar su actividad para cumplir su sueño de tener sus propias tierras para cultivar.
texts.en:
Oscar, 20, is a young man who grows vegetables on land loaned to him by his father.  He began the activity in order to support himself and become independent.

He had a clear purpose in mind at the outset which was to have his own land, but for the time being his concern is keeping the business going and attracting customers.

Oscar wants to prove to his father what kind of person he is, that he is proud enough to go on his own initiative to a financial entity to request a loan to buy fertilizers and sprinklers, the main supplies for land maintenance.

Please support youth by helping this young man.  Oscar is counting on your help to develop his activity so he can fulfill his dream of having his own cropland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and sprinklers for land maintenance.  His wish is to farm his own land.

loans.name: Kevin Stidd

texts.es: Kevin de 21 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde hace varios años vive en casa de sus padres con ellos y su grupo familiar. Él es un joven muy responsable y trabajador que se dedica a atender su negocio de un molino de nixtamal, en el cual atiende a personas emprendedoras como el que tiene algún negocio de venta de comida o platos típicos, además tiene una venta de tortillas con la cual le apoya su madre. Kevin siempre buscando lo mejor desea invertir en repuestos para su molino y en más para la elaboración de tortillas, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz y repuestos para su molino que es su mayor apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Kevin is a hard-working 21 year old man that has lived in his parents house for several years with their family.

He is a very responsible and hard working young man who earns a living running his corn mill business, in which he deals with enterprising people such as himself, for example someone who has a business selling food or food dishes. Kevin also has a business selling tortillas which his mother helps him with.

Kevin, who is always seeking the best, wishes to invest in spare parts for his mill and also to produce tortillas, but he does not have the necessary economic liquidity. Therefor he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in maize and spare parts for his mill which his biggest economic income.

loans.use: to invest in maize and spare parts for his mill.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a strong-willed mother for her two children. She runs a retail business with variety of dry good items. To fully realize her project, she requested a loan.

In the future, Julieta hopes to sustain her business and wants to see all her children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: to restock her retail business of ready-to-wear clothing and dry good supplies

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines.

Belen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Belen has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelina is 40 years old and has five children who are in school.

Evelina has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Evelina requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like shells, etc..

Evelina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like shells, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 40 years old, married with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other groceries to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is aged 36; she is a mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well as his relatives, who like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Frazana hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. The amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Farzana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer casada ella es una trabajadora innata, vive junto con su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad, su negocio de venta de miscelánea ha constituido un generador de sueños y esperanza para su familia ya que desde que tiene este negocio ha visto como su calidad de vida ha mejorado considerablemente, pueden comer mejor, sus hijos gozan de educación, tienen juguetes, ropa, su familia no es adinerada, son personas humildes que luchan por salir de la pobreza y que trabajan en ver de estar esperando una limosna, prefieren emprender, buscar medios y ayudas que le permitan crecer y después con cumplimiento y resultados mostrar que esa ayuda valió la pena.

Ella vende películas en formato DVD, ropa interior, sandalias, artículos para el hogar muy bonitos y pocos vistos en el mercado ya que se da a la tarea de buscar proveedores que vendan productos diferentes a lo que se ve en su sector.

Ella quiere incrementar sus ventas, mejorar su utilidad, lograr una sostenibilidad, diversificar su oferta, que su negocio sea algo impactante, lindo, estético, pero son cosas que va a ir  mejorando poco a poco.

Su deseo de comprar una vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos es la que la llenan de fuerza y espíritu para trabajar cada día.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de:
•	Películas en formato DVD
•	Ropa interior  
•	Sandalias
•	Acolchados para el hogar
texts.en:
Dora is a married woman. She is a born worker, she lives with her husband and two sons who are 11 and 13. Her business of general items has become a dream creator and hope for her family, as since she has had this business she has seen how her quality of life has considerably improved. They can eat better, her children enjoy an education, and they have toys and clothing. Her family does not have much money, they are modest people who struggle to come out of poverty and who work instead of waiting for a handout. They prefer to become entrepreneurs, looking for ways and help that will allow them to grow, and afterwards, by achieving results, showing that the help was worth it. 
She sells films in DVD format, underwear, sandals, and items for the home, which are very beautiful and rarely seen in the market, as she takes on the task of looking for supplies who will sell different products than what can be seen in her sector.
She wants to increase her sales, and improve their use, achieving sustainability, diversifying her offer, that her business can have an impact, and that it is nice and beautiful, things she will improve little by little.

Her dream of buying a house and paying for the education of children is what fills her with strength and spirit to work every day.

She asks for a loan to buy a stock of:
-	Films in DVD format
-	Underwear
-	Sandals
-	Cushions for the home

loans.use: to purchase films in DVD format, underwear, sandals, and cushions for the home.

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en:
Rasheed is a 50 year old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters and her husband is an auto repairing mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto repairing workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop for exchange in cars during the repairing process. 

He needs to purchase some tools for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the necessary things. Therefore his wife, Rasheed is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. 

Rasheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. for her husband's auto workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home energy systems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shampoo packets, soap, detergent, canned goods, sweet bread, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978 and lives in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. Since 2005 she has been keeping livestock and planting agricultural crops.

She is planning to improve her agricultural business because conditions in her area are favorable, and in this way she can earn money to feed her family and provide for her children.

She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant and harvest a good crop next season. She is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento para el engorde de estos, con esto ella espera mejorar su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Cayalti, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works breeding and selling animals. She has experience in this business and has good references from the people of her district. She will use the loan to buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them. By doing so she hopes to improve her business with the result of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed to fatten them

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is married with 5 children. She runs a store that sells variety of commodities. She availed a loan to restock her store with the basic commodities. She wants purchase stocks like bags of rice, canned goods, soap, milk and soy sauce. 

In the future, Nelfa hopes to sustain and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with the basic commodities to sustain and expand her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina offers home service manicure, hair re-bonding, cold waves and haircuts since she was 18 years of age. Josefina has been thankful with her previous loans from lenders.It helped her a lot especially in improving her income and providing quality service to all her customer.

Josefina still seeks for additional capital of PHP3,000 allowing her to purchase variety nail polish,chemicals for hair rebonding and cold wave for her beauty salon business.  She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to be used in buying variety nail polishes,chemicals for hair rebonding and cold waves for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 43 years old and has two children. Emelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Emelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelyn has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Jeana

texts.en:
Ma. Jeana is 45 years old and married with two children. With two children still in school, Ma. Jeana works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Jeana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Ma. Jeana has been in this business for 15 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma, 52 years old, is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past 9 years, Elma has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional storage box for her fish. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional storage box for her fish.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 47 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Liza has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, candies, detergent soap, etc. 

Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and married with three children. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care items, and other groceries.

Fe has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care items, and other groceries

loans.name: Yonalyn

texts.en:
Yonalyn is 37 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school.

Yonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Yonalyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Yonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Joaquín

texts.es: José Joaquín, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra e semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima, suelo y las cantidad de agua de lluvia que resenta la region  y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y en el desarrollo del cultivo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos eshtatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Joaquín is 24 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and brothers, who are his top priority. He would use the loan to buy good quality bean seed that adapt well to the conditions of the climate, soil, and rainfall of the region. He would also use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to the sowing and development of the crop, in addition to paying for the labor of the application of the products and planting assistance once the crop develops. By doing so, he would make certain that the job is well done.

He wishes to make the most out of the region's good conditions for this crop, as well as to put into practice his several years of experience in the handling of basic grains. He also wants to be able to buy better quality products so that his crop has a good development and health, as well as an adequate harvest, and to have an important short-term production.

He wants to use the income he hopes the harvest will generate for the well-being and education of his family, and to accomplish some of the family goals, as well as to continue investing in his crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Before this, he had not had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with more services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizers, and other products for the development of his crop, as well as to pay for the labor and assistance.

loans.name: Rafael De Jesus

texts.es:
Frente a sus ordenadores se encuentra el señor Rafael un hombre que se preocupa mucho por entregar una buena calidad de producto, tiene un negocio de marquetería y su éxito radica en la cordialidad y la buena calidad de sus muebles y sus reparaciones. Hablando un poco de la vida de Rafael es un hombre casado,  padre de una hija ya mayor de edad, no solo tiene el negocio de marquetería, el inicio con fotografía, pero se alterna las profesiones con su esposa, son una familia que de verdad se le ven las ganas de progresar, trabajan todos los días de la semana 8 horas por día.

Rafael se ha proyectado para este año expandir su local, generar empleo, realizar reparaciones a su hogar, seguir sosteniendo su negocio, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar su capital y ahora se encuentra con una manera para ir realizando estas tareas. 

Con la ayuda de un crédito el señor Rafael quiere comprar materiales para realizar algunas adecuaciones al local, teniendo como principal beneficio más espacio para laborar, también comprara materiales para realizar muebles.
