Lo más sorprendente de este hombre es que tomó el camino del emprendimiento debido a una incapacidad que lo imposibilito para trabajar, pero míralo sigue en pie de lucha, queriendo trabajar y demostrar que tiene una mentalidad fuerte y que será exitoso.
texts.en:
Rafel de Jesus can be found in front of his computers, a man who cares a lot about delivering a good quality product. He has a marquetry business and his success lies in the cordiality and quality of his furniture and repairs.

Speaking a little about his life, Rafel is a married man and has an adult daughter. He not only has the marquetry business but has gotten into photography and he alternates the work with his wife. They are a family that truly sees the desire to get ahead. They work every day of the week for eight hours a day.

Rafel has projections for the year to expand the premises, generate jobs, make repairs to his home, continue maintaining his business, improve sales, increase his capital, and now he has found a way to go about these tasks.

With the help of a loan Rafel wants to buy supplies to make some of the repairs to the premises with the main benefit being more space to work. Also he will buy supplies to make furniture.

What is most amazing about this man is that he took the road to entrepreneurship due to a disability that made it impossible to work, but he went on into the fight, wanting to work and show that he has a strong mentality and could be successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make some repairs to his premises with the main benefit being more space to work

loans.name: Claudia Yolanda

texts.es: A sus 29 años de edad Yolanda es madre soltera, sus 2 hijos tienen 9 y 11 años y asisten a la escuela, Yolanda es una joven alegre que se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales nenores, Yolanda necesita el dinero del credito para  comprar chanchos, Yolanda tiene la aspiracion de comprar mas chanchos y de aquí le quede mas ganancias para pagar todo gasto de educacion y alimenta que son las necesidades basicas.
texts.en: Yolanda is a 29 year old single mother with two children aged nine and eleven who go to school. Yolanda is a cheerful young woman who makes a living raising small farm animals. Yolanda needs this loan to buy pigs, Yolanda wants to buy more pigs and thus be able to make more money and be able to pay for basic living costs such as education and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.en:
Salamat is a 59-year-old housewife living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. Her son owns a fruit shop in the market, and it is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

Salamat's son is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will also help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his mother, Salamat, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her son to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. Her son wants to use the profit to grow his business in the future. Salamat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for her son's fruit shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband to resell, using a four-wheel cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is a barber. Gulnora is a businesswoman. She does business buying and selling women's clothing and grocery products. She has permanent clients and serves each customer gently and accurately. 

Gulnora is planning to widen her grocery store business and appealed to IMON asking for a loan to buy grocery products to store. She hopes to be supported because she is doing her best to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to work toward her law degree.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 44 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la producción y venta de queso artesanal.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, generoso, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Cohana’  que es uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes de Bolivia, por sus hermosos paisajes y por la existencia de culturas milenarias que conservan aún antiguos tesoros culturales, así como conocimientos y prácticas para alcanzar una vida en armonía con la naturaleza.
Victor es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos negros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su negocio es la cría y engorde de ganado lechero para la producción de leche para la elaboración de queso, él se ocupa de visitar las ferias ganaderas del lugar y comprar vacas lecheras para producir leche y queso, “mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de queso, también atiendo una tienda de barrio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede trabajar en ambas actividades, la desventaja es el clima del lugar que en temporadas hace escasear el afrecho. La razón de su solicitud es la poca producción lechera en época de invierno lo que ocasiona que baje la producción de queso y sus ingresos sean menores. Su sueño es tener una quesería amplia con muchas variedades de queso, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una vaca lechera para la producción de queso artesanal y víveres para su tienda de barrio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera para elaborar queso artesanal y víveres para su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Victor is a 44 year old, single man without any children. He has a business making and selling artisanal cheeses. He is an enterprising, independent, generous, patient, responsible and hardworking man.  He started his business in the city of Cohana, which is one of most important tourist attractions in Bolivia because of its beautiful landscapes and the ancient cultures that preserve their cultural heritages, knowledge and practices in order to live in harmony with nature.  Victor is tan, has short black hair, and black eyes, is short and skinny.  His native tongue is Aymará, which is spoken where he is from, but he also speaks Spanish in public and for business.  He lives with his family who works in agriculture. They live in a house that they own built of adobe with a corrugated roof, which has electricity and well water.

He has a business raising dairy cows to make milk and cheese. He spends his time visiting livestock fairs and purchasing dairy cows. "My primary job is making and selling cheese as well as running a neighborhood store." The advantage of his business is that he is able to work in both activities, the downside is the weather as in some seasons the grain harvests are scarce. 

The reason why he is seeking this loan is because of the low milk production during the winter, which reduces his cheese production and his income. His dream is to have a large cheese factory with many varieties of cheese. He hopes to expand his business by purchasing a dairy cow to produce artisanal cheeses, and by purchasing groceries for his neighborhood store.

This is his first loan with the institution in the 30 years that he has worked in this business.  Victor is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to make artisanal cheeses, as well as purchase groceries for his neighborhood store.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow to make cheeses, as well as groceries for her store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Mercedes operates a motorcycle transport service to have an additional source of income. She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to give their children a better life.

To continue operating the motorcycle, she would like to acquire a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline, wheels, and other spare parts needed. Having this financial assistance, she believes that someday she will improve the business and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and other spare parts needed

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
La feria ganadera es muy célebre en cierta comunidad de Veracruz ya que en ocasiones se dan cita más de mil personas para disfrutarla. En el corazón de dicha localidad se formó un grupo llamado El Rosario en honor a una de las integrantes.

   Las actividades que realizan las mujeres del grupo son: Eunice y Juana quienes venden calzado por catálogo; Olga, antojitos típicos; Ma. Del Rosario, miel y bolsas de mano; Blanca, cosméticos y Elia, ropa. Por su parte Antonieta maneja un club de nutrición y Eustorgia, un fonda.

   Doña Eustorgia Margarita es mejor conocida como Mago, ella es madre soltera de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad. Sus hijos fueron la motivación principal para que abriera una fonda, “no es fácil tener cuatro hijos y no encontrar trabajo, por ellos inicié”.  Al principio fue complicado levantar el negocio porque otras vecinas tenían la misma actividad, pero ahora, después de veinte años, es la única fonda que permanece abierta. 

   Mago mantiene abierto el pequeño restaurante de lunes a domingo desde las 9:00 am y hasta las 10:00 pm y ofrece a sus clientes, entre otras cosas, comida corrida, antojitos, jugos, licuados y aguas de fruta natural. La amabilidad y sazón son la clave para que su negocio mantenga el éxito. Con las ganancias obtenidas Mago logró sacar adelante a su familia. Aunque ahora sus hijos la apoyan económicamente, ella continúa con su actividad ya que tener su propio ingreso la hace sentir libre e independiente económicamente.

   Esta vez Mago ha solicitado un préstamo para invertirlo en sandalias y zapatos de piso para iniciar una nueva actividad aprovechando el espacio del local donde tiene su fonda. Mago planea continuar con ambas actividades y con el paso exitoso como hasta ahora. Con una sonrisa Mago dice "gracias por creer en nosotros y otorgarnos la posibilidad del préstamo para continuar con nuestras actividades”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de doña Mago quien viste blusa floreada color crema.
texts.en:
The cattle fair is very popular in a village of Veracruz. More than 1,000 people gather to enjoy it. At the heart of this village, the group El Rosario was formed. It was named in honor of one of the members.

The members of this group have different activities: Eunice and Juana sell shoes on a catalogue, Olga sells traditional snacks, Maria del Rosario sells honey and handbags, Blanca sells cosmetics, and Elia sells clothes. Also, Antonieta is the manager of a nutrition club and Eustorgia is the manager of a small restaurant.

Eustorgia Margarita is better known as Mago. She is a single mother of four children, all of them adults. Her children were her main motivation to open the restaurant. “It is not easy to have four children and not find a job. They are the reason why I started this business.” In the beginning, it was difficult for her to start this business, since there was a lot of competition. However, after twenty years, hers is the last tavern still open.

Mago opens her small restaurant Monday to Sunday, from 09:00 am until 10:00 pm. She sells, among other things, complete meals, snacks, juices, smoothies and water flavored with natural fruits. She is kind to the clients and her food is delicious; these are the reasons why her business continues to be successful. With the profits she has made, Mago has been able to get ahead with her family. Now that her children help her economically, she continues working, since having her own business makes her feel free and economically independent.

This time, Mago has requested a loan to buy sandals and shoes to start a new business and make better use of some empty space she has in her restaurant. Mago is planning to run these two businesses without slowing down the pace. With a smile on her face, Mago says: “Thank you for believing in us and for giving us the possibility of receiving a loan to continue with our activities.”

* This picture was taken in Mago’s restaurant. She is wearing a cream-colored shirt with flowers.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes to start a new business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, 52 years old, is married and has six children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 9 years, Fatima has operated a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted items to sell. In the future, Fatima would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy assorted items to sell

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 42 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Dorris works very hard to provide for them.

Dorris runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Dorris has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Dorris would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 55, is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school. For the past fifteen years she has worked steadily selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Francisca received and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now applying for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy assorted items to sell. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted items to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 53 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Regina has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, cereals, milk, eggs, noodles, etc. 

Regina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: G.s. Rancho Grande Group

texts.es: María, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  María tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la agricultura en cultivos de maíz,frijol y café. El cultivo de café es lo que le genera mayor ingreso, y esta producción la vende en grano despulpado y secado en la misma zona donde vive. Ella decidió solicitar otro préstamo por 6,000 lempiras en forma grupal, este préstamo lo invertirá en pago de trabajadores y la compra de abono para fertilizar la finca de café y poder mejorar la producción. Su idea es tener un buen patrimonio familiar para vivir mejor y crecer como productora de café. El grupo que han formado se llama Rancho Grande, formado por 3 mujeres que se dedican a la agricultura de café, maíz y frijol y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 18,500 lempiras para comprar abono, pago de mano de obra y fertilizar sus fincas de café. En la foto esta Mirna a la izquierda, sigue María Lucia y Rosa a la derecha.
texts.en:
María is a 45-year-old single mother. She has four children and lives in a neighbourhood of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira.  She has cultivated corn, beans, and coffee for 16 years. Her coffee crop generates the greatest income. She sells it in grain form. It is depulped and dried in the zone where she lives. She has decided to request a new loan of 6,000 lempiras in a group. She will invest this loan in the payment of labourers and the purchase of manure to fertilize her coffee farm. This will improve production. Her plan is to have a good family patrimony so that they can live well and she will grow as a coffee producer.
Her group is called Rancho Grande. It is made up of three women who work in agriculture, cultivating coffee, corn, and beans. They live in the same community. This is a group loan for 18,500 lempiras to purchase manure, lay labourers, and fertilize their coffee farms.
Mima is pictured on the left, followed by Maria Lucia and Rosa on the right.

loans.use: to pay the labourers and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Herbie

texts.en:
Herbie is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Herbie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Herbie has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.en: As a hardworking and passionate business woman, Martha is 45 years old, married and mother of two children. She received a Bachelor of Science degree in chemistry and worked in a company for more than 10 years. In order to provide the best living conditions to her family, she had ran a business for the last three years selling chemicals in the automotive industry. She would like to expand to other regions to be the most recognized company in the country. The loan she is requesting is to buy products in  large quantities to stock which will allow her to increase sales. Martha’s dream is to be financial stable and able to pay for their children to study. With this loan she will be able to increase incomes in order to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy products in large quantities to stock

loans.name: Reyna Apolinaria

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 26 años de edad, es casada tiene un hermoso hijo de cinco años, está linda familia vive  en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Reyna con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace cuatro años. 
Reyna para preparar sus deliciosas tortillas los hace con mucho amor, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes, pero con la estufa con la que ella cuenta con el paso de los años, ya no tiene la misma capacidad, es por eso que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar una estufa nueva  para seguir preparando sus tortillas.
El gran sueño de Reyna es contar con otro puesto de venta de tortillas para seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 26, is married and has a beautiful five-year-old son.  This nice family lives in a community in San Pablo Jocopilas.

Reyna has earned a living selling tortillas for four years to earn her income and get her family ahead.  She prepares her delicious tortillas with a lot of love, which is why she has a lot of customers.  With the passing of the years, though, her stove is no longer adequate, so she's requesting a loan to buy a new stove to keep on making her tortillas.

Reyna's big dream is to have another retail space to sell tortillas so she can continue to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Monica tiene 26 años y vive con su novio y su hijo Daniel, de dos meses de edad. Además de su empleo como asistente contable en una empresa privada, Monica comenzó un negocio de juegos inflables para fiestas infantiles hace casi un año. Este sueño inició cuando se enteró que se convertiría en madre por primera vez. Por esa razón está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un nuevo equipo y crear publicidad para ser más reconocida en toda la región.
Actualmente no hay un fin de semana en que no tengan un evento que cubrir.“El préstamo prácticamente se pagará solo”, Monica afirma. Su mayor sueño es tener estabilidad financiera para poder cubrir todas las necesidades y gastos de su hijo y poder ofrecerle un patrimonio en el futuro. 
Monica inició este negocio porque quiere traer felicidad a todos los niños en un día especial. Monica es una mujer muy entusiasta, alegre y trabajadora que está muy agradecida por este préstamo de Kiva que le permite continuar con este proyecto tan exitoso. Los ingresos son excelentes y en su cuarto préstamo con Konfío, su negocio ha sido muy fructífero.
texts.en: Monica is 26 years old and lives with her boyfriend. They are expecting their first child. In addition to her job as accounting assistant, she would like to run a business which rents inflatables equipment for children's parties to earn an extra income. For that reason she is asking for a loan to purchase inflatable equipment and create advertising in order to be recognized in the region she lives. Monica's biggest dream is to have financial stability in order to cover her child’s college expenses and leave him a legacy. “I want to bring happiness to children in a special day”, Monica says. That’s the main reason she wants to own this business. She is optimistic and cheerful woman who will be very grateful to Kiva and lenders who support her in this project. She is very confident in her financial planning skills on her fourth loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase inflatable equipment and create advertising

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid, 27 years old, is married and has one child. Hamid’s family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Agdam and they now live in the Baki region. This is Hamid's second loan; he repaid his first on time. 

Hamid now has a car washing place. He needs a loan of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the car wash apparatus. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to repair the car wash apparatus and increase business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977 and now lives in the small town of Vahdat with her family. Nargis is married and has four children. She has many years of experience doing business in the domestic market. She has a rental place in the market where she sells women's textiles. 

Nargis is a responsible, communicative and conscientious person. She takes great care with her customers' orders and serves them with patience. A new season is coming and Nargis is planning to buy a new assortment of textiles. She has requested a loan from KIVA and IMON to buy the textiles. Nargis hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of textiles for women

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
El socio Cesar Augusto pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ASUNTA DE CALCA, el socio tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, él socio se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras como tomates, zanahorias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar  zanahorias entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member César Augusta belongs to the Virgen Asunto De Calca communal bank.  This member is 36, lives with his partner and has one child. He makes his living from selling vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots and more. This member spends a lot of time working at this business which is going well thanks to the hard work he puts into his business every day as this is how he provides for his family. 

This member is requesting a loan to buy carrots and others. This member feels grateful for the loan and promises to keep up the payments on his share.

loans.use: to buy carrots and others.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita has been running her Internet shop for one year and has renovated it to make it comfortable for all her customers. Sherlita plans to buy another computer and printer but doesn't have enough capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000. Sherlita knows that this loan amount will enable her to improve her Internet shop business and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer for her Internet shop business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita has a tailoring business that she earns money from to support her family. At the age of 51, she has big dreams for her four children. 

Anecita has decided to have her house repaired. She requested a loan to purchase housing materials like wood, aluminum roofing, and nails. 

With the loan extended to her, she has just provided a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials like wood, aluminum roofing, and nails

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
From Tambulig, Allan has a wholesale business selling rice. This is how he has supported his family and where he has offered all his hard work. 

He signed up for his membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and accessed his needed capitalization. He has managed to run his wholesale business with the help of the cooperative. Recently, he availed another loan to restock bags of rice for goods distribution. 

In the future, Allan dreams of nothing more than for his family to be provided with their needs.

loans.use: to restock bags of rice for goods distribution

loans.name: Lluvia Elizabeth

texts.en:
An enthusiastic and enterprising woman, Lluvia is 28 years old and lives with her husband. She has a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing. Her husband is a Certified Public Accountant. Last year they decided to own a company which is dedicated mainly to consultancy and development of accounting and marketing projects. 
She is very optimistic with this business and plans to run anotherone in the coming months which will allow her to gain financial stability in order to provide the best living conditions to her children when they become parents. Lluvia is requesting a loan of MXN 2,000 to buy office equipment such as a small desk and a computer. Lluvia and her husband wants to expand to other regions in order to become a recognized company. 
She will be grateful to those who support her to continue growing. Lluvia is confident in her financial planning skills in order to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: To buy desks, chairs and a computer.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, 45, is married and has two children. The family lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person who owns a small cafe in which he offers breakfast, a Pakistani dish called naan channa. He has an employee whose salary adds to his expenses.

Rasheedan’s husband has been operating his cafe for many years. Over time many of his chairs, utensils and crockery have been broken. So he would like to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery for the café, but due to household expenses he hasn’t the capital to do so.

Therefore, Rasheedan has applied for a 80,000 PKR loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can refurbish the café. She gives thanks to Kiva and appreciates the warm support given her.

loans.use: to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery for her husband's café

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old and married woman with a 7 years old son, Diego. For the past two years she had worked a business selling delicious desserts such as cakes, cupcakes and cookies. She is requesting a loan of MXN 20,000 to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs and fruits. She wants to turn her business into a formal establishment in order to attract more customers. She would like to open several branches in different parts of the city and become a recognized restaurant. She is a very committed woman, who had always looked how to move forward in order to provide a better quality of life to her children. Her biggest dream is to have financial stability in order to come closer to her goal of own a home, where she could share quality time with her family. Alma will increase her profits with this loan, so she will make successful repayments on her fourth loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and fruits.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a rural woman of 37 years. She lives in a small kaccha (made of straw and mud) house with her family in Falakata. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Both she and her husband are illiterate and able to sign their names only, but they are working hard to provide education to their children.

Rina's husband is a farmer and is associated with agribusiness. He cultivates varieties of seasonal crops on his farmland according to the market demand. After harvest, he sells the products to the market at a wholesale rate. Rina also assists her husband in these activities, especially at the time of sowing the seedlings and harvesting. They work from dawn to dusk to give a good future to their children. Now they decided to cultivate cucumbers, which are in great demand in the summer season, but they need some financial help to execute their plan.

Rina came to know about Kiva’s partner BJS and that they give enterprise loans to poor rural women. She thus applied for a loan to buy farm supplies like good-quality seeds and fertilizer to cultivate cucumbers. Rina hopes this will give a boost to their business profit and that she will be able to build a concrete house for her family in the future.

She is appreciative to both BJS and Kiva for this financial aid.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for cultivating cucumbers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

He runs a book shop alongside secretarial services to supplement his income. He also earns a monthly salary so as to be able to cater to the increasing family demands. 

He dreams of educating his children to university level. However, he is challenged by inadequate capital to fully stock his business and increase his sales. 

He needs a loan to buy books and secretarial materials like paper and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy books and secretarial materials like paper and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jared Ailyn

texts.en: Jared Ailyn is 20 years old and lives with her couple and their children. In addition to her job as a restaurant hostess, for the past eight months she had ran a business selling shoes at her home. Jared Ailyn wants to turn her business into a formal establishment to expand customers’ base increasing sales. She is asking for a loan of MXN 3,000 to buy shoes in bulk so she can make inventory and cover pending orders. She plans to run a food business when having greater financial stability. Jared’s dream is to own a home where she can share unforgettable moments with her family. Currently she is studying high school online and she plans to finish a degree in Law in order to keep growing personally and professionally. With this loan she will make higher incomes and make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk

loans.name: Ykval

texts.ru: Ыквал, 57 лет, вдова. У нее - средне-специальное образование, она на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Ыквал занимается торговлей продуктами питания и посудой, стартовав в 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Ыквал, ее ежемесячный доход доходит до 50,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ыквал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания для расширения ассортимента. Ыквал планирует направлять доход от кредита в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Ykval is 57 years old and a widow. She has vocational education and is currently on a pension. As a main source of income for her family, Ykval works with retail of food products and kitchenware, after having started this business 10 years ago. Thanks to Ykval's persistent work, her monthly income is up to 50,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Ykval turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase food products to expand her assortment. Ykval plans to direct the income from the loan towards developing her business. She will also invest in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food products to expand the assortment in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: На районах и селах Республики Таджикистана основным видом деятельности является животноводство и растениеводство. На районе нет заводов и мало транспортных средств. Там много растение, деревья, свежий воздух и  прекрасная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Парвина из района Гиссар. Ей 19 лет и она замужем. У нее пока нет детей. Парвина на районе занимается растениеводством. Она молодая девушка, н можно сказать она талантливая и трудолюбивая девушка. Парвина в этом году  посадила лук. Она радуется, когда собирает богатый и качественный урожай. Парвина хочет, чтобы люди принимали здоровый и качественный урожай.  Минеральные удобрения поможет получить здоровый и качественный урожай. Парвина решила отработать землю минеральными удобрениями, но у нее нет количество сумма денег для купли необходимые средства. У нее мечта в будущем стать хорошим дехканкой.
texts.en:
In the regions and villages of the Republic of Tajikistand, the main type of business is livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. There are no factories and few means of transport in the regions. There are lots of plants, trees, fresh air and great weather for agriculture. 

Parvina is from the Gissar region. She is 19 years old and married. She does not yet have children. Parvina works with field crop cultivation in the region. She is young; however she is talented and hardworking. 

This year Parvina sowed onions. She is happy when she can get a rich and high quality harvest. Parvina would like people to eat healthy and high quality crop. Mineral fertilizers help get a healthy and high quality harvest. 

Parvina decided to process the land with mineral fertilizers. She does however not yet have enough money to purchase the necessary amount. In the future she dreams of becoming a dekhan farmer.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and use it to process the land

loans.name: Saodatmoh

texts.ru:
Саодатмох прелестная женщина приятная в общении и чиста душой. Она мать троих сыновей. Старший сын занимается таксистом на районе. Младшие сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации.  Сыновья уже женаты и самостоятельные парни. 
Все жители района Хуросон почти занимаются животноводством. Саодатмох тоже занимается этой видом деятельностью. Вот таким она уже 10 лет следит и разводит мелких скотов. Саодатмох только идет вперед, не смотря ни на что. Потому, что это деятельность является основной источником дохода. У Саодатмох большой опыт в этой сфере и большая вера в душе. Она берет кредит для купли крупнорогатого скота. Саодатмох хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. Она очень нуждается на Вашу помощь. Вы можете ей помочь!
texts.en:
Saodatmoh is a charming woman. She is pleasant to talk with and has a good soul. She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son works as a taxi driver in the region. The younger sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. The sons are already married and are independent. 

Almost all the residents of the Khuroson region work with livestock breeding. Saodatmoh is also engaged in this type of activity. She has looked after and bred sheep and goats for ten years already. Saodatmoh goes on no matter what. Therefore this business is the main income of the family.

Saodatmoh has a large experience in this area and a lot of faith. She takes a loan to purchase cattle. Saodatmoh would like to increase her herd and expand her business. She needs your help very much. You can help her!

loans.use: to purchase cattle and increase her herd

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana, 71 years old, is from Tudela. She is a retired teacher with 1 child. Cipriana is separated and has raised her child alone. Being the breadwinner of the family, she sees to it that she can provide well for the family's needs. Cipriana has borrowed a loan recently to purchase angle bars, paint and wood for house repairs. Cipriana dreams of continuously supporting the programs and services of the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase angle bars, paint and wood for house repairs

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en: Carmelina, 56 years old, is married and has four children. For the past ten years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Carmelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes for selling.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en:
Hermelita is a woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hermelita is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Hermelita has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

Hermelita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita, 53 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Clarita has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, noodles, rice, etc. for her business. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, noodles, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Парвина. Ей 28 лет. Она вместе тестю, свекровью, мужем и троими детьми проживает на районе Н. Хусрав. Детям 5, 2 года, и маленьким 7 месяцев. У нее честный и трудолюбивый муж. Он занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, и свободное время помогает жене в работе. Сама Парвина дома занимается купле продажей крупнорогатого скота около 6 лет. Она покупает скота и откармливает несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ей в этом бизнесе нравиться то, что она может сама контролировать свой бизнес. Парвина хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовье скота. Она берет кредит, чтобы закупить несколько поголовья крупных скотов. Парвина хочет, чтобы Вы помогли ей расширить деятельность. Она будет рада на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
The photo shows Parvina. She is 28 years old. She lives in the N. Khusrav region together with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and three children. The children are five and two years old, and the youngest is seven months. Parvina has an honest and hardworking man. He works with agriculture. In his spare time he helps his wife with her work. 

Parvina has worked with cattle breeding and sales from her home for around six years. She purchases cattle and breeds them for a few months. The she sells them at the cattle market. What she likes about this business is that she herself can control it. 

Parvina would like to expand her cattle sales business through increasing the number of cattle. She takes a loan to purchase a few heads of cattle. She would like you to help her expand her business. She will be very happy for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru:
Это Рузигул. Она живет на районе Восеъ вместе двумя сыновьям, невесткой и дочерью. Все они мирно живут в одном доме. Сын на рынке занимается торговлей. Он продает овощи. Невестка и дочка домохозяйка, они ведет домашнее хозяйства и помогает Рузигул на работе. Рузигул настоящая мастерица и рукодельница. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Рузигул очень хорошо умеет шить и кроить национальные женские платья. 
Рузигул уже 10 лет занимается такой деятельностью и довольна своей работой, но ее швейная машинка сильно устарела и она хочет на деньги от кредита купить новую машинку. Рузигул надеется, что с появлением новой швейной машинки она будет принимать больше заказы и увеличиться доходы.
texts.en:
This is Ruzigul. She lives in the Vose region together with her two sons, daughter-in-law and daughter. They all live peaceably together in a house. One son works with retail sales at the market. He sells vegetable. The daughter-in-law and daughter stay at home. They do household chores and help Ruzigul with her work. 

Ruzigul is a skilled worker and a seamstress. She works with sewing women's clothing from her home. She knows well how to sew and cut women's traditional dresses. Ruzigul has worked with this type of activity for ten years already. She is satisfied with her work; however her sewing machine is very old and she would like to use the money from the loan for purchasing a new one. 

Ruzigul hopes that she will be able to take more orders and increase her income due to the new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Durenagracia

texts.en:
Durenagracia is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Durenagracia is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Durenagracia has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Durenagracia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted items to sell.

Durenagracia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Durenagracia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted items to sell

loans.name: Frindah

texts.en:
Frindah is a woman in her golden age. She is 53 years old, hardworking, enterprising, loving, and very dedicated. She comes from Nkubu, which is a town in the central region of Kenya.

Frindah is a smallholder farmer who keeps dairy cattle and poultry. She is also an entrepreneur engaged in other small personal businesses. For the twenty-eight years that Fridah has been doing farming, she finds milking to be the most enjoyable activity. However, she doesn't enjoy cleaning the dairy unit as much. There is no doubting her deep connection to farm animals.

Frindah is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. Farming tools are very crucial to all farmers regardless of the nature of the agribusiness they are involved in. With your loan, Frindah will acquire farm implements that will make her work in the field much easier and efficient. These benefits will translate to efficiency, improved quality, and profits. Additional income as a result will help Frindah to foot the high farming costs that keep rising by the day.

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Frindah replied, "More income will help me buy more assets and be able to pay school fees for my school-going children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 31 years old, and she is the mother of one son. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, 31, is a responsible wife who lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a shop in which he buys such recycled items as scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. and then resells it to recycling factories.

Nowadays, due to household expenses he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods to sell and generate income. Shazia has now applied for a 60,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he can continue to buy scrap goods, stabilize his enterprise and save money to meet sudden needs or expenses.

Shazia hopes to take more loans after the successful payment of this one. She is very impressed with and wants to thank Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for their honorable support.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for her husband to resell to recycling factories

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha is a farmer, and has a piece of land where she grows corn and potatoes. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She has been doing this work for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her farming business. The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.


She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Niyozmo

texts.ru:
Ниёзмо женщина из провинциального района Хамадони, Ниёзмо заниматься растениеводством. Ее работа приносит в дом важный источник дохода. В работе ей помогает невестка. Ниёзмо замужем и имеет одного сына. Муж работает в заводе по производству соли. Сын вместе с женой живет с родителями. Он работает таксистом, а его жена уборщицей в местной школе. 
Ниёзмо обратилась за кредитом, потому что сейчас ей срочно необходимо посеять новый урожай. На заемные деньги она купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Наёзмо нуждается в деньгах. Для нее важна каждая помощь.
texts.en:
Niyozmo is a woman from the provincial Hamadoni district who is involved in agriculture. Her work brings home an important source of income. Her daughter-in-law helps her with the work. Niyozmo is married and has a son. Her husband works in a salt factory and her son and his wife live at home with them. Her son is a taxi driver and his wife is a cleaner at the local school. 

Niyozmo applied for a loan because she needs to plant for a new harvest. She will buy fertilizers and seeds with the borrowed money. Niyozmo needs money and every bit of help is important for her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila lives in Tudela together with her three children. As a widow, she sells fish around the neighborhood for a living. 

When she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she was able to access capitalization. Now, she availed another loan to purchase additional kilos of fish for resale. 

In the future, Teofila hopes to see all her children have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of fish for resale

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy and sell fruits and vegetable business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetable to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Adela has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetable to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 60 years old and married with eight children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries o sell.

Aida has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries o sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 59 years old now.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 37 years old and married with  children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Charito has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Charito aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old with four children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, personal care products,  and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, personal care products,  and other groceries

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мижгоне  24 года. Она молодая жена и невестка. Мижгона мастерица швеи. Около 3.5 года услуга швеи является основным источником дохода для Мижгона. Шить и кроить для ее доставляет много удовольствий. Она шьет платья на заказ на машинке, на которой Вы видите на фотографии. Этой машинке много лет, и она не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Мижгона  шила на ней, потому что другой машинки у нее не было. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести современную швейную машинку.  Мижгона заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Mijgona is 24. She is a young wife and daughter-in-law. Mijgona is a seamstress and sewing has been her main source of income for around 3.5 years. She enjoys sewing and tailoring. She sews dresses to order on the machine that you see in the photograph. This machine is very old and does not function well enough. Mijgona sewed on it because she did not have another one. She requested a loan to purchase a modern sewing machine. Mijgona expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Manos Unidas De Amadeo Repeto Ii Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS UNIDAS DE AMADEO REPETO II, la socia Victoria continua con su negocio de trabajos de melamina,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  continua elaborando  diferentes tipos de trabajo como reposteros, andamios entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de melanina entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member, Victoria, belongs to Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto II Communal Bank.  She still has her business working with melamine.  She's a responsible and hardworking person.  She makes kitchen cabinets, shelving, and other types of jobs.  This is how she gets her family ahead.

Victoria requested the loan to buy melamine and other items.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to making her payments on time.

The members in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive to the meeting late because of work.

loans.use: to buy melamine and other items

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old from Tudela. She has fish selling business that sufficiently provides for her family. She has savings for house renovation but still lacks for some construction materials like wood and paints. 

She applied for a loan to realize her project. Virginia hopes to continuously patronize the various programs and services of the cooperative so that she can always go there in times of needs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like wood and paints

loans.name: Fretzie

texts.en:
Fretzie has a piece of cocoland in Tudela. At the age of 32, she has continually helped her parents manage their farm. 

Recently she availed a loan to pay for labor cost on land digging and cleaning. She has 100 more coco seedlings ready for planting. In the future, Fretzie hopes to own a riceland for another source of income.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost for land digging and cleaning

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from rice farming and food vending businesses. Cherry Mae is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Cherry Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Letecia has been in this business for eight years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Diana Lyn

texts.en:
Diana Lyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Diana Lyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Rubeena

texts.en:
Rubeena is a 38-year-old, is a married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband, and he has only a single source of income. 

He owns a workshop in which he provides services to paint and assemble the bodies of wagons. He removes the dents over a wagon's body and paints for renewal. Mostly he paints the full bodies of wagons for renewal.

His stock of paints has been dwindling, and he does not have enough cash in hand to buy paint for services, because he has already spend his savings upon the maintenance of his workshop.

Therefore, Rubeena requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy new cans of paint and some additional tools to continue his services.

loans.use: to buy cans of paint and wagon repairing tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Tillahon

texts.en:
Tillahon is a kind woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in small town of beautiful nature, scenery and fresh water. She is married and has four children. She was started her business with buying and selling almonds, nuts and peanuts. But recently she is busy with planting onions, corn and rice. Separately, she has trees of almonds and nuts, which give her additional income. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy seeds and fertilizer for her land and harvest. She hopes to have a good harvest and can earn money to feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her land and harvest

loans.name: G.s En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es:
El g.s. en Dios confiamos esta conformado por cuatro  integrantes tres mujeres y un varón, madres  y padres de familia responsables de dies hijos, todos menores de edad, lo cuales están estudiando. son originarios de la paz centro lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, y se caracteriza por su comida y bebida típica como como quesillo, tites, y su artesanía de barro. son personas responsables con ganas de superación personal para brindarles a sus familias una mejor nivel de vida.

gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Teresa y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía desde hace diez año en un lugar especifico de la localidad,  también vende por encargo como. ceniceros, floreros, hamacas, adornos de barro, maseteros, trajes típicos, llaveros etc. ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The "en Dios Confiamos" communal bank is made up of four members, three women and one man. They are all mothers and fathers of families and responsible for 10 children, all minors in age and studying. They are natives of La Paz Centro a place located in the west of the country and is known for it's traditional food and drink such as cheese and pottery. They are responsible people with the desire to excel to provide their families with a better standard of living.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead Teresa is the coordinator and she has been selling handicrafts as her economic activity for 10 years in a specialized location. She also sells custom made items like ashtrays, flower vases, hammocks, clay decorations, flowerpots, traditional clothing, key chains, etc. She works 10 hours every day at her business offering her products. The reason for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling of handicrafts so that in the not so distant future she can have higher income.

loans.use: to buy and sell handicrafts like jars, ashtrays, flower vases, kitchen decorations and traditional shirts.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 27 years old and has three children. Cristina is married and has two children currently in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 32 years old and has three children still in school.

Jocelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish materials like a fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish materials like a fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs in technical and software skills

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 31 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Ma. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Zakareya

texts.en:
Zakareya is a young man who is studying at university majoring in physical education.  His father is retired from the army and he has a big family which is consisting of 9 members.  Due to that, his father cannot pay his university fees because of the requirements of home for a large family.  That is why Zakareya applied for an education loan.

Zakareya is happy and satisfied with the loan that he will receive.  It will help him to pay his semester fees. He wishes in the future he might be able to travel abroad to complete advanced study and work at the same time.

loans.use: to pay his university fees in physical education

loans.name: Marianie

texts.en:
Marianie works hard to support her family. Marianie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marianie requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Marianie has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodina is 38 years old and has one child in school.

Melodina has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, personal product care, canned goods, and other groceries.

Melodina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Melodina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, personal product care, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
JENNY, es una joven mujer de 24 años, vive con su cuñada y sus 2 hijos.
desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de embutidos, costillas ahumadas y tilapia. todos estos productos los compra en Colombia ya que a la gente ecuatoriana les gusta el sabor de estas carnes.

sus hijos gozan de buena salud y asisten normalmente a clases.

JENNY espera ver su negocio mas grande, poder contar con 3 congeladores para almacenar mejor sus productos.

este es el segundo crédito que gestiona y en esta ocasión recibirá $900,00 dolares. con los que invertira en su negocio, comprando mas tilapia, y costillas para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
JENNY is a young 24 year old woman who lives with her mother-in-law and two children. For the past two years she has been selling cold cuts, smoked ribs and tilapia. She buys all these products in Colombia as the people in Ecuador like the taste of these meats. Her children are in good health and go to school normally.

Jenny would like ti see her business expand and be able to have 3 freezers to store her products better. This is her second loan she is negotiating and at this time she will receive $900 which she will invest in her business buying more tilapia and ribs to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy smoked ribs, cold cuts and tilapia in Colombia for sale in Ecuador.

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es: Oscar, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su esposa e hijo en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Oscar ha sido agricultor desde pequeño y hace 4 años tiene sus propios cultivos de maíz, frijoles y café, los cuales vende en el mercado local. Con el fin de mejorar su finca ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,500 lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de limpieza de la finca de café y así poder aumentar la producción. Su plan es mejorar el nivel de vida con su familia y formar un patrimonio familiar y para su hijo.
texts.en: Oscar is 36 years old. He is married and he has one child. He lives with his wife and son in a small town in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Oscar has been a farmer since he was young. For four years, he has had his own crops of corn, beans and coffee. He sells them at a local market. In order to improve his farm, he has decided to request a loan of 5,500 lempiras to purchase fertilizers and to pay to clean the coffee farm. With these actions, he will be able to increase production. His plan is to improve his quality of life for his family and create an inheritance for his family and son.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay to clean his coffee farm.

loans.name: Aileen Grace

texts.en:
Aileen Grace has a piggery right in her own back yard. She earns a quarterly income doing this kind of business. She has accessed her capitalization from Paglaum and is now expanding by buying additional piglets to raise. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aileen Grace hopes to save more for the concreting of a pig septic tank for sanitation purposes.

loans.use: to buy bags of animal feed

loans.name: Nenian

texts.en:
Nenian is 55 years old and has five children. Nenian is married and has one child still in school.

Nenian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenian requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenian has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo instead her.  She and her husband did not complete their education because of the financial situation for their families. Wafaa is 34 years old and her husband Ahmad is 51 years old. He has started his own business which is an aluminum shop for making kitchens and cabinets in1979. 

Financial difficulties and a seeming lack of qualifications did not prevent Wafaa from helping her husband to achieve his dreams. Ahmad has determinedly confronted and overcome his challenges, emerging triumphantly.

Lately Ahmad is feeling that his customers are decreasing, therefore Wafaa decided to help him and to be a partner in his business.  Now she wants to do a promotion for the shop and to expand the current shop, but she does not have money. That is why she is applying for a loan to do what she wants and to achieve for her and her husband some work.

loans.use: To expand their family's aluminum shop

loans.name: Robie

texts.en:
Robie is 25 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Robie works very hard to provide for them.

Robie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Robie has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Robie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 49 years old and married, with four children. With one child in school, Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Celsa has been in this business for four years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 55 years old and has seven children. Maribel is married and has three children who are still in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Maribel has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rouella

texts.en:
Rouella is 30 years old and married with one child. Rouella works very hard to provide for them.

Rouella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, coffee, milk, noodles, spices, etc.

Rouella has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, coffee, milk, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Meet Jane, aged 47, a smallholder crop and dairy farmer based in Nkubu, Kenya. She has four children. She has been doing mixed farming for twenty eight years now. Her primary source of income is milk and crops. 

Jane is seeking a loan from Kiva via Juhudi Kilimo to expand her banana farming. This venture will diversify her product portfolio and help her manage risks that may affect a single line of product. With banana farming, she will be able to sell bananas and other banana products such as banana leaves in the market to boost her income. She will also use the banana leaves in feeding her animals, which will result in increased milk production. 

The money will help her manage to pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to smallholder farmers and making financial loans to farmers affordable. 

She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her banana farming activity.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 44 years old with five children. With two children in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a tender and angelic 50-year-old woman. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. With charisma and smiles, Dorcas ploughs and tends her mixed farm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Ndaragwa area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.en: Haitgul is a conscience woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a district with her family. She is married and has four children. She is busy in agriculture; she has livestock and plants cereal in her yard. She wants to widen her working capital and decided to buy livestock. She appealed to IMON asking for help buying livestock. She is a responsible person knows her activity well. She hopes her business will succeed and that she can gain profit to feed her family. She is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia Aurelia  se dedica al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva verduras,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de animales menores y veta de jora, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Aurelia works in agriculture and raising animals. She has land where she grows vegetables. She also continues her business of selling small animals and selling corn beer. She works from 6 am until 5 pm. She has been in this business for a number of years and things are going very well. Her dream is to expand her land for growing. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is happy with the loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a farmer who is supporting his family in a rural community in the Philippines. He is 57 years old and has 6 adult children. 

Cesar and his family have been planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for almost 28 years. He is aiming to improve his farming business in order to increase his yields and income. 

However, having insufficient capital, Cesar would like to take a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy certified seeds, insecticides, pesticides, and fertilizer for his crop production. 

Being a patient and industrious farmer, Cesar believes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and certified corn seed.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura has a coconut plantation in Tudela. She has this business for more than 3 decades now. She enjoys being a member of the cooperative having her access for capitalization. 

Recently, she took a loan to pay for cleaning and land holing for coconut planting. She has readily prepared 50 more coconut seedlings to grow. In the future, Maura hopes to fence her farm for privacy.

loans.use: to pay for the cleaning and land holing for coconut palm planting

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en: Vergilita has wide experience in selling. She owns and runs a sari-sari store in Tudela and makes just enough to raise her four children. Recently, she availed a loan to restock inventories for her sari-sari store business. She wants to have stocks like shampoo, soap, biscuits, canned goods, and noodles readily available. Vergilita is thankful to the cooperative for providing her capital.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Loribeth

texts.en:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Loribeth was granted a PHP 45,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of merchandise products associated with her direct selling business. Having been able to induce greater sales, Loribeth found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting to take a loan worth PHP 50,000 that she will use to obtain additional product sales for selling like clothing, footwear, cosmetics, and other similar products.
