Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits to Loribeth. This is why she is very hopeful that you will allow her request. 

She dreams for her son to graduate college and be a professional some day. Plus, she desires to be able to get an opportunity to franchise goods also in due time. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To obtain additional product sales for selling like clothing, fotwear, cosmetics, and other similar products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Contribute now to Rowena. Recently, she was granted a loan amounting to 42,000 PHP, which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanksgiving, she would like to ask for another loan worth 45,000 PHP. This time, she will utilize this to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs and basically support their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays for more strength and more blessings for her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add heaps of grocery items to her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of vehicle engines, such as renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working on the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is negatively affected.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine. Shazia hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work on the lathe machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia Brigida se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales y venta de jora, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Brigida continues working in her business of raising animals and selling corn beer. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She wants through her business to open a grocery store as it is her dream to have her own business. She also wants to have a larger area to be able to sell her animals. She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as feed for the animals. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is single and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Jannet requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Jannet has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jannet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ruth Bina

texts.en:
Ruth Bina is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth Bina is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ruth Bina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ruth Bina requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ruth Bina has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Ruth Bina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carolina Arvicenda

texts.es: Carolina es una mujer emprendedora exitosa de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante, inicio su negocio hace 10 años con un puesto de venta de tortilla en su domicilio, con las ganancias obtenidas logró poner una pulpería, por lo que uno de sus mayores deseos es aumentar la oferta de productos para satisfacer la demanda de su comunidad y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, azúcar, arroz, aceite y avena.
texts.en: Carolina is a successful, enterprising 28 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two children who are her main motivation for getting ahead. She started her business 10 years ago with a stand selling tortillas at her house. With her profits she managed to open a small store. Her greatest wish is to increase the number of products offered to satisfy the demand of her community and in this way expand her business. The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, sugar, rice, oil and oats.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, rice, oil and oats.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 46 years old and lives with her husband. She is mother of two children. She lives in Ecatepec De Morelos, State of Mexico. In order to provide a better quality of life to her family and support her husband with the household expenses, she started a business which provides a rental service of tableware and cutlery for events. Lucia is requesting a loan of MXN 2,000 to purchase cutlery in large quantities to cover orders. She plans to turn her business into a formal setting which will allow her to increase sales. Lucia will be very grateful if lenders support her in her way to success. She is very committed to be in time with repayment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase cutlery in large quantities.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (coffee and corn) since 30 years ago. Age 50 years; He is married and has three children. It is clear that Arturo works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying improve the living conditions.
Arturo is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a conservative woman and she asked her husband, Mohammad, to take her place in the photo instead. They live in Irbid with their three children.

Mohammad is retired from the army and he wants to save the future for his children. Therefore, he opened his own business which is a grocery shop. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. Elham and Mohammad are managing the business and they are working hard to provide better living conditions for their family and to ensure the good education of their children. 

Elham is now applying for this loan to help increase the amount of goods in the shop. Therefore, they are waiting for your support.

loans.use: to increase the amount of goods in the shop.

loans.name: Evenilda

texts.es: Evenilda vive en casa propia con su esposo  y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, con las ventas que realiza es como logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos, carnes, mariscos, arroz, frutas, refrescos, verduras, entre otras cosas que necesita para la preparación de los alimentos y asi poder variar el menú y tener mas clientes y ella tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Evenilda lives in her own house with her husband and son.  She sells food.  She started 15 years ago, her business is located in the municipal market.  With the sales she is able to get ahead with the home expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, meat, seafood, rice, fruit, sodas, vegetables and other items that she needs to prepare the food and make a varied menu to gain more customers and have better profits.

loans.use: to buy chickens, meat, seafood, rice, fruit, sodas, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales y venta de verduras,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar verduras como zanahorias,cebollas y tomates.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to be in the farming and livestock business. She also keeps working in the animal husbandry and vegetables sales business. Through these small businesses, she wants to support her family to get ahead. 

The borrower's dream is to expand the vegetables sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables like carrots, onions, and tomatoes. She is happy about the loan and commits to comply with her installment's payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like carrots, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina offers native delicacies to buyers in her local community. At 63 years old she still works hard to sustain her family's basic needs. She also raises hogs as an additional source of income.

Silvina would like to minimize her expenses for traveling to and from the market to grind her glutinous rice. Instead, she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP which will allow her to buy her own manual equipment for rice grinding, 3 kgs of glutinous rice, sugar, and glutinous flour for her food vending business.

Silvina hopes that lenders will approve her loan request for further growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy manual equipment for rice grinding, 3 kgs of glutinous rice, sugar, and glutinous flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Don Mario de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa,  él se dedica a la venta de fruta de temporada, además tiene una sastrería confecciona ropa por encargo, tiene 6 años de experiencia en las ventas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mango, naranjas, aguacates,  etc. todo por mayor  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don Mario is 53 years old, lives at home with his wife, he makes a living selling seasonal fruits, in addition he has tailor shop where he makes custom-made clothing, he has six years of  experience in sales, his business is located in his place of residence and with what he earns working, he is able to get ahead with the home expenses, he is applying for a loan in order to purchase mangoes, oranges, avocados, etc. all for wholesale and so will be able to have better economic income in order to have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: Purchase of mangoes, oranges, avocados, etc. all wholesale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old, married and mother of a daughter. In order to provide the best living conditions to her family, in addition to her administrative job, two months ago she became a greengrocer. Sometimes Virginia takes her daughter to the business because she does not have a nanny.
She wants to grow her business and turn it into a formal establishment so she can have financial stability. She has a lot of competitors in the market and she tries to offer the best price to attract more clients. For that reason she is asking for a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy fruits and vegetables in high quantities in order to make inventory and expand her customers base. 
Virginia will be very grateful if lenders support her business to continue growing and she will earn higher income and settle her obligations on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.en: Dulce Maria is 51 years old and lives with her husband. A few months ago she started a perfumes and accessories business. Dulce Maria launched this business as a hobby, but she started making higher profits than she expected. For that reason she wants to turn her business into a formal establishment. Dulce Maria is asking for a loan of MXN 5,000 to stock and get a new line of products such as handbags, jewelry, necklaces, earrings and bracelets. She is always looking for new opportunities to succeed so her grandchildren may follow her example. With this loan she will earn higher earnings and fulfill her obligations on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, handbags, necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: An independent and passionate in business woman, Claudia is 49 years old, divorced and responsible for her three children. She is a woman who had always struggled to get ahead her children by herself. To provide the best to her children, three years ago Claudia started a business planning and coordinating events such as weddings, christenings and parties. She has to rent equipment for events and it generates her higher expenses. For that reason she is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to purchase chairs and tables and offer a new concept at a better price. In addition to planning events, Claudia has a small real estate business. Claudia is an active woman who in addition to her businesses takes her time to read, go to the movies or go for a bike ride around town. Her dream is to be a recognized wedding planner because her commitment and values are what make customers feel in confidence. The greatest happiness Claudia has is to meet customers and see that they had started a family. She is very committed to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс молодой и шустрый парень из северного городка под названием Худжанд. Ему 27 лет. Он очень добрый и всегда думает о семье. Он живет вместе с мамой, женой и маленьким ребенком. Фирдавс имеет не большой магазин продуктов питания. Также в теплое время года он занимается продажей мороженого. Он обожает это период, потому что он любит детей и большую часть клиентов составляет маленькие клиенты. 
   Фирдавс планирует открыть маленькое кафе. На площадке возле его магазина есть не большое место, где он в скором времени разместит столы и стулья. По началу он будет продавать только мороженное и напитки потом по маленькому расширять бизнес. Фирдавс сильный и целеустремленный человек. Он верит, ему способствует удача.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young and nimble man from the northern town of Khujand. He is 27 years old. He is very kind and always thinking of his family. He lives with his mother, wife, and child. Firdavs owns a small food shop. He also sells ice cream during the warm seasons. He loves this time of year, because he loves children and most of his ice cream clients are kids. Firdavs plans to open a small cafe. In the square by his shop there is a small spot where he can put out tables and chairs. At first he will only sell ice cream and drinks but he plans to expand the offerings bit by bit. Firdavs is a strong, purposeful and ambitious person. He believes he will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 46 years old and married with three children. One of his children has completed high school, while the others are still in school.
 
Enoch believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can purchase more oil palm seedlings and expand his oil palm field. The extra income will allow him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 46 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.

Kwame is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 28 years old and married with a child.

Dominic believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can purchase more oil palm seedlings and expand his oil palm field. The extra income will allow him to fund his child's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field and fund his child's education

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a safety officer at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 22 years old and single.

Jackson believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable, and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can purchase more oil palm seedlings, and expand his oil palm field. The extra income will allow him to support his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es: Rosa de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace5 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene es como puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, su esposo también le ayuda en los gastos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 32 years old and lives at home with her husband, she has been making a living for the past 5 years in agriculture, growing corn and millet, she sells her products in different markets that are found close to her home, with the income that she earns is how she handles household expenses, her husband also helps with the expenses, she is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc, and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to be able to continue her work and have better income.

loans.use: purchase of seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill. He also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are attending school.

Kennedy believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and that it helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can purchase more oil palm seedlings and expand his oil palm field. The extra income will allow him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 45 years old and married with two children; both of them are in primary school. 

Kwame is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in primary school.

Martin is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia  Juana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner Juana continues dedicating herself to the business of raising animals, she raises guinea pigs and hens, she, through this group wants to have her own grocery store since it is her dream to have her own business,  she also wants to have a larger place in order to sell her animals. The member is applying for a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and hens as well as food for the animals.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to completing the payments of her share.

loans.use: The partner is applying for a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens as well as food for the animals-

loans.name: Ingrid Lissette

texts.es: Ingrid de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos desde hace 3 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como ha podido salir adelante con su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa y cosméticos por mayor,  para seguir con su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en: Ingrid is 31 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter, she has been making a living selling clothes and cosmetics for the past three years her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers, thanks to the sales that she makes she has been able to get by with her daughter, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of clothes and cosmetics for wholesale, in order to continue with her business as well as be able to have better income to give a better quality of life to her daughter.

loans.use: purchase of clothes and cosmetics for wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy domestic appliances and clothes.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru: Гулсун вместе с семьей живет на районе Шахритус. Ей 20 лет. Она еще не замужем. Гулсун как и многие жители республики занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, Этим видом деятельности она занята более 3 года. В работе на земле  помогает ее родители. Ее деятельность является семейной. Гулсун имеет не большую часть земли, где она выращивает растение. Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее цель обработать землю минеральными удобрениями и закончить посев. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по той причине она обратилась за кредитом. Гулсун надеется на Вашу помощь и считает, что с Вашей помощью она сможет закончить посев и на следующий сезон собрать богатый урожай.
texts.en: Gulsun lives with her family in the region of Shahrituz. She is 20 years old. She is not married yet. Gulsun, like many people in Tajikistan, works in agriculture. She has been working in farming for over three years. Her parents help her on the farm - it's a family business. Gulsun has a small plot of land where she grows her crops. She is preparing to plant a new crop and has therefore applied for a loan. Right now her objective is to fertilize the soil and finish sowing the crop. But in order to purchase all the fertilizer she needs, she must apply for a loan. Gulsun is relying on your help and hopes that with your help she will be able to complete the sowing and have a bountiful harvest next season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia lives in the town of Tudela and exclusively retails bananas. She purchases unripe bananas in bulk and sells them at retail in the neighboring towns. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase sacks and a weighing scale for her banana retailing business. She hopes to purchase a hauling truck for easy transport, for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks and a weighing scale for her banana retailing business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica has considerably savings for the renovation of her house in Tudela. As a mother of 4 children, she has dreamed of having her house fixed. 

Recently, she received a loan to purchase nails, wood and paint. 

Jessica has high hopes to expand her fish selling and sari-sari store so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase nails, wood, and paint

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Emeliana has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell in the market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emeliana has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 62 years old and married, with four children and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, candies, etc. to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beer, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a van transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling batteries.  Susan is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies for the maintenance of her van transportation business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a machinery rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lorena is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy new tools and pay for the repair of her machinery.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and pay for repair.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is married, 62 years old and has six children, one of whom is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edelita requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Edelita has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Absolom

texts.en:
Absolom, 25, is a single father of three; twin boys aged 3 and a girl aged 7. Being a young father, Absolom is tasked with the duty of fending for his family. He's doing this through a food kiosk. 

He has been serving mainly traditional African foods but now wants to expand his menu to appeal to more customers. He wants to start selling chips and sausages popularly knows as "Russians". He is requesting a loan to buy a deep freezer for storage purposes and a deep fryer for the chips. 

Absolom is young and ambitious. He aspires to own a chain of restaurants located all over the province.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and a deep fryer

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon owns a small farm with a daughter in Cheay Sampov Village. She has 4 independent children who live near by.  Besides her small business at home, Yon owns 3 hectares of land for growing cashews. At the age of 49 years old, she wants to live comfortably. 

Yon has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. She needs to recharge the battery 2 or 3 times every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, Yon’s children recommended their mother use a solar home system and promise to help support with her finances. As a result, she decided to apply for KIVA loan to buy solar home energy. 

Yon believes solar home energy can enhance her living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Cheay Sampove Village, Sambo Commune, Prasat Sambo

loans.name: Felze

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Felze works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Felze is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Felze has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 54 years old and is married with five children.

Mila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Mila has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mila aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 49 years old. She is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works with dairy products like milk, curds and butter to sell. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk to different tea stalls daily. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one more cow to increase his income in the milk sales business. So, Zainab asked for a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and is married with two children. With both children still in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Marites has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Delu

texts.en:
Delu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rafin Tabo Village. Delu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  

In the past, Delu suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Delu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Delu can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm supplies that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney worked as a farm hand for 20 years, dutifully saving his income until he had enough to buy a second-hand van and start a public transport business. The father of four works hard to fend for his family and make ends meet.  

Unfortunately, the business came to a halt earlier this year because the van broke down. He is requesting a loan to buy a new fuel pump system and to repair the worn-down seats. This will ensure that his taxi gets back on the road and that his business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy a new fuel pump system for his taxi and to repair its worn-down seats

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 48-year-old woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like garments, etc..

Virginia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Nida has been in this business for several years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 26 years old and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Jocel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Jocel has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jocel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Rebecca has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fertilized duck eggs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam, like all mothers, wants to provide good life for her six children. She is an ambitious, patient and simple woman.  Ibtesam could not complete her education because of the financial crisis that her family had faced, but that did not prevent her from becoming a productive woman.  She opened her own business, a small restaurant, selling snacks on a busy street.

Now Ibtesam is applying for her second loan to help her expand her business and to promote it.  Also, she wants to use this loan to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant and some new supplies.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant and new supplies.

loans.name: Maribel Esperanza

texts.es: Maribel es una microempresaria exitosa de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para prosperar y darles un mejor futuro, ella se dedica a la elaboración de repostería y ventas de productos Avon desde hace seis años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar y queso.
texts.en: Maribel is a successful small business owner.  She is 28 years old, married and mother of two children, who are her biggest motivation to thrive and give them a better future.  For the past 6 years, she earns a living making and selling baked goods and selling Avon products. She request this loan for the purchase of flour, butter, sugar and cheese.

loans.use: to purchase of flour, butter, sugar and cheese

loans.name: Katherine Joyce

texts.en:
Katherine Joyce is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Katherine Joyce is 27 years old and has three children currently in school.

Katherine Joyce has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Katherine Joyce has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married, with one child.   She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 48 years old now.

Susan has a business buying and selling cardboard cartons in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cartons to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 13 years.   In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cartons to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married, with three children, all three still in school.. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 37 years old.

Jocelyn has a business buying and selling pottery in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more pots and vases to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pots and vases to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 42 years old now.

Thelma has a business selling food in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Thelma has been in this business for 15 years.   In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family.   She is widowed, and she has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell, like squash, bananas, cabbages, papaya, carrots, and  potatoes.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years now, and she also earns income from fish vending and a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell, like squash, bananas, cabbages, papaya, carrots, and potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de especies (ajonjolí, achiote, pimienta, etc.) tiene 15 años de tener su negocio el cual inicio con capital propio, vende de manera ambulante por los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas especies por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She works selling spices (sesame, annatto, pepper. etc.).  She has had this business for 15 years, which she started with her own capital. She sells as a street vendor around the area where she lives. She is requesting a loan to buy more spices at wholesale prices in order to continue with her sales and have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more spices (sesame, annatto, pepper, etc.) at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Salome has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 54 years old and married.  She has eleven children, two of whom are in school.

Aurea is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aurea has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aurea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  

In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ayuba has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea is a 40-year-old single woman from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She has a pensioner father and a student daughter. The only breadwinner in the family is Medea, who has her private activity. She has a store with various kinds of home products, such as detergents and personal use products. She works as a saleslady on her own and has loyal customers among local people and passersby as well. Medea has a great desire to make her business activity more productive in order to meet the family costs more effectively. She requested a loan among local credit providers and was approved within the start up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the requested amount Medea plans to purchase additional brand products which are more famous among people. This will give her a chance to attract more clients and increase sales. Medea and her family members will be very grateful for the financial support and the help making the business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products and expand trade.

loans.name: Ubertina

texts.es:
La socia Ubertinase sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia tambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha (es una bebida a base de maiz), la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ubertina continues to run her business of raising animals. She is now also running a business selling chicha (it is a drink made from corn)and raises guinea pigs and chickens. The member through this business wants put up her own grocery store as it is her dream to have her own business. She also wants to have a larger place to sell her animals. She requests this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and food for animals.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to meet the payments of her installments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens and also food for animals.

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es: Gloria de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, café y chocolate desde hace 15 años se dedica a esa venta la cual inicio con capital propio, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chocolate, pan dulce, café y un termo donde anda las bebidas y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Gloria is 58 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children. For 15 years she has sold sweet bread, coffee and chocolate. She started this business with her own capital. She sells as a street vendor at the different markets close to her house. She is requesting a loan to buy chocolate, sweet bread, coffee and a thermos to transport drinks and be able to continue with her job, because it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, sweet bread and a thermos to transport drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tools, wrenches, screwdrivers, pliers, etc. and buy inputs for his foods such bread, sausages, meats, sauces, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Grapehalp

texts.en:
GRAPEHALP is a social organization working to support people with disabilities. It was founded on June 14th, 2011 under the leadership of Micheline. It is composed of people with disabilities and parents of disabled people.

Its activities cover two municipalities: Limbé and Port-Margot. Its main activities are: culture and sales of vegetable products; cow breeding, goats and sale of cows. It also implements small social studies projects for people with disabilities.

Over the years, GRAPEHALP has done farming and trades of cows as a priority to support its members and generate revenue within the organization. Now GRAPEHALP would like to strengthen its business, satisfy a larger clientele, and reach more members through the purchase of three new oxen. Two oxen will be killed and sold by the piece to its members and retailers; the other will be dedicated to breeding. Your loan will help GRAPEHALP make a step further towards its goal.

The members in the picture can be identified as:

From right to left in the first row: Micheline, Jean Baptiste, Elissema.
From left to right in the second row: Léo, Yvoir, Youselande,Marie-Claude, Anne- Edith, Heberne, Gerson.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Roberte

texts.en:
Roberte is a female entrepreneur who graduated in naturopathy. She decided to offer her first array of natural cosmetics in Haiti by her company in 2000. She gave much time to the business because it was a source of comfort for her. Quickly the sales went up.

Willing to showcase her products, she managed to open a distribution stand at the national airport in 2005. As she noticed the attraction of the Caribbean, a new branch was opened in Grenada; then in the USA. She hires five people to help her run the business.

She applied for a loan in order to meet the demand and launched her 31 newly tested products:

• body soap
• body lotions
• insect repellents

Your contribution will help Roberte achieve her goals while empowering women in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a generator, 2 drums, 4,000 plastic bottles, an automatic cutter, and labels.

loans.name: Saveur D'oree

texts.en: Saveur d’Orée Production is a small company launched and run by Samantha and Claudin since the beginning of 2012. It specializes in cocoa processing. It produces chocolate and reinforces the national production. They both are the main workers for the company, but they support more than 10 people in husking the cocoa during the processing period. To meet the increasing demand of their customers, they are seeking a loan to double their productivity while creating another part-time job.

loans.use: to purchase a husker, a plastic machine, 200 pounds of cocoa, and raw materials

loans.name: Plantation Sans Frontieres

texts.en:
Plantation Sans Frontière was launched by the Tiréus family to answer erosion problems in Acul-du Nord. After discussing community issues, they found many reasons to forward seedling activities such as degradation of the environment and erosion issues. Then they thought the agricultural sector could be the best way to contribute to the development of a country, and particularly to the community of Acul-du-Nord. Through their dynamism, they have a contract to deliver seedlings to USAID, in the AVANSE program. The business has now hires three employees.

Their goal is to produce nurseries in order to facilitate farmers and people in the community to continue with planting activities. This is a strategy that they put up to strengthen the agricultural sector. A lot of progress has been made and the business has supported a few activities such as providing some scholar kits and the delivery of seedlings to families to encourage them to plant. To reach their goal, Walex and Guernie are seeking a loan to purchase raw materials and equipment to better organize the production and meet the current demand.

loans.use: to purchase a hose, a pump spray, 40 packs of bags, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sedah

texts.en:
Sedah was launched in February 2012 by Erode to reinforce the agricultural sector. It is an individual enterprise that specializes in providing equipment to farmers and producing seedlings. To do so, they do different activities such as poultry and nurseries.

Sedah is seeking a loan to produce more in order to respond to the demands of the project of PTTA from the Ministry of Agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase 100 bags of pesticides, 100 bags of manure, a wheelbarrow, a shovel, and some other materials.

loans.name: Royal

texts.en: Royal is a high fashion school that began in 2008 under the leadership of Mrs. Jocelyne. She soon awoke her entrepreneurial instincts when she noticed that then number of students in the school started to decrease. Next to the school, she opened a sewing workshop and a supply store. Thanks to her marketing strategy, the following year the turnover doubled. Now, Jocelyne is seeking a loan to purchase new stock of cloth and sewing supplies to avoid running out of stock, and then to increase her turnover.

loans.use: to purchase 7 clothes rollers , 200 dozens collars, 4000 dozen cuffs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is a 52-year-old farmer from Tudela. She has a rice land that earns well for the family. She signed up her membership with the cooperative for access to capital needs. She applied for another loan to purchase farm inputs. Arsenia hopes to have a good harvest so that she can save for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Chiyembekezo Group

texts.en:
Tereza is aged 35 and has six children whose responsibility lies in her hands. She sells usipa (small fish) in order to adequately support her family, but despite these efforts, life is a struggle for her. As such, she decided to take a loan so she could sufficiently meet the needs of her family members by being able to pay their medical bills and school fees. She would like to obtain a loan to expand her business, increasing her stock of fish.

Tereza plans to build a better house for her family members. Although she still faces some minor challenges, accessing loans has improved her living standards as she is now able to provide food for her family members.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Жительнице района Шахритус 34 год ее зовут Парвина. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Муж Парвины занимается строителем. Она живет вместе мужем и детьми. Парвина любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Парвина занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота всего один год. Она покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Парвина быстро учиться и за столь короткое время она освоила свою работу на отлично. Парвина обратилась за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Она считает, что набралась опыта и пора продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Парвина за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи.
texts.en: Parvina is 34 years old and lives in the region of Shahrituz. She is married and has four children. Parvina's husband works in construction. She lives with her husband and children. Parvina loves animals and that's why she raises cattle. Parvina has been raising cattle for just one year. She buys young calves and fattens them up before reselling them on the livestock market. Parvina is a fast learner and in only a short time has become excellent at her work. She has applied for a loan in order to expand her business. She thinks she has gained enough experience to take her business to the next level. Parvina will purchase several young calves with the money she borrows. This loan will enable her to achieve her goals and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and to expand her cattle-raising business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has six children who are in school.

Stella has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Stella has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to resell.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children and lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been successfully running a goods distributor business in his society. He has two years of experience in this field. Her husband purchases stock of goods from the market at wholesale prices and distributes them to different general stores, grocery shops, etc. with profitable prices.

He wants to grow his business so Shazia requested a loan to financially support her husband. Her husband will buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand. Her husband is expecting a boost in his earnings and dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Shazia is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his goods distributor business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a brilliant, hardworking, 46-year-old Kenyan lady whose home is on a small farmland in a remote village called Kipsaiya. She gets a lot of help and support running her business from her handsome husband and their lovely children. In a bid to expand her farm, Esther is seeking a KES 15,000 loan to purchase farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed.

Currently, she sells different varieties of crops at Kipsaiya. To boost the quantity of produce she sells, she needs a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She also needs to purchase tools and implements that will be used to work on the increased acreage. Esther will use any money made from this investment to help her husband meet the family's basic needs. She will also save for future investments into the business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farm implements

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 32 years old and single with three children.  With two children still in school, Chona works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, sugar and personal care products.

Chona has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, sugar and personal care products

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is divorced and has five children.  After her husband left his duties towards their children, she started her own business to be able to cover the needs of the children without help from anybody.

Rajaa sells household supplies in her home.  She started her work with a low quantity of products, and now she wants to expand her work, to earn a higher standard of living. She has applied for a loan to help her buy more products to sell and thus improve her life and save  for the education for her kids.

loans.use: to help her buy more products to sell and improve her life.

loans.name: Gloria Cielo

texts.en:
Gloria Cielo is married, with two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria Cielo is 44 years old.

Gloria Cielo has a business selling ready-to-wear  in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Gloria Cielo has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 54 years old and married. She has four children. 

Lina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Lina has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old woman. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Farzana is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people from her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Farzana requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as she requested. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her own stitching work

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 17 años de edad, y su negocio es el tejido de manta de alpaca.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Villa Mercedes’, Situado a pocos metros de la zona Franca, está habitada por más de 300 familias, la mitad son mineros relocalizados y la otra mitad son migrantes del altiplano. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de mantas de Alpaca y Vicuña, actividad que realiza con ayuda de su hijo. Ella se encarga del hilado que consiste en convertir los retazos de lana en hilo, de forma artesanal. Su hijo colabora con el tejido porque es una labor más sencilla, “inicie mi negocio desde muy joven vendiendo lana y ayudando en el tejido para otras personas, mi primer tejido fueron 2 mantas, las vendí y fui incrementando mi capital hasta contar con clientes continuos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su hijo ayuda con la mano de obra, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de lana. Su sueño es tener un taller amplio y exportar sus tejidos, ella desea comprar lana de Alpaca y Vicuña por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de varios tipos de lana por mayor para abrir un taller amplio y exportar sus tejidos.
texts.en: Martha is a 42 year old woman. She is single and has a 17 year old son. Her business is to knit alpaca blankets. She is a good woman, enterprising, independent, constant, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business in the area of ‘Villa Mercedes’, located few meters from the free trade zone, inhabited by more than 300 families: half of them are relocated miners and the other half are immigrants from the highlands. The weather here is cold and dry, with temperatures varying between 0-12 degrees Celsius during the day. Martha is dark skinned, with brown eyes, black long hair which she wears braided, short, stocky. She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and skirt). Her native language is Aymará which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and in her job. She shares her life with her son, who attends school. They live in their own house, built with brick and cement, with corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is making weaved fabrics in alpaca and vicuna, a job she does with her son. She takes care of the weaving which consists of converting the pieces of fabric from wool into thread in a craftmanship way. Her son helps with the weaving because it is a simpler job. “I started my business when I was very young by selling wool and helping other people with fabrics. My first weaving were 2 blankets. I sold them and started to increase my capital until I had my set customers...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that her son helps her with hand labor; the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy wool. Her dream is to have a bigger workshop and to export her fabrics. She wants to buy alpaca and vicuna wool at wholesale prices. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years she has been working in this job. These are the reasons why Martha is requesting a loan to buy various types of wool at wholesale prices in order to open a bigger workshop and export her fabrics.

loans.use: to buy various types of wool at wholesale prices to open a big workshop and export her fabrics.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Without the Jeepney business, there would probably be no Michelle. For several years now, Michelle has been busy operating and depending on the inventory. Michelle is really working very hard and patiently to improve the present status of her business. 

Recently, Michelle availed a loan worth PHP 14,000. This indeed has helped in maintaining the household, both in financial and educational needs of the family members, especially the children. 

To continue her business enterprise, Michelle would like to take out another PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to pay for the maintenance and renewal of her Jeepney franchise. With hope and determination, she believes that someday her family will be able to be successful and that her business will experience full expansion. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and renewal of her Jeepney franchise so that she can continue to operate her business.

loans.name: Herawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of our lenders, Herawati. Herawati lives in Cilegon, Banten, located about a 2 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two daughters. She owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products, small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. To help her husband improve their life, she decided to join Ruma. She feels happy because ever since she joined Ruma, she can improve her business and save more money for another business opportunity. Her community sees her as a hard-working and friendly woman, as well as a trusted mobile services provider.

She was excited to become a Ruma agent because she wanted to learn to start up a business selling mobile phone airtime credits. Because her small business keeps improving, she wants to continue it. She feels happy that she can give access to those who need it in her community.

As the business runs, Herawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community.  As seen in the photo, Herawati is standing in her own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Angel Bolivar

texts.es: Angel tiene 36 años de edad es soltero vive con su hijos y sus padres en chimbo provincia de Bolivar. El se dedica a la fabricación de fuegos artificiales, solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para incrementar su capital de trabajo y realizar mas y vender para tener mas ingresos ya que por falta de capital no puede fabricar, el realiza las compras en Guaranda, su sueño es progresar y salir adenlante, en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Angel is 36 years old.  He is single and lives with his children and his parents in Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar.  

He works making fireworks.  He is requesting this loan to purchase materials to increase his working capital so he can make and sell more fireworks.  He will have more income since his lack of capital means he cannot make anything.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda.  His dream is to progress and move forward.  

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make fireworks.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen runs a small canned-food production company in Armavir town. In the summer season, he also organizes dried food production and exports the produce products to neighboring countries. 

Karen lives with his wife and two children, a son and daughter. Karen's wife works in the secondary school as a teacher. 

Karen has applied for this loan to be able to purchase  raw materials needed for his canned food production,  He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Karen hopes to receive lenders' support to invest on his production business and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed for  canned food production

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy is 21 years old, single, and a student. He is from the Kampot Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in tourism, and is in his second year at a university in the city. 

His father is a taxi driver, and his mother is a grocer. Because Rithy is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 41 years old, and she is married with 5 children. 4 of her children are in school.

Jasmin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

Jasmin has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before. She has been running her general store for 5 years, though she also earns income from farming rice.

Jasmin aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karen Esthefania

texts.es:
Karen tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive en chimbo provincia de Bolivar,
Ella estudia y vende ropa, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia para incrementar su capital y mejorar su economía, realiza las compras en Ambato cada mes, su sueño es ser profecional y llegar a tener un trabajo estable, en su tiempo libre sale a bailar con sus amigos.
texts.en:
Karen is 19 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives in Chimbo in the province of Bolivar. She studies and sells clothing. 
She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to increase her capital and improve her economic situation. She makes purchases in Ambato each month.
Her dream is to be a professional and to have a stable job. In her free time she goes out dancing with her friends.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Eldy

texts.es:
Eldy es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de madera de eucalipto.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, inteligente, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el cruce ‘Viacha’ caracterizada por ser un área de paso para el transporte a otras ciudades. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Eldy es tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello legro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su padre que trabaja, con su hermana que también trabaja y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de madera de eucalipto para construcción y para todo uso. Este tipo de madera es especial para ser usada en paletas, chapa decorativa, molduras, muebles, suelos y pisos de parket, “aprendí el negocio de mi madre que fue una de las primeras en este comercio, luego me hice cargo del negocio…” comenta. Paralelamente a su trabajo ella se encuentra realizando los trámites para obtener el título de enfermera profesional. La ventaja de su negocio es que ya se encuentra establecido desde hace muchos años, la desventaja son las temporadas de falta de madera. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y trabajar en su profesión para tener ambas actividades, ella desea realizar la compra de madera por mayor para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Eldy solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para cumplir con sus pedidos y con los beneficios tramitar su titulo profesional.
texts.en: Eldy is a 36 year old woman. She is single and has an 11 year old son. Her business is selling eucalyptus wood. She is a good mother, enterprising, intelligent, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business at the ‘Viacha’ crossing, characterized by being a crossing area for transportation to other cities. The weather here is cold and dry, with temperatures varying between 0-12 degrees Celsius during the day. Eldy is dark skinned, with brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied, short and thin. Her native language is Aymara, spoken in the place, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and in her job. She lives with her father with whom she works, with her sister who also works, and with her son who attends school. They live in their own house, built in brick and cement, with corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is selling eucalyptus wood for construction and for all use. This type of wood is special for use in palettes, decorative panels, moldings, furniture, floors and parquet floors. "I learned the business from my mother who was one of the first in this business. Later, I took care of the business...", she comments. Parallel to her job, she is working in obtaining the certificate of professional nurse. The advantage of her business is that it is already well established for many years; the disadvantage are the seasons when wood is lacking. Her dream is to improve her business and to work in her profession in order to have both activities. She wants to buy wood at wholesale prices in order to fulfill her customers' orders. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 17 years she is working in this job. These are the reasons why Eldy is requesting a loan to buy wood to fulfill her orders, and with the benefits to pay for her professional certificate.

loans.use: to buy wood to fulfill her orders, and with the benefits to pay for her professional certificate.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda desde hace 2 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce, jugos, granos básicos, leche etc. todo por mayor y así surtir mas la tienda para atender mejor  a sus clientes y ella tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Sandra is 31 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. She has had a store for two years. Her business is located in her place of residence.
