With the sales that she makes and the help of her husband, she manages to come out ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy sweet bread, juices, basic grains, milk, etc. wholesale. In this way she will be able to stock the store to better serve her customers and have an improved economic income.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, juices, basic grains, milk, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ester runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years and she sells a variety of items such as cereals, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, toothpaste, etc. 

Ester would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support of Ma. Teresita. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to buy more merchandise for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she had started, she would like to avail herself of another 20,000 PHP that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Teresita's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life to her family. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 57 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Reynalda works very hard to provide for them.

Reynalda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, school supplies and other groceries. She has been in this business for 31 years. 

In the future, Reynalda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José, tiene 49 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su madre e hijo en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, Lleva 3 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, el cual vende en la misma zona y obtiene sus ingresos. El préstamo que esta solicitando es por 5,500 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicarle a su cultivo de café para mejorar la próxima producción. Su plan es seguir con el cultivo y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old. He is single, and he has one son. He lives with his mother and son in a village in the city of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. He has always made a living cultivating basic grains such as corn and beans. For the past 3 years, he has had his own coffee crops, which he sells in the area in order to earn an income.

He is requesting a loan of 5,500 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and supplies for his coffee crops in order to improve his next yield. His plan is to continue with his crops and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who have all grown up. 

Cresencia earns her living from her hog fattening business. She has been engaged in this business for 2 years already. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month and that amount is so helpful to meet her needs. She has requested a loan to purchase 2 additional piglets, sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog fattening business. 

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Cresencia hopes to expand her hog fattening business by constructing additional piggery buildings.

loans.use: to purchase 2 additional piglets, sacks of booster, and grower feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and 5 sheep in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Zinnatoi

texts.en:
Zinnatoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977, and she lives in the district with her family. She is married and has three children. 

Zinnatoi has a big yard where she plants apples and agricultural products including cereals and corns. She also keeps livestock and sells in the domestic market. She knows how to take care of her land and livestock well, and she wants to expand her business and make it more efficient. She asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nona works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales and her general store business. Nona is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nona has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old and married with three children. All of her children are sent in school.

Esther works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Esther has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Esther aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs in technical and software skills

loans.name: Pandu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Pandu. Pandu lives in Cilegon, Banten, located about two hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Pandu owns a small stall where he sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He knew Ruma from one of sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as a family man (because he cares so much to his family), as well as a trusted mobile provider.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Pandu sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Pandu improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Pandu is the one who is smiling and standing. He is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Gina has a selling jewelries business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more jewelries to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell to her customers to help send her children to college

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herminia is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Herminia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Herminia has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Herminia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 71 years old and widowed with two children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 36 years.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Janet is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies to help expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs so he may study technical and software skills

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 36-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home. Her husband has been running a small printing press business for three years. Flex is a sheet of polythene widely used to deliver high quality digital print for outdoor hoardings and banners mainly printed on large color plotters. These prints are used instead of handwritten banners for the low cost and durability. Shagufta's husband prints advertisement banners and logos on order. He wants to increase his current business, but he does not have sufficient money to buy more supplies for his printing press and advertisement business. Therefore, Shagufta requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Shagufta is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to increase her husband's printing press and advertisement work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs for her technical and software skills

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is conscience woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in small town with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She has ten years of experience doing business in the domestic market. She is responsible, goal oriented and honest person. She buys and sells kid’s wear and has permanent clients every day. 

Each month she goes to the central market and buys a new collection of clothes for sale. She does business in order to feed her family and ensure her children. She asked a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy a new assortment of clothes. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
Navbahor is a conscience woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has four children. 

She is a tailor and additionally she wants to buy livestock to grow and then sell in her meat stall. She is planning to rent a small place to have as a meat stall and supply residents with fresh meat. She is goal-oriented, honest and a kind person. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy livestock and earn money to feed her family. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock and earn money to feed her family

loans.name: Maria Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maria Leah works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Maria Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lorna

texts.en:
Ma. Lorna is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ma. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Lorna has been in this business for 5 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Ma. Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 39 years old and has three children.

Narcisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Narcisa has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 43 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Charita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as salt, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, dried fish, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 64 years old and has four children. Teofila is a married woman.

Teofila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teofila requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teofila has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is 25 years old and married woman. She has four children between the ages of 1 and 5. She describes herself to be a hardworking lady. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and blankets. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in her home, and her primary customers are regular. 

Majeda describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She applied for a loan to buy more inventories of clothes and blankets. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more inventories of clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is 23 years old, single, and she is still in the age of flowers. She depends on herself, but she was not able to complete her education because of the financial crises that her family has faced. 

Hadeel is working in a clothes shop to help her family cover their household expenses. Because she is an ambitious lady, she works hard to achieve her dreams and she is hoping to become a partner in the shop that she is working in. Therefore, she applied for a loan to pay for her share of her shop and to buy more kinds of cloths and head covers to sell that will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of cloths and head covers to sell.

loans.name: Natijamo

texts.en:
Natijamo is a communicable woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has four children. She is an honest, kind and confident person. She is doing business in the domestic market; selling kid’s wear. 

She has many year of experience in this field and knows well her business. She wants to perform her activity well and buy a new assortment of kid’s clothing. She appealed to Kiva and IMON to buy a collection of clothes for kids. She hopes to be supported by Kiva and IMON.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothes for kids

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is involved in food vending. She offers a variety of vegetables within her local community. She is married and has three grown children. According to Perlita, she has a vegetable garden where she grows the variety of vegetables she offers. She is also engaged in hog raising and rice farming.

Perlita is seeking additional capital in the amount of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy a variety of vegetable seeds such as seeds for squash, string beans, and okra. She would be grateful if her loan request is granted.

loans.use: buy vegetable seeds such as seeds for squash, string beans, and okra for her vegetable farmland

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries. She has been in this business for 8 years now. 

In the future, Joan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies, so she can send her children to college

loans.name: Suharto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! No it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Suharto. Suharto lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only son. Suharto works as an employee in one private company. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to become an entrepeneur. Together with his wife, he realized that they need to save more money for their children’s education. Suharto is a friendly and informative mobile provider, that’s why he has many customers. He also feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he can give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, Suharto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Suharto’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Suharto is the one who is smiling. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour, a farmer and also a employee in a company, lives in Lvea village that is far from a power grid. As a farmer and also employee, Hour works hard to support his family to live in comfortable conditions. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery, the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. 

He is applying Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Lvea Village, Svay Rumpair Commune, Kampong Leng D

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 22-year-old single man who opened a shop for buying and selling different birds to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and an ambitious young guy who is trying his best to develop his business. 

Therefore, today, he is acquiring a youth loan to increase his business merchandise with new kinds of birds and develop his work to satisfy his customers' needs.
This loan will help Osama make a step forward toward independence, as it will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new kinds of birds and develop his work to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is 28 years old from Minia. He is married and has a son and a daughter. 

He has an ice cream shop and it is the only source of income to Sherif's family. 

Sherif wishes he could expand his project and increase his income, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a new refrigerator and juice for sale along with ice-cream.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator and juice for sale along with ice-cream, this is the only support for his family

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is an honest woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an agrarian. She has 35 years of practice keeping livestock and trading in animal market. Her business is good and gives her enough money to feed her family. She also has a yard where her husband does a business planting agricultural products. 

The standard of living in their area is not well, and she tries to live in better conditions. She is planning to renovate her house and asks a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy construction supplies and renovate her house. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 38 years old and has two children. Maricel is married and has two children who are in school.

Maricel has a general store business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Maricel has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Elviza

texts.en:
Elviza is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by selling fish in the Philippines. Elviza is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Elviza has been selling fish for 21 years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
This is Felista Kahindi. She is a grocery seller who buys fruits and vegetables from farmers in the villages. She comes to the urban centers to sell the produce at better prices. With the money she gets from her sales she is able to cater for her family needs and school her children. 

She encourages women to go out and get self employment in order to better themselves while supporting their spouses. With a Kiva loan she will increase her fruit stock.

loans.use: to buy fruit stocks from farmers for resale in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her buy more products to sell and to increase her merchendise.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 19 years old young man from the village of Marani. He lives with his parents and pensioner grandmother. The family members earn a living with a  small agribusiness. Particularly, they are engaged in pig breeding, in cultivating agricultural land and harvesting nuts. They get a small income from selling agricultural products at the local market. For increasing the family's living condition and more effectively meet the daily costs, Zurab decided to start dairy farming. 

He wants to purchase cattle and requested a loan among local financial institutions. His loan request was approved in the frame of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. The family members will raise them and, after 12 months, will start milking. They will start production of cheese and yogurt for selling and for family-use also.

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family's income will significantly increase and Zurab will make his bit to the family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and expand agribusiness

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home systems

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is 42 years old. She is divorced; her husband left her with two children, and since then she has raised her children alone. Now she is living with her lovely family in the Fuzuli region as a refugee; the family members have been IDPs (internally displaced persons) from the city of Fuzuli for 23 years.

Nazakat has a little store. Today Nazakat is planning for the support of her business; she needs 1800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manats) to buy more goods (socks, slippers, galoshes, etc.) for resale. She says thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders for the loan and the help. In the future, Nazakat wants to increase her monthly income and give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
Yagub is married with two children. One of them is studying the first course of medical college. His younger child is 14 years old and is going to school. Yagub’s wife is a math teacher at the same school. The family is living in the Baku region, but they are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from the city of Fuzuli.

Yagub has been a taxi driver for 15 years. He wants to repair his car’s motor, so he has applied to Komak. He needs 1000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manats). He says thank to all the lenders at Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to repair his car’s motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale eggs, basic grains, juices, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by selling a coconut wine in the Philippines. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for 27 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut trees.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Iis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Lis. Lis lives in East Bandung, a suburban area located around four hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Lis is a housewife who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that coming to her house and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to start up a business. As a woman, Sumarni realized that she has to help her husband to improve their life. Her community sees her as a trusted and hardworking mobile provider.  

For now, lis is becoming an agent who sells mobile airtime credits for her community. As the business grows, she needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Lis’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Lis is the one who is sitting in her own house. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Chingamudzi Group

texts.en:
Edina used the previous loan she obtained to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. This helped her to successfully increase her profits. She used the profits to pay school fees for her children and send two of her children back to school, as they had dropped out due to lack of funds for school fees. Edina greatly thanks Kiva for the assistance that she was given by being granted a loan.

Edina is requesting another loan in order to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys her products in Lilongwe and resells them in her home area in Zomba.

Edina dreams of improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta sabanas, cubrecamas, fresadas, sobrefundas, etc. se dedica a las ventas desde hace 10 años vende en los pueblos aledaños en su moto, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
David, age 32, lives in his own home with his partner and his son.  He works selling sheets, bedspreads, blankets, pillowcases, etc.  He has worked in sales for 10 years.  He sells in neighboring towns on his motorcycle.  With what he earns from his profits, he has been able to cover some household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale to continue his sales and thereby be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, blankets, pillowcases, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Adriana Carol

texts.es:
Adriana es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas. 
Ella es emprendedora, inteligente, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla dentro de una escuela situado en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por su feria considerada las más grande del país, donde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Adriana es tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello legro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que se dedica al mismo negocio. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas como; refrescos, chocolates, dulces, papas fritas, etc., actividad que realiza adentro de una escuela en horarios de clases por las mañanas y tardes, “inicie mi negocio ayudando a vender a mi madre, ella se fue a otra escuela y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes en época de clases, la desventaja son los días en lo que no hay clases. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea incrementar su mercadería para ofertar mayor variedad y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adriana solicita un préstamo para incrementar su oferta de golosinas, mejorar sus ventas y estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 19 year old young lady, single, with no children, and your business is selling sweets.
She is enterprising, intelligent, patient, optimistic, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business within a school located in the '16 de julio' zone which is characterized by its fair considered the largest in the country. Here you can find everything from a pin to an agricultural tractor. It’s weather is Cold, dry with temperatures during the day varies between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Adriana has dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair which she ties back, a short stature and a thin physique. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish for the general public and for her business. She shares her life with her mother that does the same thing for a living. They live in a home built of brick and cement with a tin roof that has water, electricity and sewerage. 

Her business is selling treats like; soft drinks, chocolates, candy, chips, etc., which she does in a school during class hours in the mornings and evenings, "I started my business by helping my mother to sell, she went to another school and I became independent ... "she says. The advantage of her business is that sales are steady during school time, the downside are the days that there are no classes. Her dream is to have a stable business, she wants to increase her supply of merchandise to offer more variety and improve her sales. 

This is the 1st sequence of loans with the institution in the two years she has been running her business.
It is for these reasons that Adriana requesting a loan to increase its supply of treats, improve sales and stabilize its business.

loans.use: to increase her supply of treats, improve sales and stabilize her business.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en:
Gulnazi, a 40 year-old married woman, lives in village Dzveli Abasha. She has a husband, three children and a pensioner grandmother. The family has very poor living conditions, as they don't have any source of significant income for financial stability. They require financial support to get rid of poverty and live in a normal condition. Gulnazi and her husband get income from a small agricultural activity. They take care of pigs and chickens and sell them locally. However the income is really small for a 6-member family to cover even basic needs. She wants to purchase cattle and has requested a loan among local financial institutions. 

Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers,” because of low income. 

Gulnazi will place the purchased calves in an old cattle-shed located in the family yard. She will raise them, and after 12 months, will start milking them. Gulnazi will start production of cheese and she will sell it at the open market. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family's income will significantly increase and they will live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and start dairy-farming.

loans.name: Gerson Efrain

texts.es:
Gerson es un joven de 22 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia, por motivos familiares recientes decidió irse a vivir a la ciudad de Cochabamba. Gerson es el hijo mayor, sus dos pequeños hermanos continúan en el colegio,  comenta además que sus padres se divorciaron hace varios años atrás, por lo que su mamá empezó a trabajar en una librería el cual es la principal fuente de ingreso de su hogar.
Actualmente Gerson se dedica a tiempo completo en sus estudios, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder finalizar su carrera en Gastronomía, cumpliendo de esta manera su más grande sueño de volverse chef y así abrir su propio restaurante, para poder apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que su deseo es poder comprar una casa a su mamá y pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hermanos. 
Lo que más anhela Gerson es poder viajar a Japón para poder aprender nuevas técnicas de cocina y lograr una fusión entre la comida japonesa y la boliviana.
Gerson agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes a cumplir su sueño de ser profesional y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Gerson is a young man of 22 years, born in La Paz, Bolivia.  Due to recent family reasons, he decided to go live in the city of Cochabamba.  Gerson is the oldest son.  His two younger siblings are still in secondary school.  He also comments that his parents were divorced several years ago, and for that reason, his mother started working in a book store, which is the main income source for their home.

Currently, Gerson is a full-time student.  He is requesting a loan to be able to finish his degree in culinary arts.  This will let him fulfill his greatest dream of becoming a chef and opening his own restaurant, as well as of being able to economically support his family, since his wish is to be able to buy his mother a house and pay for his siblings’ university studies.

What Gerson longs for most is to be able to travel to Japan to be able to learn new cooking techniques and achieve a fusion between Japanese and Bolivian food.

Gerson is grateful to the people who, with their economic resources, help young people fulfill their dreams of being professionals, and who create new opportunities for growth.

loans.use: to pay for his degree in culinary arts.

loans.name: Edwin Fabian

texts.es: Edwin tiene 26 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar. El es chofer de un taxi, solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para cambiar a su carro ya que estan en mal estado, realiza la compra en Guaranda, su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida y en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chimbo, in Bolivar province.  He is a taxi driver and is requesting the loan to replace the tires of his car, as they are in poor condition. 

He makes his purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to improve his standard of living and in his free time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don Salvador de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un Carwash desde hace 4 años el cual lo inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes que lo buscan por que realiza un buen trabajo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina para bombear agua a presión ya que la que actualmente tiene está fallando y esa es parte de las herramientas que utiliza en su trabajo y con una nueva podrá realizar un mejor trabajo al gusto del cliente.
texts.en:
Salvador, age 50, lives in his own house with his family group.  He has owned a car wash for four years.  He started it with his own capital.  His business is located in his place of residence, and he has many customers who seek him out because he does good work.

He is requesting a loan to buy a machine to pump water by pressure, since the one he currently has is breaking down.  It is one of the tools he uses in his work, and with a new one, he will be able to perform better work to the customer’s liking.

loans.use: to buy a machine to pump water by pressure.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a married woman and a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myra is 37 years old and has five children who are in school. Myra has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myra has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like sugar, salt, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Myra has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to wear sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her ready-to-wear business.

Gena has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from sewing. Gena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is 29 years old from Minia. She is married to a driver and has 4 children. She works in sewing to help her husband with the family income. 

Her sewing machine is very old and this negatively affects her income. Safa has requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy a new sewing machine to sew more, and better quality, clothing in order to to increase her sales and the income to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in East Bandung, a suburban area located around four hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ani owns a small stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She heard of Ruma, Kiva's partner, when a Ruma’s sales executive came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to expand her business in technology. 

As a woman, Ai realizes that she has to help her husband to improve their life. Ani has motivation to become a successful entrepreneur. Her community sees her as a friendly and hardworking mobile services provider.

Ani is working to become an agent who sells mobile airtime credits for her community. As the business grows, she needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so that her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. 

Ani’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community via Ruma's latest product, called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Ani is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to help community members.

loans.name: Oscar Roberto

texts.es: En su taller de ornamentaciones que se encuentra ubicado en un barrio de la localidad sur de Barranquilla, Oscar de 55 años de edad, inició su negocio tras haber cursado estudios de soldadura industrial.  Este emprendedor hombre compró su equipo de soldadura y empezó a realizar trabajos a familiares y amigos, elaborados en hierro y en aluminio;  hoy en día realiza trabajos a nivel de empresas y cuenta con 15 años de experiencia.  Sus principales productos son los cerramientos en hierro, portones, puertas y ventanas en aluminio, protectores de ventanas y rejas, que ofrece mediante su propio catálogo y al momento de realizar la venta solicita una anticipo del 50% y el resto al momento de la instalación. En la actualidad Oscar está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de materia prima (hierro y aluminio) y en una pulidora y taladradora industrial.  Oscar considera que esta inversión mejora sus condiciones laborales y que puede realizar trabajos de mejor calidad. Es padre de dos hijos que educa en compañía de su cónyuge y desea ofrecerles estudios profesionales.  Su principal desafío fue atreverse a solicitar crédito, porque él no podía realizar trabajos por no contar con el capital necesario y se había limitado en el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
In his welding workshop, which is located in a neighborhood in the south of the city of Barranquilla, Oscar, who is 55 years old, started his business after completing his studies in industrial welding. This entrepreneurial man purchased welding equipment and started making things for family members and friends using iron and aluminum. Today, with 15 years of experience, he performs work at the company level. His main products are iron fences, gates, aluminum doors and windows, and window guards and fences. He offers his products through his own catalog. When he makes the sale, he asks for a deposit of 50%, and he asks for the rest at the time of installation.

Currently, Oscar is seeking a CrediKiva, which is the first loan that he requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy raw materials (iron and aluminum) as well as a polishing machine and an industrial drill. Oscar believes that this loan will improve his working conditions, allowing him to make products of better quality.

He is the father of two children, whom he is raising together with his spouse. He wishes to offer them a professional education. His greatest challenge was daring to request a loan. Since he did not have the necessary capital, he was unable to work; therefore, he had limited the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (iron and aluminum) as well as a polishing machine and an industrial drill.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Candelaria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias desde hace 10 años, con las ventas que realiza es como ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para compra de pescado por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es u única fuente de ingresos y poder seguirle dando a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Candelaria is 56 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling fish on the street in the different neighborhoods. With these sales she has been able to get ahead with her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fish wholesale to continue these sales,  since it is her only source of income and she wants to continue giving her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Lala's Group

texts.fr: Lala qui se trouve sur la photo assignant sur le tabouret en tenant la pochette portant une pagne verte avec un t-shirt rouge noir, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bassian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Lala, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 2 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Lala à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Lala cultive l'arachide, le maraîchage, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'accès au marché. Lala entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Lala effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 22 ans que Lala cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Lala planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Lala espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Lala, the one shown on the photo seated on a stool holding a green myAgro pack and dressed in a green skirt and a red-and-black T-shirt, belongs to a group of 16 farmers who have signed up with myAgro. They live in work in the village of Bassian, to the Southeast of Bamako in Mali. Lala, 50 years old, has six children, the youngest of whom is only two years old. Four of her children currently attend school. Farm work is what allows her to provide for her family. She also married a farmer and has been engaged in farmwork for 40 years now. Lala grows peanuts, vegetables and okra on her field. Her challenges are lack of agricultural supplies and access to the marketplace. Lala is starting her second year with myAgro. She has renewed her membership because of the possibility to pay in installments and obtain quality seeds and fertilizers. 

This time Lala is making payments on a pack of myAgro OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers to grow peanuts in order to bolster her yield on a parcel of 0.125 ha [0.3 acres]. Lala has been growing peanuts for 22 years because of its economic profitability and market value. Thanks to an increased yield and higher revenues, Lala hopes to become a vendor. She also hopes to be able to cover the school fees for her children to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers to increase the yield of peanuts on her field. as well as to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers to increase the yield of peanuts on her field.

loans.name: Julio Marbin

texts.es:
Julio es un caficultor que se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 7 años. Vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua, donde junto a su esposa y su hijo mayor trabajan cada día en el mantenimiento de su pequeña finca, y de su cafetal el cual maneja bajo las certificaciones de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Este año, Julio está necesitando un financiamiento para comprar los abonos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, a fin de poder asegurar una buena cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos que le permitirán dar a su familia mejores condiciones. 

El sueño de este pequeño productor es dejar a sus hijos una finca productiva y sostenible, para ello se esfuerza cada día a fin de que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Julio is a coffee grower who has grown coffee for 7 years.  He lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua.  He works together with his wife and oldest son in maintaining his small farm every day, which he operates under certified FAIRTRADE, UTZ and C.A.F.E practises.

This year Julio needs a loan to buy the compost and fertilizers that his coffee plantation requires to ensure a good harvest.  With the increased income, he will be able to give his family better living conditions.

The dream of this small coffee producer is to leave a productive and sustainable farm to his children, for whom he works hard every day to provide a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to apply to his coffee farm and ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Don Lorenzo de 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, el posee una sastrería desde hace  30 años  el cual lo inicio con capital propio su taller de costura  está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Don Lorenzo is 56 years old and lives in his own home with his two daughters. For 30 years he has had a tailor shop which he started with his own capital. His sewing workshop is located in his place of residence. He has many customers because of his good work. He is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, various fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc., so he can continue his work which brings him a good income.

loans.use: buy thread, needles, various fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
This is Philomena from Nairobi County. She is a fruit vendor in the urban center. She sources fruit from the farmers in the county and also buys exported fruits to sell. 

She has a put up a stand and operates under an umbrella. She believes that through buying and selling fruits, she is helping the community to live better and healthier lives. She dreams of one day owning a grocery shop of her own. 

With this KIVA loan, she intends to purchase more fruit stock.

loans.use: to increase her fruit stock.

loans.name: Yatim

texts.en: Yatim is a handsome man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. He is living in a village with his family. He is married and has three children. For more than 15 year he has been doing business as a taxi driver. He is a well-known driver and has permanent clients every day. He is a responsible, goal-oriented and honest person. In order to feed his family he works hard and tries to be useful. He wants to ensure his children have education and other necessary things until they become independent. He appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay for his son’s higher education costs. He hopes that his son will be educated and will help residents of his area. He awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s higher education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grass bundles and bamboo for house roofing and to pay labor

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Aminata. She is married and has one child aged 7 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are her cousins.  

In 2012, Aminata established her dry pepper, beans, etc. business. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are both men and women. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,750,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy 10 more bags of beans and 10 bags of dry pepper to add to the business. She hopes that this loan will permit her to add stock and to generate more profit. 

In the future, Aminata plans to buy a piece of land, to become an international businesswoman and to provide quality education for her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 more bags of beans and 10 bags of dry pepper

loans.name: Manjula

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Manjula. She is married and has two children aged 18 and 16 years. She has one additional dependent, to be fostered. 

In 2014, Manjula established her pampas, shampoo, body cream, body lotion, wax cotton, body spray and hair business. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are mostly women. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,250,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Manjula requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice, cartons of body cream, pampas, shampoo, and other items for resale.  

She hopes that this loan will help the business to improve by generating more profit. In the future, Manjula plans to buy a piece of land, to expand the business by having a variety of items in the shop and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice, cartons of body cream, pampas, shampoo, and other items

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a 61-year-old widow from Cortes, Bohol. She has four grown children. She buys and sells scrap iron, empty bottles and cans, and many other things. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years now. She is in need of funds to finance her existing livelihood.

Artemia is asking for a loan to buy more empty bottles, cans, and scrap iron to sell. Slowly her income will grow and she will start to balance her finances. She will be able to pay her obligations and start to save for emergencies.

Artemia is determined to expand her business in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles, cans, and scrap iron to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. 

She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and open a tailoring school.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. 

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 28 years. She is married and has two daughters. She raises her children together with her husband. They live in a small village, Subhaspally, in Alipurduar district. Her daughters read in grade 4 and 1, respectively.

Pramila’s husband is associated with paint work, but his earnings are hardly sufficient to cover all the household and educational expenses of their children. So to assist her husband financially, Pramila is involved in sewing work. She learnt it from her mother. Currently, this knowledge helps her to earn income for food and other household expenses.  

She sews all kinds of clothing. She earns a good income for the family. Her neighbors are her main customers. They appreciate her work; thus, she has goodwill in her neighborhood.  

Currently, she would like to purchase a better quality of sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher quality clothing. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes for a better result and she also dreams to have her own sewing shop in the market in the future, where she can employ more women like her.

Pramila is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her existing sewing business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Don Alfredo de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de carpintería desde hace 25 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del trabajo que realiza y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Alfredo is 67 years old and lives with his wife in his own house.  He's had a carpentry workshop in his house for 25 years.  He has many clients because of the quality of his work and with the profits he's able to get ahead.  
Don Alfredo is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to invest in his business by buying wood, nails, glue, varnish, and other articles that will help attract more clients and thus achieve his goal of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, and other articles.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don Jose de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his son.  He's had a workshop in his home for 8 years where he works fixing car chassis as a tinsmith and painter.  With the income from his projects his able to pay for some of his home expenses.
He's requesting a loan to buy paint, varnish, oil, etc. to continue with his work and obtain a larger profit thus improving his quality of life and  his son's.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu lives in a small village of Alipurduar in West Bengal. She is 36 years old, married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She got education up to grade 5 and could not proceed further due to her parent's poor economic condition. Her children are in grade 4 and grade 1 in local village school. Jhunu wants to provide them with a good education.

Jhunu’s husband, Shyamal, is engaged with a vegetable vending business. Jhunu is involved with farming; they have a small piece of land where she grows different vegetables in different seasons with the assistance of her husband. She and her husband give their hard toil to grow vegetables and earn sufficient profit, to give their family financial sustenance. Her husband sells the vegetables after harvesting in the market and in their neighborhood. Sometimes he also buys vegetables from the wholesale market to sell.  

As Jhunu has been in agribusiness for such a long time, it has given her the skills and knowledge necessary to attend her crops. Now Jhunu wants to cultivate chilies, which have a great demand in the market. 

So Jhunu has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to expand her agribusiness. She plans to purchase seeds of chilies, fertilizers and other farm supplies to cultivate chillies. She is hopeful that this business will give a quality life to her family, and that she will save some money for her children's future.

She is obliged to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for the cultivation of chilies.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is an innovative woman of 26 years from a small village of Alipuduar in west Bengal, India. She is married to Apurba, who is involved with a clothing business.

Anjana has been practicing cattle breeding for many years to give sustenance to her family through a dairy business. She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable. She has a few dairy cows. She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow, but the biggest challenge she faces is her limited funds.
 
Anjana is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow.  It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more milk as well as dairy products and satisfy her customers, thus she will earn more. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). The loan will help her greatly to organize her business in more effective ways. She wants to assist her husband economically.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 29 years old and from Minia. He is married to a housewife and has two sons and one daughter. 

The only source of income for the family is a grocery store project that he runs, but because the project is very small, the income from it can't cover the family's monthly expenses. So he requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and more products such as fizzy drinks and ice cream.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and more products such as fizzy drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a store where she sells milk, rice, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her store is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more milk, rice, flour, and other items to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is Jane’s fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more milk, rice, flour, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata qui se trouve au premier rang, avec sourire sur la photo, elle tiens le drapeau de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de N'Tentoukoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Fatoumata, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 20 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'agriculture comme activité géneratrice de revenu complètant son travail principal de , ont incité Fatoumata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 25 ans. Fatoumata cultive l'arachide, le mais, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, de terres cultivables et d'herbicides. Fatoumata entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Fatoumata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 22 ans que Fatoumata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Fatoumata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de moutons et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Fatoumata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, who is smiling in the first row and holding the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 11 farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of N'Tentoukoro, to the southeast of Bamako, in Mali.

40-year-old Fatoumata, is the mother of eight children from three to 20 years of age, of whom four are currently attending school. Agriculture enables her to ensure her family's self-sufficiency, but also agriculture as an income-generating activity prompted Fatoumata to exercise this activity for 25 years.

Fatoumata cultivates groundnuts, maize, and market vegetables on her plot of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of agricultural equipment, arable land and herbicides. Fatoumata is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her affiliation because of the payment system and the prospect of increasing her efficiency through services offered by myAgro.

This year Fatoumata is making payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, so she can increase crop yield on her 0.25 hectare parcel (0.62 acres).

For the past 22 years Fatoumata has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value, explaining that the groundnut is directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce in food preparations, and also for its productivity and commercial value.

With increased yields and income Fatoumata plans to go into sheep farming and buy some farming equipment. Finally Fatoumata also hopes to cover her children's school fees as well as ensure the family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Ana Veraliss

texts.es: Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Ana trabajo por un tiempo en una maquila y luego quedo sin empleo, decidió iniciar su propio negocio que le generara sus propios ingresos, ahora tiene 5 años su negocio donde vende productos alimenticios como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, lácteos, productos enlatados, pan, churros, productos de aseo, harina, y otros abarrotes. Con el fin de seguir aumentando y surtiendo su negocio a solicitado el segundo préstamo con ODEF por 30,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos como granos básicos, lácteos, manteca, harina, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, pan, huevos y otros para surtir el negocio  aumentar las ventas. Su plan es crecer como microempresaria y generar mas ingresos para la familia y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and a single mother of 2 children.  She lives in a village of the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barabara.  Ana worked in a manufacturing plant but lost her job.  She decided to start her own business to have her own income.  Five years later she has her own business in which she sells food products like rice, sugar, butter, milk products, canned products, bread, churros, hygiene products, flour, and other articles.  
She's requesting a second loan from ODEF for 30,000 Lempiras to buy more products like basic grains, milk products, butter, flour, sodas, churros, hygiene products, bread, eggs, and others with the purpose of stocking and growing her store.  Her goal is to become a microentrepreneur and generate more income her family and her chidren.

loans.use: to buy more products like basic grains, milk products, butter, flour, sodas, churros, hygiene products, bread, eggs, and others to stock her store.

loans.name: Narlys Del Carmen

texts.es: Narlys de 35 años, por su propia iniciativa decidió ayudar económicamente a su familia y emprendió la búsqueda de alternativas de generar recursos.  Con unos ahorros compró ropa de niños, camisas y  jeans de adultos, les ofreció a sus conocidos y poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y su base de clientes.  Hoy en día su oferta de productos es más amplia puesto que por medio de catálogos especializados ofrece joyería, cosméticos, cremas corporales, tratamientos para el cuidado de la piel  y demás.  Esta actividad le permite estar cerca de sus dos hijos que son menores de edad y requieren de mucho tiempo, dedicación y en compañía de su cónyuge  les ofrecen bienestar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para cumplir con unos pedidos de camisas, jeans, perfumes, colonias y cremas.  Esta inversión responde a la demanda de sus clientes puesto que estamos próximos a la temporada de día de las madres y es muy importante para Narlys estar aprovisionada. Su meta familiar es construir su apartamento para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Narlys is 35 years old. On her own initiative, she decided to help her family financially and she started looking for different ways of generating income.
With her savings, she bought children's clothes, adult shirts and jeans and sold them to people she knows. She gradually increased her capital and her customer base. 

Today she offers a wider range of products such as jewellery, cosmetics, body lotions, skincare products and others that she sells through specialist catalogues. This enables enables her to be with her two young children who need a lot of time and attention. Along with her husband, she ensures their well-being. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to be able to fulfil orders for shirts, jeans, perfumes, colognes and creams. She is making this investment to be able to meet customer demand as we are approaching Mother's Day and it is important for Narlys to be stocked up. Her objective for her family is to build their own apartment to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, perfumes, cologne and creams to meet customer demand

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Awa qui se trouve sur la photo assignant en deuxième position, habiller en noir en tenant le sac de n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 9 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kabe au sud de Bamako au Mali. Awa, âgée de 43 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 7 à 25 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  Son mariage avec un agriculteur a incité Awa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Awa cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho, le riz, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Awa entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Awa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectares. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans qu’Awa cultive l’arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Awa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Awa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa is seen in the photo, sitting in the second position, wearing black and holding a bag.  She is a member of a group of nine farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Kabe, south of Bamako, in Mali.

Awa is 43 years old and mother to six children, aged between seven and twenty-five years old.  All of her children attend school.  Awa married a farmer and began working in this business thirty years ago.  She grows peanuts, maize, sorghum, rice and okra on her land, and has to cope with lack of rain and shortage of agricultural equipment and good quality fertilizer.

This will be Awa's second year working with myAgro to buy good quality seed and fertilizer.  This year, she is buying fertilizer to improve the harvest of peanuts on her 0.125 hectares of land.  She grows peanuts because they are a valuable food for families (often used to prepare sauces), and a good product to sell at market.

Awa will use her increased yield and earnings to continue her business and raise livestock.  She also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for her children and provide enough food for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Norma Narcisa
