texts.es: Norma tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive con su madre en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos abonos y fertilizantes para la siembra de maiz, para mejorar su siembra, realiza las compras en Guaranda cada 15 días, su sueño es comprar ganado para la produccion de leche, y asi mejorar su economía, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en: Norma, 22, is single and lives with her mother in Chimbo in the province of Bolivar.  She is a farmer and is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as manures and fertliizers to plant corn and improve the crop.  Every 15 days she makes her purchases in Guaranda.  Her dream is to buy dairy cattle to improve her economy.  In her free time she likes to knit.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, manures and fertilizers.

loans.name: Drissa's Group

texts.fr: Drissa qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, portant une chemise de trois poche de couleur jaune marron, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Koni au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Drissa, âgé de 45 ans, est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 2 à 24 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Drissa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Drissa cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le riz, le maraichage, le coton, la patate sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité . Drissa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des innovations de myAgro. Cette année Drissa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans que Drissa cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Drissa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme les bœufs et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Drissa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Drissa is seen in the photo, wearing a brown shirt with three pockets.  He is a member of a group of eighteen farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Koni, south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

Drissa is 45 years old and father to eight children, aged between two and twenty-four years old.  Six of his children currently attend school.  Drissa's principal source of revenue is agriculture and he began working in this business thirty-five years ago.  He grows peanuts, maize, millet, rice, vegetables, cotton and sweet potatoes on his land, and has to cope with a lack of good quality fertilizer.

This will be Drissa's first year working with myAgro.  This year, he is buying hybrid seed and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize on his one hectare of land.  He grows maize because it is a valuable food for families and a good product to sell at market.

Drissa will use his increased yield and earnings to raise beef cattle and do business.  He also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Diego Mauricio

texts.es: Diego tiene 21 años es soltero vive en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, el es empleado privado, solicita el crédito para la compra de muebles y electrodomesticos ya que por su trabajo le toca vivir en otra lado, realizara la compra en Guaranda su meta es progresar y salir adelante para asi poder formar una familia, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Diego, 21, lives in Chimbo in the province of Bolivar.  He is a private employee and is requesting a loan to buy furniture and domestic appliances since his works requires him to live elsewhere.  He does his shopping in Guaranda.  His goal is to prosper and get ahead so he can form a family.  In his free time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy domestic appliances.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as honest. Annah operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. Annah will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
MARÍA  tiene 22 años de edad, desde hace 3 años es  clienta de VisionFund, y ve en esta organización una oportunidad de poder crecer, ya que desde su primer crédito, inicio con el proyecto de cría de pollos, y con las ganancias, ha podido construir poco a poco su vivienda.
MARÍA, con este nuevo crédito, continuara en la actividad de cría de pollos y a demás invertirá en la terminación de su casa propia.
ella vive en una comunidad de la provincia de Esmeraldas, tiene un hijo y hasta el momento está viviendo en casa de sus padres.el padre de su hijo la abandonó hace unos 6 meses y no le apoya económicamente.
está estudiando la secundaria y cursa el ultimo año del bachillerato. luego de graduarse como bachiller tiene deseos de continuar sus estudios superiores en la universidad.
se describe como una mujer muy pro-activa, dinámica  y emprendedora.
LA PERSONA QUE LEVANTA LA MANO EN LA IMAGEN ES LA LÍDER DEL GRUPO.
texts.en:
Maria, 22, has been a member of VisionFund for three years.  She sees in this organization the opportunity to grow.  With her first loan she started A chicken raising business and has used the profits to build her own house little by little.

With the new loan, Maria will continue her chicken business and also finish building the house.  She lives in a community in the province of Esmeraldas and has a son.  For the time being she lives with her parents.  The father of her child left six months ago and pays no child support.

Maria is in her last year of high school and wants to continue her education at the university.  She considers herself a pro-active, dynamic, enterprising woman.

THE WOMAN RAISING HER HAND IN THE PICTURE IS THE GROUP LEADER.

loans.use: To buy 300 chicks and feed (corn, balanced feed and vitamins) to continue her chicken business.

loans.name: Bape's Group

texts.fr: Bape qui se trouve sur la photo montrant la pochette n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kola au sud de Bamako au Mali. Bape, âgé de 50 ans, est le père de 10 enfants âgés de 1 à 26 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Bape à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Bape cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho, le riz, le sésame sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Bape entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Bape effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans que Bape cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Bape planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme. Enfin Bape espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Bape is seen in the photo holding up a bag.  He is a member of a group of ten farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro.  The group all live and work in the village of Kola, south of Bamako, in Mali.

Bape is 50 years old and father to ten children, aged between one and twenty-six years old.  Three of his children currently attend school.  Bape began working in this business, which he loves, thirty-five years ago.  He grows peanuts, maize, sorghum, rice and sesame seeds on his land, and has to cope with lack of rain and shortage of agricultural equipment and good quality fertilizer.

This will be Bape's second year working with myAgro.  He works with them because of their system of purchase payments and his belief in their agricultural methods.  This year, he is buying hybrid seed and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize on his 0.5 hectare of land.  He grows maize because it is a valuable food for families and a good product to sell at market.

Bape will use his increased yield and earnings to buy agricultural materials and raise livestock.  He also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Sr.Ezequiel é casado maritalmente, pai de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 05 a 09 anos de idade. Trabalha como caixa na ferragem do seu pai, vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir do seu irmão que é  cliente da Hluvuku. Pede empréstimo pela primeira vez e com o valor financiado irá averbar a sua carta de condução de ligeiros para pesados.  
Tem como sonho pessoal abrir um negócio de venda de material de construção e comprar uma carinha para ajudar a escoar a sua mercadoria, neste momento o seu principal desafio e averbar sua carta de condução e depois procurar um emprego como camionista que acredita que aumentará o seu rendimento mensal e poderá satisfazer as suas necessidades pessoais e familiares.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 9. He works a cashier in his father’s hardware store. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from his brother, who is a Hluvuku client. He is requesting his first loan and will use it to get a license to drive heavy vehicles.
His personal dream is to open a business selling construction materials and buy a van to help transport his merchandise. Currently his biggest challenge is to get his driver’s license and then find a job as a trucker, which he says will increase his monthly income and help him satisfy his personal and family needs.

loans.use: to get a heavy vehicle license.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
For more than 10 years now, Silvina has been engaged in weaving native baskets. She is 47 years old and married with one grown child. She is from Antequera, Bohol. Silvina also engages in a food vending business, selling bread and balut (a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell).

Silvina is asking for a loan to buy materials such as wicker (a pliable twig) and buri (a kind of palm). She is also seeking additional capital for her food vending business. With these materials, she will be able to weave more baskets and buy more balut and bread to sell to the locals in her place. Thus, her income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances.

Silvinia wishes to expand her business and to be able to manage it properly. She hopes that her sources of income will be successful in the near future, and that she can improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wicker (a pliable twig) and buri (a kind of palm).

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a single woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, and has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Priscilla describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es una microempresaria que se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, y gracias a los financiamientos ofrecidos por MiCrédito ha podido apoyarse en negocio. Ella se siente agradecida pues con el último financiamiento pudo comprar el alimento necesario para su ganado, asimismo pudo darle mantenimiento a las  herramientas de producción. 

Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para contratar ayudantes de limpieza y comprar abono, porque al acercarse la época lluviosa necesita tener limpio los potreros y una vez que llueva crezca el pasto necesario para alimentar su ganado, y así obtener más leches para hacer cuajadas.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a small business owner and farmer.  Thanks to loans from MiCredito she has been able to support her business.  She is grateful because she was able to use the last loan to buy feed for her cattle and also provide maintenance for her production tools.

Now she is requesting a new loan to hire cleaning workers and buy fertilizer since the rainy season is approaching and the stables must be cleaned out.  After it rains the pasture will grow and she can graze the cattle and obtain milk to make cottage cheese.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire cleaning workers.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is from Qajaran town, where he is involved in the retail business. He trades in polyethylene bags. He lives with his wife and their children live separately. 

Seyran started his business six years ago with an initial investment, which helped him to acquire the necessary stock of bags from Yerevan town and build a relationship with his customers in Qajaran town. At first, Seyran could only afford to purchase low-cost bags. However, when the first profits started to appear, he decided to bring high quality polyethylene bags to his customers. Now, aiming to boost his retail business, Seyran has applied for this loan to purchase new stock of polyethylene bags to sell to his customers. 

Seyran has now been approved for this loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy new stock of polyethylene bags to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano es un hombre de 35 años de edad es un gran agricultor, pues él está muy agradecido porque gracias a al crédito el logro comprar sus semillas de papas  y abono químico, con el que obtuvo una buena cosecha y mejoraron sus ganancias,  pero él ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus abonos químicos para su cultivo.
El gran sueño de Victoriano es poder construir una casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Victoriano, 35, is a great farmer.  He is very grateful for the loan which allowed him to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizer, producing a good harvest and improving his profits.

Now he requesting a loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his crop.

Victoriano's greatest desire is to build a house with a patio.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Sounba's Group

texts.fr: Sounba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, mettant le drapeau au cou, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dialakoroba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Sounba, âgée de 65 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants âgés de 25 à 40 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Sounba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Sounba cultive l'arachide, le wonzou sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Sounba entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Sounba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Sounba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Sounba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Sounba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Sounba, who is on the right in the first row of the photo, and wearing the flag around her neck, is a member of a group of 11 farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Dialakoroba, to the south of Bamako, in Mali.

65-year-old Sounba, is the mother of nine children from 25 to 40 years of age, of whom none currently attend school. Agriculture enables her to ensure her family's self-sufficiency, but the love of farming also motivated Sounba to exercise this activity over the past 50 years.

Sounba cultivates groundnuts and bambara beans on her plot of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and quality fertilizers. Sounba is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her affiliation because of the payment system and the quality of seeds and fertilizer.

This year Sounba is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, so she can increase crop yield on her 0.125 hectare parcel (0.31 acres).

For the past 50 years Sounba has been cultivating groundnuts for its crop value, explaining that the groundnut is directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce in food preparations.

With increased yields and income Sounba plans to raise livestock and become a merchant. Finally Sounba also hopes to cover the children's school fees as well as build a home for the family.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultiate groundnuts and benefit from myAgro's training in agricultural techniques

loans.name: Salamao

texts.pt:
Sr. Salomão casado maritalmente e pai de uma filha de 4 anos de idade e vive com seus pais ,conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir dos seus pais e irmã de que já são clientes. Com o valor financiado pretende comprar 20 sacos de cimento para fabricar blocos e um laptop para seu irmão que encontra se na cidade a estudar na Universidade Pedagógica. 
A nível profissional o cliente deseja mudar de emprego de jardineiro para Bar Men ou recepcionista numa das empresas locais e a nível pessoal sonha ter sua própria casa. De momento o seu principal desafio é construir uma casa no seu próprio terreno para poder sair da casa dos seus pais e tirar uma carta de condução.
texts.en:
Salomão is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. He lives with his parents. He heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from his parents and sister, who are already clients. He will use this loan to buy 20 bags of cement to manufacture cement blocks and a laptop for his brother, who is in the city studying at the teacher’s college.
Professionally, he hopes to stop working as a gardener and become a bartender or receptionist at a local business. On a personal level, he dreams of having a home of his own. Currently, his main goals are to build a house on his own piece of land so he can move out of his parents’ house, and to get a driver’s license.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of cement to manufacture cement blocks and a laptop for his brother.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Sr. Fernando é viúvo, pai de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 10 a 14 anos de idade, além dos seus filhos não tem outros dependentes. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir do seu irmão que e também cliente, vive na sua casa que esta na fazer de acabamentos, com o valor financiado ira comprar 20 baldes de tinta para pintar a sua casa.
Tem como sonho e desafio pessoal terminar sua obra e abrir um furo de água, a nível profissional sente se satisfeito.
texts.en:
Fernando is a widower and has three children between the ages of 10 and 14. Apart from his children, he has no other dependents. He heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from his brother, who is also a client. His lives in his own home, which is in its finishing stages. He will use the loan to buy 20 buckets of paint to paint his house.
His personal dream and goal is to finish the construction and dig a well. Professionally speaking, he feels fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy 20 buckets of paint to paint his house.

loans.name: Santiago Xavier

texts.es: Santiago tiene 43 años de edad es soltero vive con su madre en Chimbo, provincia de Bolivar, el se dedica a l comercio de granos, solicita el crédito para la compra de maiz ya que si compra en estos meses le sale mas económico y podra vender a un precio mas alto para obtener ganancias y aumentar su capital de trabajo, las compras realiza cada semana en San Pablo, San Miguel y Chimbo, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasearse con su madre.
texts.en: Santiago is 43 years old, single and lives with his mother in Chimbo, Bolivar province. Santiago makes a living selling grains. He is applying for a loan in order to buy corn as, if he buys it now, it will be cheaper and he can sell it at a higher price in order to increase working capital. Santiago makes his purchases every week in San Pablo, San Miguel and Chimbo. Santiago likes to spend his free time with his mother.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt: Casado maritalmente pai de dois filhos do sexo masculino  com idades compreendidas entre os 7 e 18 anos e tem como dependente uma sobrinha menor. É cliente da instituição a sensivelmente 3 anoas e já levantou 4 emprestimos e com valor financiado o cliente irá comprar 30 sacos de cimento, 3m3 de pedra , 50 varrões de ferro 8mm e teto falso pra cozinha. Seu principal desafio é concluir sua obra e tem como aspirações a progressão da carreira profissional mais e terminar seu curso de nível superior. A nível social sonha em viver junto com sua família sendo que se encontra a trabalhar longe dela
texts.en: Pedro is married with two sons, 7 and 18 years old, and he also takes care of his young niece. He has been a client of the institution for three years. He has already paid off four loans. He will use the value of this loan to buy 30 bags of cement, 3 m3 of stone, 50 8 mm iron rods, and a false ceiling for the kitchen. His main challenge is to finish the construction. His goal is to advance professionally and finish college. He also dreams of living with his family, since he currently has to work far away from them.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of cement, 3 m3 of stone, 50 8 mm iron rods, and a false ceiling for the kitchen.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is from Kapan town, Syunik region. He owns a truck (a Kamaz) and organizes transportation services from Yerevan to Iran in both directions. He currently needs this loan to purchase 10 tires for the truck, which are required for the development of his business. 

Mher has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Mher hopes to receive the lenders' support and goodwill needed to improve the working condition of his truck.

loans.use: to pay for the 10 tires needed for his truck.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 39 años de edad, es soltero tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 5 y 16 años, está humilde familia vive  una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Miguel con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la sastrería desde hace seis años, gracias a  esta labor él ha logrado sacar a delante a sus hijos.
Miguel es uno de los mejores sastres de su comunidad, es por ello que mucha gente lo busca para que confeccione los mejores pantalones, pero a pesar de toda su experiencia él tiene una dificultad que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar una máquina para seguir confeccionando pantalones de lona.
El gran sueño de miguel es adquirir su máquina para seguir confeccionando y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old, single and has a lovely family of four children, ages between sixteen and five years old. This humble family lives in a community in Chichicastenango.

In order to earn an income and help his family, Miguel has been working as a tailor for six years. He has been able to help his children as a result of this work.

Miguel is one of the best tailors in town and therefore many people come to him to make the best trousers. Despite all of his experience, however, he does not have enough capital to buy a sewing machine in order to continue producing canvas trousers.

Miguel’s big dream is to buy a sewing machine, continue producing clothes, and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Oumou est la dame debout au bout avec la daba en main sur la photo
Oumou, présidente de son groupe est âgée de 58 ans, veuve vivante  dans une commune rurale au Mali avec ses 2 enfants de 17  et 25 ans non scolarisés. 
Oumou fait comme activité le commerce de condiments( ingrédients pour la sauce)  et des semences pour  cultiver de l’arachide, elle a  10 ans d’expérience dans  ses activités. Elle est analphabète. Par manque de moyen  elle fait recourt  au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent. Son rêve tourne autour du bien-être de sa famille en santé et nourriture suffisante. Le profit  généré  par  la vente des condiments permet  à Oumou de faire face à ses besoins. Elle  veut acheter plus de condiment et les intrants agricoles pour agrandir davantage son travail. Elle fréquente le marché public  et environnant pour l’approvisionnement et la  vente de ses produits. Elle rencontre parfois la mévente de ses condiments pendant la période de soudure
texts.en:
Oumou, the woman standing at the end of the row holding an axe in the photo, is the president of this group. She is a 58-year-old widow who lives in a rural commune of Mali with her two children, aged 17 and 25 years old. Her children did not attend school.

Oumou earns a living through selling foodstuffs (ingredients for preparing sauces) and seeds for growing peanuts. She has 10 years of experience in these areas. She is also illiterate. As a last resort, Oumou turned to RMCR for a loan. Her dream is to be able to ensure that her family is healthy and well-fed. The profits made from selling foodstuffs allows Oumou to meet her needs. She wishes to purchase more foodstuffs and farming inputs in order to further grow her business. She goes to the local and surrounding markets in order to purchase and sell her wares. She sometimes sees a slump in sales during the tide-over period.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale and seeds to cultivate on their land

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt:
Alda é casada de 3 filhos , uma maior de idade e dois com idade escolar, vive na casa propria,não ha mais  pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Não depende só de negocio tem tambem conta com apoio do seu esposo que lhe ajuda em despesas de casa.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar: cerveja, refrescos ,peixe e frangos.
O seu sonho é construir uma casa para os seus filhos, pagar escola para os mesmo, empreender mais no seu negócio e construir uma mercearia.
O seu principal desafio é gerir melhor o seu, ter uma familia formada academicamente. E prepara o futuro dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Alda is married and has three children, one of whom is adult and two of whom are in school. She lives in her own home and is not financially responsible for anyone else. In addition to the income she gets from her business, she is able to count on her husband’s help with household expenses.
She will use the loan to buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and chickens.
Her dream is to build a home for her children, pay for their education, expand her business, and build a grocery store.
Her main goals are to run her business better, have a well-educated family, and prepare her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and chickens.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Raimundo é casado, pai de 6  filhos todos maior de idade,tem tambem netos sob sua resposabildade,vive na casa propria e é pensionista mais também realiza pequenos trabalhos de canalização para o incremento da renda e conta com ajuda dos seus filhos nas despesas da casa.
Com o valor do emprestimo vai comprar cimento arros da janela,  portas; area e pagar a mao –de – obra.
O seu sonho e esperança é ter melhores condições de habitação e construir outra casa para filhos.
O seu principal desafio é pagar o emprestimo da hluvuku sem entrar em moras para poder ter acesso  ao outro emprestimo
texts.en:
Raimundo is married and has six adult children. He also takes care of his grandchildren. He lives in his own home and is retired, but he also does small pipe-laying jobs to increase his family’s income. His children help him with household expenses.
He will use this loan to buy cement, window frames, and doors and to pay labor costs.
His dream is to have better living conditions and to build another house for his children.
His biggest goal is to pay off the Hluvuku loan without going into arrears so that he will be able to apply for another loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, window frames, and doors and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Assitan's Group

texts.fr: Assitan qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, portant une foulard vert, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Koni au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Assitan, âgée de 65 ans, est la mère de 2 enfants âgés de 35 à 42 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux n’estt actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Assitan à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Assitan cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Assitan entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Assitan effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Assitan cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Assitan planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Assitan espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Assitan, the woman to the left in the second row wearing the green headscarf, is a member of a group of 13 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Koni to the south-east of Bamako in Mali. Assitan is a 65-year-old mother to two children, aged 35 and 42 years old, neither of whom are currently receiving an education. Adherence to the family farming tradition, which is her main source of revenue and food sufficiency, is what pushed Assitan to carry out this activity for the past 50 years. She grows peanuts, corn, millet, rice and vegetables on her plot of land, but she must face up to many difficulties, such as a lack of rainfall, farming equipment and quality fertiliser. Assitan is starting her first year with myAgro. She signed up in order to increase her crop yield through the services offered by myAgro. This year, Assitan has taken out a loan in order to purchase a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser for growing peanuts in order to increase her crop yield over her 0.0625-hectare plot. Assitan has been growing peanuts for 50 years due to its value as a daily foodstuff, as it can be directly eaten by the family and is used as a base sauce for many dishes. It also brings in a good price at market. With the increase in her yield and her revenue, Assitan plans to start raising livestock and going into retail. She also hopes to be able to ensure her family's food sufficiency.

loans.use: to purchase OPV seeds and fertiliser for growing peanuts in order to increase farming productivity on their plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, rice, potatoes, onions, peanuts, eggs, cooking oil, beer, soft drinks, and mineral water.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Awa qui se trouve sur la photo montrant la pochette n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kola au sud de Bamako au Mali. Awa, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 8 à 12 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Awa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Awa cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le riz, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Awa entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Awa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans qu’Awa cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Awa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Awa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: Awa, the woman holding the purse in the photo, is a member of a group of 11 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Kola to the south of Bamako in Mali. Awa is a 45-year-old mother to three children, aged between 8 and 12 years old, two of which are currently receiving an education. Adherence to the family farming tradition, which is her main source of revenue and food sufficiency, but also a love of farming are what pushed Awa to carry out this activity for the past 30 years. She grows peanuts, sorghum, rice and vegetables on her plot of land, but she must face up to many difficulties, such as a lack of rainfall, farming equipment and quality fertiliser. Awa is starting her third year with myAgro. She signed up once again due to the repayment plan and the opportunity to obtain quality seeds and fertiliser. This year, Awa has taken out a loan in order to purchase a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser for growing corn in order to increase her crop yield over her 0.25-hectare plot. Awa has been growing corn for 30 years due to its value as a daily foodstuff as well as its commercial value, as it brings in a good price at market. With the increase in her yield and her revenue, Awa plans to start raising livestock and going into retail. She also hopes to be able to pay for her children's school fees and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser for growing corn

loans.name: Indrani

texts.en:
Indrani is a 34-year-old hardworking married woman. She strives tirelessly to earn an income with her husband to help with the household finances, and their children's education. She lives in a small house in the village of Birpara in Alipurduar district with her husband Uttam and three sons.   

She and her husband are engaged in a business of selling clothing for ladies.  They sell saris (traditional Indian ladies wear), blouses, frocks etc. Her main customers are her relatives, friends, neighbors and acquaintances in their area. Now they want to expand their business to get additional profit.

She is asking for this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase stocks of clothing. This way, she can satisfy her customers' demand as well elevate her income.

Indrani says that her main purpose is to continue working for her family's wellbeing and she will continue working with effort and dedication to accredit her business well and guarantee her family's financial stability so she can enjoy a better quality of life with her loved ones. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing for her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
Sonali is a resident of Alipurduar. As a mother of two daughters, her great desire is to see her children educated. What inspires Sonali is working with enthusiasm. She is a 21-year-old young woman who works tirelessly on her farm by rearing goats. She lives with her two daughters and husband in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Her husband is a farmer by profession. To support her husband financially, she began the rearing of livestock like goats. She buys goat kids, raises them, fattens them and at the time of sale, charges a good price according to the weight acquired by the animal. This has permitted her to obtain additional resources to continue taking care of and upholding her family.

Sonali is a hardworking, thriving woman, who does her best every day to get ahead for her family. She is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more goat kids to fatten and sell. Sonali hopes to advance one step closer towards the fulfillment of her dream of providing her daughters the opportunity for a better education and good living conditions.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her existing livestock business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Anna is a married woman and a mother of one toddler. She lives with her family in a semi-concrete house in Alipurduar, West Bengal. 

Anna and her husband are associated with a sari retailing business. A sari is a traditional Indian dress for women. She buys different varieties of garments, especially saris, from the wholesale market and sells in her area. This business is the only source of income and financial support for her family. With the growing needs of her family, she wants to expand this business.  Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS to stock a variety of saris of different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

Anna is a successful entrepreneur.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She wants to go ahead with her business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their help.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of saris (a traditional indian dress for women) to sell.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a 46-year-old married woman and responsible mother of one son who is pursuing his graduation level education (B.Sc). She is living with her husband and son in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. She has completed her higher secondary grade education.

Her husband, 50-year-old Ratan, is associated with the betel nuts business. Kalyani has been involved in a sewing business for the last few years. She decided to share her husband’s financial burden, earn and to be independent, so, she learned sewing, and from then on she has been engaged in sewing. Now, she has taken an important role in the family's income and all the responsibility for her son’s education. She has one sewing machine at present, which she uses to stitch salwar suits, blouses, petticoats etc. 

As the old one has been damaged and old-fashioned, now she is asking for loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a new and modern sewing machine that will help her to run her business smoothly and stitch more clothing.

She is sure that the profit from her business will help her to strengthen her family finances and help her to be more independent. She hopes to be able to train some girls in her village or hire them for growing her sewing business and creating a good lifestyle for her family in future.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a modern sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a construction worker living in Kapan town in the Syunik region with his parents. He receives orders from local people in Kapan town to organize reconstruction and other home design works. 

Years ago, Albert and his family were struggling like many farmers in Armenia to earn a living, but due to the recent hard work of Albert, the family is now able to earn a daily living and cover basic costs. For the development of his work, Albert needs some funds. He has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for construction work.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for construction work

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a 41-year-old entrepreneur. She is a widow. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years back. She lives in a semi-concrete house with her only son in the village named Ghagra in the district of Alipurduar. Her son is a retailer of Chinese goods, but his income does not provide sufficient finance to cover the family's expenses.

Beauty is the main breadwinner of the family. She sells saris (an Indian traditional dress for women) in her local area. Her main customers are the neighbors and relatives. She started her business with a small review, but gradually she attained a good number of customers. She works hard to expand her business to generate more income for her family. She purchases stocks of saris from the wholesale market. But due to a lack of capital, she could not purchase more varieties of saris. 

Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a variety of saris and expand her business to meet her customer's need as well as to upgrade their financial condition. The profits generated from her business will be used to build up her savings and help her to give her son a better life. Her dream is to open a sari shop in the local market in order to expand their business.

Beauty is a lady with great enthusiasm  who never wants to stop fighting. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of saris (an Indian traditional dress) to expand her business.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa, 25 years old, is  from Minia. She is married to a farmer and has a son and a daughter. Her husband's income can't cover the family's monthly expenses. So, Wafaa decided to start a clothing shop to increase her monthly income and cover her children's expenses. Wafaa wishes to expand her project so she requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is 25 years old, married and the mother of two daughters. She is from the rural village of Sobhagunj in Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. One of her daughters reads in grade three and the other one is too small to go to school.  She has attended school up to primary level.

Pinki's husband is engaged in cycle repair work. But his income is inconsistent. Thus, Pinki, to help her family financially with her earnings, started her business of selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. For additional income, she sells many kinds of ready-made garments also, according to the customers' demands. Pinki started her business from her house. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris and other clothing from the wholesale market to increase her stock of collections for the fulfillment of the demand of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. 

Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her daughter, she stared this business and expects a boost in her earnings. 

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase wide varieties of saris to expand her business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a construction worker living in Kapan town in the Syunik region. He is a father of two sons and a beloved husband. 

Samvel, to sustain his family's living, has been involved in construction works for three years.  He receives different reconstruction work orders from local people in Kapan town and is already a skilled constructor. 

The tools that he uses for the work are too old and damaged, so Samvel has applied for this loan to purchase new tools. 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for providing reconstruction work and housing repair works

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es un hombre de 40 años de edad, que se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el crédito anterior, pues gracias a ello el logro comprar sus fertilizantes y obtuvo muy buena cosecha, pero también le dejo muy buena ganancia que él ahora lo utiliza como ahorro para comprar un terreno, el ahora nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar  abono químico y orgánico para el mantenimiento de cebolla.
El gran sueño de Natividad es comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 40 year old man who is extremely grateful for the previous loan. Thanks to that loan, he was able to buy his fertilizers and had a good harvest. He also made a very good profit, which he is saving so that he can buy land. 

Now he needs to request an additional loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizer in order to maintain his onions. 

Natividad's great aspiration is to buy land and build his house.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos posee 13 años de experiencia en las ventas, su producto lo anda en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor y así continuar con sus ventas para tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Emilio, 42 years of age, lives in the house that he owns with his wife. He works in the sale of shoes and has 13 years of sales experience. He travels with his product to different communities. With the profits that he makes, he is able to cover household costs. 

He is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale. In this way he will be able to continue his sales so that he can earn better income.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale grain, eggs, water, soup, sugar, milk, carbonated drinks, etc.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia  continua  dedicándose a su negocio de hospedaje, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colchas entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank group. She continues to work in her lodging business. She feels thankful for the loan and she promises to meet her payments. The member wishes to be able to continue working to thereby continue supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy bedspreads and other items.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and other items.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco de 71 años de edad solo vive en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina  natural posee 30 años de experiencia en las ventas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y podrá tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Francisco, 71, lives alone in his own home. He sells natural medicine and he has 30 years' experience in sales. He runs his business from home and he uses the income he generates to pay his expenses. 

He is asking for a loan so he can buy more products in bulk. This will allow him to continue selling his products, which is his only employment. In turn he will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Cipriano Donato

texts.es: Cipriano es un hombre de 37 años que vive en la localidad de Aplao, perteneciente al departamento de Arequipa. El se dedica a la ganadería, criando desde vacas, cabras, caballos y ovejas. Actualmente vende leche cruda de su ganado vacuno que es orgánico, esto por que lo alimenta con forraje natural. Cipriano solicita el crédito para comprar una oveja y espera vender leche cruda orgánica de esta oveja, el confía en que se venderá a un mejor precio esta leche. En el futuro espera aumentar sus ingresos económicos y poder mejorar su casa para que pueda vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Cipriano is a 37 year old man who lives in Aplao, belonging to the Arequipa region. He works in ranching, raising cows, goats, horses and sheep. Now he sells raw milk from his cattle which is organic. This is because he feeds them natural fodder. Cirpriano is asking for a loan to buy a sheep and he hopes to sell organic raw milk from this sheep. He believes that he will sell this milk at a better price. In the future he hopes to increase his income and to be able to improve his house so he can live comfortably.

loans.use: in the production of organic sheep milk.

loans.name: Magna Vicenta

texts.es:
Magna de 54  años conviviente con hijos mayores e independientes. Magna se dedica hace tres años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño espacio de su vivienda todos los días. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Magna ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. El mayor anhelo de Magna es ampliar y seguir mejorando su negocio. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (arroz, leche, azúcar .golosinas, etc.) y así poder obtener más ingresos.
Se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Magna, 54, lives with her children who are now grown up and independent. She has been selling grocery products for three years using a small space in her home. She works every day and, thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve her home and contribute to household expenses.

Her greatest desire is to expand and continue to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy more goods (rice, milk, sugar, sweets, etc), which will help her to generate more income.

She acknowledges the help she gets from Kiva and Edaprospo because it helps her to move forward.

loans.use: to buy general grocery goods.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Ii Group

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas y pacumutos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la colonización de migrantes; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del lugar e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Leidy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la derecha agarrando una mochila con su hijo, viste polera blanca y pantalón azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller automotriz, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, reparación de aire acondicionado, venta de fruta, venta de comida y venta de bisutería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas y pacumutos; la empanada es una masa de pan, rellena con una preparación llamada ‘jigote’ cocida al horno o frita, el relleno puede incluir carnes rojas o blancas y verduras. El pacumutu es una comida que consiste en varias clases de carnes intercaladas con verduras, cortados en trozos cuadrados y ensartados en un palillo de madera o alambre para asarlas a la brasa o parrilla, ambas comidas son muy tradicionales, “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y cuidar a mis hijos, poco a poco los ingresos mejoran y el negocio necesita crecer…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes y diarias, la desventaja es la falta de materiales de trabajo como parrilla y otros utensilios. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de comida típica, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una parrilla para aumentar su menú y mejorar las ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Leidy solicita un préstamo para la compra de una parrilla para abrir un puesto de venta de comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young 19 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has two children, 2 and 4 years old. Her business is selling empanadas and pacumutos (kebabs). She is a good mother, businesswoman, independent, reliable, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is carried out in the "plan 3000" area, characterized by the colonization of migrants. Native Ayoreo tribes and relocated miners from the West took over the area and began manufacturing and trade everywhere. The area has a hot and very humid tropical climate, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 18-35 degrees Celsius.

Leidy is dark-sinned, with brown eyes, long black hair that she ties back, short stature, and thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní that she speaks with family and she speaks Spanish in general settings and for her business (she is sitting to the right holding a backpack and with her son, dressed in a white shirt and blue pants). She shares her life with her husband, who works as a constructor, and with her children who are not yet old enough for school. They live in their own room built from bricks and cement, with a tin roof and which has drinking water, electricity and sewerage. 

Her desire to excel led her to form a group of people with businesses such as: an auto shop, selling second-hand clothing, selling natural health products, air conditioner repair, selling fruit, selling food and selling imitation jewelry, in order to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is selling empanadas and pacumutos (kebabs). The empanada is a ball of bread, stuffed with a mixture called "jigote", and baked or fried. The stuffing can include red or white meats and vegetables. The pacumutu is a food that consists of various types of meats interlaced with vegetables, cut into cubs and skewered on a wooden stick or wire to roast on coals or on the grill. Both foods are very traditional. "I started my business because of the need to work and take care of my children. Little by little the earnings improve and the business needs to grow..." she says. 

The advantage of her business is that the sales are reliable and daily. The disadvantage is the lack of work materials such as a grill and other utensils. Her dream is to open a restaurant of traditional foods. She wants to extend her business through buying a grill to increase her menu and improve her sales. This is the 1st sequence of loans with the institution in 4 years that she has been working this business. It is for those reasons that Leidy is asking for a loan to buy a grill to open a stall selling traditional food.

loans.use: to buy a grill in order to open a stall selling traditional food.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 55 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de sodas, agua y  jugos posee 15 años de experiencia el comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de jugos, sodas y aguas por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, 55, lives alone in his own home. He sells soft drinks, water and juice. He has 15 years experience. He sells his products on the streets at the different markets near his home. He uses the profits he makes to get along in life.

He is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, juice and water in bulk so he can improve his income which will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy juice, soda, and water in bulk.

loans.name: Delia Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Delia Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
Delia Fortunata is one of the members of the communal bank Illary III. She still works selling baby clothes. She has been in business for quite a long time and is doing well because she works hard every day. She would like to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

Delia is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.name: Cony

texts.es:
Más de 15 años tiene Cony de haber iniciado un pequeño negocio de alquiler de habitaciones. La idea surgió luego de que a su esposo le dijeron que pronto sería jubilado, y ellos para mantenerse activos  y generar más ingresos, decidieron ofrecer habitaciones a estudiantes, aprovechando los espacios vacíos de su hogar. 

El negocio se volvió rentable y próspero, por ello Cony solicita un préstamo para hacerle mejoras y darle mantenimiento a las habitaciones, así podrá ofrecer cuartos en óptimas condiciones y podrá aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cony has been renting out rooms for more than 15 years. The idea for the small business occurred to her when her husband found out that he was soon to be offered early retirement. In order to stay active and generate more income, they decided to offer rooms to students, making use of the empty space in their home.

The business became profitable so Cony is now asking for a loan to make improvements and to maintain the rooms. In this way she can offer better quality rooms and generate more income.

loans.use: to improve and maintain the rooms in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta y compra de artesanía, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de polos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank. She continues to be engaged in the business of buying and selling handicrafts. She is in this business for a long time. It is doing well, thanks to the determination she puts into it every day. The member wants to be able to continue working as a way to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, among others.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay all her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, among others.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco ILLARY III,la socia continua dedicándose a  su negocio de compra y venta de carteras, pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familaires entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the communal bank Illary III. She continues with her business buying and selling purses, pants, blouses and sweaters. She sells to friends, relatives, and other people. She wants to continue working and supporting her family.

Ysabel is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, among other things. She is grateful for the loan she received and promises to make the payments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Carlos continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte a sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir  trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco. He continues to be engaged in offering a transportation service, to the customers who request him. He is in this business for a long time. It is doing well, thanks to the determination he puts into it every day. The member wants to be able to continue working as a way to keep supporting his family.

He is requesting the loan to do maintenance on his car.

He promises to pay all his installments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de madera, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank group. She continues to work buying and selling wood. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments. The member is a responsible and determined person. Being that way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia sigue con su negocio de bar y picantería, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  arroz, menestras ,carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Illary III. She continues her work at her bar and restaurant business. 
She is in this business for a long time. It is doing well, thanks to the determination she puts into it every day. The member wants to be able to continue working as a way to keep supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, mixed vegetables, meant, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, mixed vegetables, meat, among others.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, leche, azúcar  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Sabina belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank group. She continues to work in her grocery store. She sells goods of basic needs, such as rice, sugar, and so on. The member is a responsible and determined person. Being that way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, milk, sugar, among others.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, among others.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia Inés pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia sigue  dedicándose a la venta de comida, la socia es una persona  responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,azucar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Inés belongs to the ILLARY III communal bank group. She continues to work selling food. The member is a responsible and determined person. She prepares different types of meals on her customers' requests. Being that way she improves her family's financial situation.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, among others.

She feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to pay all of her installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, among others.

loans.name: Kamoljon

texts.ru:
Камолжон честный и ответственный человек района Н.Хусрав. Он женат и отец двоих сыновей. Сыновьям 20 и 11 лет. Младший сын учится в средней школе. Старший сын помогает папе на работе. Камолжон на районе живет вместе матерью, женой и сыновьям. 
На районе Н. Хусрав большая часть народа имеет скотный двор или землю для посева. И Камолжон не стал отставать от других жителей Н.Хусрав. 15 лет назад открыл свой бизнес по "купле и продажи крупнорогатых скотов". Он сейчас продвигает деятельность отца. Камолжон старший мужчина в семье, и он так много старается, чтобы прокормить семью, и улучшить условия жизни семью. Его доходы только от животноводческой деятельностью. Он  хочет увеличить доход, путем расширения бизнеса. Камолжон просит кредит для купли несколько крупнорогатого скота. Он большими надеждами обратился к Вам за кредитом. Камолжон надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Kamoljon is an honest and responsible resident of the Nosiri Khusrav region. He is married and the father of two sons. His sons are 20 and 11 years old. His younger son is studying in high school. His elder son helps his father at work. Kamoljon lives with his mother, wife and sons.

In the Nosiri Khusrav region, most people have a livestock yard or land for planting crops. And Kamoljon does not lag behind the other residents of Nosiri Khusrav in this regard. He opened his own business for buying and selling cattle 15 years ago. Now he is carrying on his father's business. He wants to increase his income by expanding the business. Kamoljon is asking for a loan to buy a few cattle. He has turned to you for a loan with high hopes. Kamoljon hopes for your support.

loans.use: to expand his livestock operations and buy cattle.

loans.name: Josefa Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefa, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y mecánico. 
Doña Josefa es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su marido el cual se dedica al comercio de frutas y plátanos, el viaja hasta  Santo Domingo ciudad en la cual distribuye las frutas a comerciantes, el compra a Agricultores todo tipo de frutas como melón, sandia, naranjas, pepinos entre otros y lleva a vender en la ciudad antes mencionada y de allá se va hasta  Quevedo lugar en el cual compra plátano el mismo que de regreso lo distribuye en su ciudad con lo cual se gana algo en el viaje de ida y de vuelta, el lleva 7 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y plátano. Lleva más de 11 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ayuda a su marido en la dura carga de mantener su hogar. Sus sueños son darles lo mejora  sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Salud y Vida (Health and Life) meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. This place is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes away from the two best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Josefa is 33 years old and lives in this place. She is married and they have two children, a 12-year-old and a 7-year-old, who both go to school. Her husband is a merchant and a mechanic.

Josefa is a very good wife. She will use the loan to help her husband, who is making a living selling fruit and bananas. He travels to the city of Santo Domingo where he sells the fruit to merchants. He buys all kinds of fruit from the farmers, like melons, watermelons, oranges, cucumber, and so on, and brings them to the aforementioned city. Afterwards he goes to Quevedo, where he buys bananas to sell back in his hometown. This way he makes money on both trips. He has been doing this for seven years to improve his family's financial situation.

This loan is to buy fruits, vegetables and bananas. She has been in this credit group for more than 11 years and likes it, because with the loans she helps her husband with the heavy burden of maintaining their home. Her dream is to give the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and bananas.

loans.name: Maritza Johana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Maritza tiene una carreta en la cual se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, vende hamburguesas, tostadas, sanduches, alas asadas, chuzos entre otros bocadillos, además de deliciosos  batidos de fruta, gaseosas, aguas, trabaja todos los días todo el día, con ella trabaja una persona a quien le paga por sus servicios ya que en ocasiones el trabajo es mucho y ella no alcanza a atender a sus clientes, ella en temporadas también se va a las playas cercanas para aprovechar la oportunidad para vender más, lleva más de 9 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana sus ingresos.  
Este crédito es para comprar pan, embutidos frutas y otros víveres  para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella mejora su vida. Sus sueños son tener una cadena de carretas de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Salud y Vida communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its traditional culture and, in addition, for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Maritza lives in this place. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 8. The older one is in secondary school and the younger is in primary school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Maritza has a cart with which she works selling fast food. She sells hamburgers, tostadas [toasted corn grains], sandwiches, barbecued wings, and meat skewers, among other snacks, in addition to delicious fruit smoothies, soft drinks, and water. She works every day, all day long. A person who she pays for their services works with her since sometimes there is a lot of work and she can't keep up with serving the customers. Seasonally, she also goes to nearby beaches to take advantage of the opportunity to sell more. She has been working in this business for over 9 years, with which she earns her income.

This loan is to purchase bread, cold cuts, fruit, and other groceries to prepare the foods. She has been in the communal bank group for more than 4 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she improves her live. Her dream is to have a chain of fast food carts.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cold cuts, fruit, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Shelita Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Shelita, tiene 44  años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 22, 18 y 11 años, los dos menores  estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Shelita se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus prendas ella las vende en su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y otras prendas. Lleva más de 10 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Salud y Vida communal bank group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its traditional culture and, in addition, for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Shelita lives in this place. She is 44 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children, ages 22, 18, and 11. The two younger ones are students at the university and secondary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Shelita works in sales. She sells all sorts of clothing. She sells door-to-door though she sells the majority of her clothing in her house. She leaves the products on credit and covers each week or two weeks. She has been in this business for over 10 years, which allows her to earn her own income for the good of her family. 

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and other clothing. She has been in the communal bank group for more than 10 years and she likes it because with the loans she began her business. Her dream is that her children be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III,la socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Maruja belongs to the Illary III communal bank. The member continues with her grocery store business. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The member has had her business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day; this is the way that the member gets her family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to purchase milk, sugar, and more.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III.
