 La socia Julia  Beatriz alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de turismo, la socia opera diferentes tipos de rutas como camino inca entre otros, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Illary III communal bank.

Julia Beatriz alternates her daily work with her tourism business. She operates different types of routes such as the Inca trail and more. She has been working at her business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way to continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase tourist tickets and more. 

The member is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets and more.

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  5 meses de edad. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja casi todos los días y aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora es más fresco y su mamá le cuida al bebé, también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus conocidos, tiene mucha clientela ya que les da crédito y cobrar cada 8 o 15 días. Lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y  zapatillas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Lleva  2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe en el grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su  hijo.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

María lives in this place. She is 21 years old, in a common-law marriage, and in this relationship they have one child who is 5 months old. Her husband is a construction worker.

María works selling all sorts of clothing and sandals. She sells from door-to-door. She works almost every day and takes advantage of the morning hours since at this time it is cooler and her mother cares for the baby. She also sells from her house, where her most known customers come. She has a large customer base since she offers them credit and collects every week or two weeks. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, which allows her to earn her own resources.

This loan is to purchase clothing and sandals since she has many orders. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it for the benefits that she gets in the group. Her dream is to give her child the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Solanda Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Solanda, tiene 25 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos 8 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela.
Doña Solanda es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica al comercio, ella vende zapatos, ropa, artículos para el hogar, electrodomésticos, entre otros productos, ella recorre la ciudad donde tiene sus clientes, realiza los pedidos y luego entrega los productos los mismos que cobra cada 8 días,  ella aprovecha cuando hay artículos de oferta que es para lo que invierte los créditos ya que luego los vende al precio normal y de esta forma se gana muy buenos ingresos, ya son 5 años que lleva realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida y la de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, ropa, ollas y otros artículos del hogar que ella  vende. Lleva 2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

Solanda lives in this place. She is 25 years old, is separated and from this relationship, has two children, ages 8 and 3. The older one goes to school. 

Solanda is a housewife who, to get her own resources, works in sales. She sells shoes, clothing, household goods, household appliances, and other products. She makes her rounds in the city where she has her customers, she takes orders, and later delivers the products which she collects for each week. She takes advantage of when there are items on sale, which is what she invests the loans in, since later she sells them at the regular price and in this way she gets a good income. She has been doing this work for 5 years, with which she earns her living and that of her children.

This loan is to purchase shoes, clothing, pots, and other household products that she sells. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans permit her to finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, pots and other household goods.

loans.name: Agueda Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Agueda, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, la menor aun vive con ella. 
Doña Agueda es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa, joyas y bisuterías y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días  y no tiene horarios fijo, ella también vende en su casa, hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 7 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo y no depender de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisuterías y joyas. Lleva 4 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

Agueda lives in this place. She is 61 years old, and some years ago her life-long partner died and she became a widow, but from this relationship she had three children, who are now adults. The youngest still lives with her. 

Agueda is a woman who likes to earn her own income and in this way get ahead. She works in sales; she sells clothing, jewelry and costume jewelry and she sells from door to door. She goes out three or four days a week and doesn't have a fixed schedule. She also sells from her house, where her most known customers come. She leaves the products on credit and collects every week or two. She has been in this business for more than 7 years, which permits her to earn her own income and not depend on her children. 

This loan is to purchase clothing, costume jewelry and jewelry. She has been in the loan group for 4 years and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, costumer jewelry and jewelry.

loans.name: Abelino Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive don Abelino, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Abelino es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad con tal de que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa donde vende agua en bidones y botellas pequeñas, le ayuda su mujer en las ventas en su casa ya que él se encarga de entregar el agua por toda la ciudad y en playas cercanas donde cuenta con muy buena clientela que lo llaman y el muy gustoso sale en su carro a surtir a sus clientes de este liquido vital, el también tiene un centro de eventos y alquiler de sillas con lo cual gana un ingreso extra que les ayuda a salir adelante. Lleva 10 años con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidones y sillas para el alquiler. Lleva dos  años en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Salud y Vida loan group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its traditional culture, in addition to being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Abelino lives in this place. He is married and has two children, ages 13 and 8. The older one goes to secondary school and the younger one is in primary school. His wife is a businesswoman. 

Abelino is a very hard-working man who does whatever job as long as his family doesn't want for anything needed to live. He works in business. He has a small store in his house where he sells large bottles and small bottles of water. His wife helps him with the sales in his house since he takes care of delivering the water throughout the city and the nearby beaches where he has a good customer base which calls him and he very willingly leaves in his car to supply his customers with his vital liquid. He also has an event center and rents chairs with which he earns extra income that helps them to get ahead. He has been in this business for 10 years.

The loan will be used to purchase large bottles of water and chairs to rent. He has been in the loan group for two years and he likes it because it offers him loans. His dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase large bottles of water and chairs.

loans.name: Tania Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Tania e una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella tienen un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversos trabajos de arreglo personal, también realiza trabajos a domicilio si sus clientes así lo desean. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00 y si algún cliente requiere  de sus servicios hasta más tarde, no le incomoda ya que su salón lo tiene en su casa, trabaja sola y lleva más de 10 años con su labor la cual le encanta y con la que se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar tintes, esmaltes y herramientas para y así brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son tener un SPA.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Progreso communal bank meet fortnightly in the El Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of the Manabí province. This city is also known as the “city of the royal tamarind trees.”

This is where Tania, 27, lives. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children, aged 11 and 8, who go to school. Her husband works as a driver. She studied Cosmetology at a local academy a few years ago. Tania is a woman that likes to work hard to get ahead. She owns a beauty salon where she offers different beauty treatments. She also visits her clients if they want her to. She works every day from 9:00 until 9:00 pm. She can work later in case her clients need her help. This is not a problem for her, since her salon is located at home. She works alone and has been doing so for more than ten years. She loves her job, and it is how she makes a living.

She will use this loan to buy dyes, nail polish and tools needed to offer a better service. This is her fourth cycle with the communal bank and she likes to be a member because the loans are helpful for her. Her dream is to open a spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish and tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Alba Beguy

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 34 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, 11, 9 y 8 años que estudian uno en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es Guardia de seguridad
Doña Alba es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ayuda a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de su hijos que es  lo más importante para ella, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de víveres, recargas telefónicas, artículos  de bazar y papelería que es lo mas necesita en esta época del año, trabaja todos días y casi todo el día, su negocio cada vez está mejor y esto por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Tiene más de 5 años con su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares y productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio y cada vez con los créditos cada día mejora su tienda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the citadel of El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which is known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds. The members of Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progresso come together every fifteen days.

In this location lives Ms. Alba. She is 34 years old, is married and from this relationship she has three children, ages 11, 9 and 8 years old who study in college and the younger ones in school. Her husband is the security guard.

Ms. Alba is a hardworking woman who helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children, which is the most important for her. She has a grocery shop in her home where she sells all types of food, telephone chargers, bazaar items and stationary which is the most needed in this time of year. She works every day and all day long, her business every time is better and it is for the help she receives from the loans. She has more than 5 years with her business.

This loan is for the purchase of school supplies and primary necessity products. She has 8 years in the Loan Group and she likes it because it began her business and every time the credits every day improve her shop. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and necessities.

loans.name: Segundo Froilan

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 15 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que va a mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 59 years old, lives with his spouse and their two children in Callayuc district, a community which works in agriculture and animal husbandry which is located in Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

He works growing coffee and has done this work for the past 15 years, so he has experience in this business. The loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his coffee crop. With this, he hopes to offer a better product to his customers which will improve his income level, with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Jessenia Cecibel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 39 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, 20, 19, 17 y 9 años de edad,  los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela, tres de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Jessenia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de su hijos, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de víveres, artículos  de bazar y papelería, medicinas, helados y otros artículos, trabaja todos los días casi todo el día, sus hijos y su marido le ayudan cuando ellos pueden. Tiene más de 10 años con su negocio el cual les da para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y útiles escolares. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es mejorar su local.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

Jessenia lives in this place. She is married, and from this relationship has four children, ages 20, 19, 17 and 9. The two youngest ones are in secondary and primary school. Three of them still live with her. Her husband is a businessman. 

Jessenia is a very hard-working woman who likes to help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. She has a grocery store in their house where she sells all sorts of groceries, small items and paper goods, medicines, ice cream and other items. She works every day almost all day long. Her children and husband help her when they can. She has had this business for over 10 years, which allows her to get ahead with her family. 

This loan is to purchase groceries and school supplies. She has been in the loan group for 9 years and she likes it because the loan help her a lot. Her dream is to improve her retail space.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies.

loans.name: Francisca Marilu

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 50 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos, siete son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio, cinco de ellos aun viven con ella. 
Doña Francisca es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene un local en un centro comercial de la ciudad donde vende  comida rápida como  tostadas, sanduches, corviches, empanadas, jugos de fruta, gaseosas, aguas, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola y  en ocasiones con la ayuda de sus hijos, lleva 7 meses en este local pero desde hace varios años se dedicada a este negocio. 
Este crédito es para comprar pan, embutidos frutas y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella cada vez mejora su vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

Francisca lives in this place. She is 50 years old; some years ago her husband died and she became a widow but from this relationship she had 8 children. Seven are adults and the youngest is 15 years old and is a secondary school student. Five of them still live with her.

Francisca is a woman who likes to work to get her family ahead. She has a retail space in a mall in the city where she sells fast food such as tostadas [toasted corn kernels], sandwiches, corviches, empanadas, fruit juices, soft drinks, water, etc. She works every day from 9:00am to 6:00pm, works alone, and sometimes with the help of her children. She has been in this retail space for 7 months but for the a number of years, she has worked in this business.

This loan is to purchase bread, cold cuts, fruit, and other groceries to prepare the food. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she is improving her life. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cold cuts, fruit, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica started her first business, JB Couture Cakes, at 16 years old while attending the only culinary high school in the US. She started baking for family and friends, and then word spread and she began to get requests for paid orders. From there, her business took off. Through word of mouth, repeat customers, and social networking, she has created a successful startup business.

Now, at 20 years old, Jessica wants to move her business to a storefront in Belmar, NJ: JB Couture Cupcakes. She hopes that a storefront will allow her to more easily cater to her loyal customer base, while being more accessible to the local residents of Monmouth County.

She has a strong backing of community support. She held a successful Kickstarter campaign, which raised $5,840, and has had multiple commercial kitchen appliances donated to her from community members as well. This loan of $1,150 will be used to purchase the remaining equipment she needs for her new storefront.

From Jessica: "I plan for JB Couture Cupcakes to be an interactive cupcake experience where the customer will create their own cupcake. A menu will list the type of cupcake, buttercream, filling, toppings, and sprinkles that the customer will be able to choose. Once the customer picks the flavors and toppings they crave, I will create the cupcake before their eyes. I will also have a seating area and benches so the customers can enjoy their cupcakes in style just steps away from the beach. Whether it’s a sweet treat on a beach day or a dessert to go along with summer fireworks, JBCC with satisfy everyone."

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her cupcake bakery.

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Viviana con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella tiene un local arrendado en un centro comercial de la ciudad, son muchas las personas que asisten a este lugar todos los días, su marido también los fines de semana se desplaza a otros lugares a vender con lo cual él gana algo extra.  Lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones, ropa de niños y otras prendas que vende. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener su propio local.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years of as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks. 

Viviana lives in this place. She is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage and from this relationship they have two children, ages 14 and 6, who are in secondary school and primary school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Viviana, with the aim of having her own income to help her husband to take care of the household expenses, works selling all sorts of clothing. She has a rented retail space in a mall in the city. Many people come to this place every day. Her husband also goes to other places on the weekends to sell, with which he earns a little extra. She has been in this business for 3 years, which allows them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to purchase shirts, pants, children's clothing and other clothes that she sells. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dream is to have her own retail space.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, children's clothing, and other clothes.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is the owner of a home health services business in the town of Red Bank, New Jersey. Her business focuses on providing affordable home care services to people in need of live-in companions and sitters, home health aids, CNAs, or nutritional guides.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her home health business.

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, ella tiene hijos mayores de edad de otra relación, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido actual es agricultor. 
Doña Doris es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante, ella tiene un  bar en su casa donde vende bocadillos, caramelos, aguas, colas, cervezas entre otras bebidas, trabaja todos los días aunque son los fines de semana es cuando mas vende ya que llegan muchas personas al lugar, lleva más de 10 años con su bar el cual le da buenas ganancias.
Este crédito es para comprar caramelos, golosinas, colas, aguas y bebidas de toda clase para surtir su negocio. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños seguir incrementado su negocio.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso members meet twice a month in the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Doris lives here. She is 48 years old and maintains a common-law marriage. She has older children from another relationship and one of them still lives in her home. Her current husband is a farmer.

Doris is a woman who has had to work hard in order to get ahead. She has a bar in her home where she sells snacks, candy, water, colas, beer and other beverages. She works everyday but the weekends are when she sells the most because she has more customers those days. She has been in this business for more than ten years which brings in good profits.

This loan is to buy candy, sweets, colas, water, and all kinds of beverages to supply her business. This is her 6th cycle with the communal bank and she likes it due to improvements to her business.

She dreams of continuing to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy candy, sweets, colas, water, and other beverages

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es:
Guillermo es un joven estudiante de 21 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia, vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos, quienes durante toda su vida fueron su apoyo. 
Guillermo actualmente trabaja como mensajero en una empresa de electrónica, sin embargo gracias a sus conocimientos de Inglés, Francés y Alemán se dedica también a realizar traducciones particulares, sus ingresos los utiliza principalmente para apoyar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar. Con mucho esfuerzo culminó sus estudios de primaria y solicita un crédito educativo para poder continuar cursando la carrera de Derecho. 
Guillermo manifiesta que además de aspirar a alcanzar su independencia financiera, desea continuar especializándose en su área; asimismo, en el ámbito personal su sueño es poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 
Guillermo agradece de antemano a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 21 year old student. He was born in La Paz, Bolivia and he lives with his parents and two siblings. They have been supportive of him his whole life.  
 
Right now, Guillermo is working as a messenger in an electronics business. Nonetheless, thanks to his knowledge of English, French and German, he also does private translations. He mainly sues his income to help with the household expenses. With much effort, he finished his primary studies and is asking for an education loan to continue studying law. 

Guillermo says that in addition to aspiring to reach financial independence, he wants to continue specializing in his field. In addition, for his personal life his dream is to give his family better living conditions. 
 
Guillermo thanks people beforehand for helping others and generating new opportunities for growth with their financial resources.

loans.use: to pay for his law school studies.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila is a divorced woman she has a kid and she lives with her parents at her parents house Lucila is still selling huanaco blankets and she is working hard at her workshop she is healthy and now she needs a loan to buy vicuña, huanaco and regular wool to increase her production and to have more to offer to their customers  Lucila is 31 years old and she hopes you can help her again
texts.en:
Lucila is a 31-year-old divorced woman. She has one child and she lives with her parents at her parents' house. 

Lucila is still selling huanaco blankets and she is working hard at her workshop. 

She is healthy and now she needs a loan to buy vicuña, huanaco and regular wool to increase her production and to have more to offer to her customers  Lucila hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy wool for blanket making.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es: Luis vive en el campo y se dedica hace 8 años a la crianza de ganado  y tambien trabaja de albañil cuando le contratan, Luis cuando tiene contratos de albañileria en ciudades lejanas y en esos casos vive solo y aveces vive con sus padres y 2 hermanos y una hermana que esta estudiando. Luis solicita el dinero del credito para comprar una vaca, Luis espera mejorar su negocio y espera comprar mas ganado ya que comenta que es  bueno este negocio y de alli le sale los ingresos para pagar sus cuotas y apoya con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Luis lives in thine country and has raised cattle for 8 years. He also works as a bricklayer when he is hired for it. Whenever Luis is hired for bricklaying in cities that are far away, he lives alone. Sometimes he lives with his parents and his 2 brothers and a sister who is in school. Luis is asking for the loan money to buy a cow. Luis hopes to improve his business and buy more cattle, because he says he is good at this business and from it he gets income to make his payments and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Khomidjon

texts.ru: Хомидчон 51-летный житель района Н.Хусрав.  На районе Н.Хусрав  имеется хорошие погодные условия для ведения сельского хозяйства. Хомидчон  проживает здесь давно. Он женат и отец троих детей. Сыновья находится на заработках Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Его дети хорошо воспитаны и они уже самостоятельные парни. Жена Хомидчона занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Сам Хомидчон занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота в течение 15 лет. Он покупает молодых телят, откармливают их несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу Он трудолюбивый и сильный человек. Целью данного кредита является развитие животноводческой деятельности. Хомидчон планирует увеличить поголовье скота и тем самым улучшить условия жизни семьи. Он надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать его сейчас.
texts.en:
Khomidjon is a 51-year-old resident of the N. Khusrav region, an area that has good conditions for running a farm. He has lived in the area for a long time and is married with three children. His sons are working in Russia in order to earn money to help their parents care for the family. His children were raised well and are already independent men. His wife works in farming, and Khomidjon himself has been raising cattle for 15 years. He buys young calves, fattens then for several months, and then sells them. He is a hardworking and strong person.

The goal of this loan is to develop his animal husbandry business. Khomidjon plans to increase his head count of livestock and in such a way to improve his family's living conditions. He hopes for your help. You can support him right now.

loans.use: to increase his head count of livestock and expand his business

loans.name: Pablo Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven de 21 años de edad, Andres vive en el campo junto a sus padres y a sus hermanos, Andres comenta que su madre se dedica al ordeño de vacas, su padre es discapacitado y no trabaja y de sus 3 hermanos uno se encuentra estudiando. Andres se dedica al jornal y al  ordeño de vacas de su patron, Andres necesita el credito para comprar terneros  ya que su patron le hace tener hasta 3 terneros y no le cobra por la hierba que consuman estos terneritos, Andres desea comprar terneros, criarlos y comercializarlos y asi  mejorar sus ingresos para formar  un capital y seguir apoyando para mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Andres, age 21, lives in the country with his parents and his siblings.  Andres says that his mother milks cows, and his father is disabled and does not work.  His three siblings go to school.  Andres is a day laborer, and he milks his boss’s cows.

Andres needs the loan to buy calves because his boss allows him to have up to three calves without charging him for the pasture that they consume.  Andres wishes to buy calves, to raise them, and to sell them.  This way he will improve his earnings in order get money.  He will continue helping to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 48 años de edad, Rosario vive en el campo donde se gana la vida por medio de la ganaderia y crianza de animales menores. El esposo de Rosario  no puede trabajar ya que tiene una enfermedad en sus manos ya que no tiene movimiento en sus dedos. Rosario tiene 5 hijos de los cuales una asiste al colegio, y los demas ya trabajan al jornal o en la ganaderia y crianza de animales menores.Rosario desde que era muy joven se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y al ordeño de las vacas y la venta de la leche . Rosario necesita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos. Rosario vive en una casa que les presta un amigo y Rosario tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y a futuro poder comprarse una casita para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario, 48, lives in the countryside and earns her living working with livestock and raising small animals.

Her husband is unable to work because he has a medical problem with his hands and he cannot move his fingers.

Rosario has five children, one of whom goes to school. The others already work on the farms or in raising livestock and small animals.

Since she was very young, Rosario has worked in this field, as well as milking cows and selling their milk.

Rosario needs the money from this loan to buy some pigs.

They live in a house which they are borrowing from a friend. She dreams of improving her business so that in the future she can buy a small house for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is the owner of a landscaping business operating in Hackensack, New Jersey. 

He will use this loan to purchase equipment to better serve his clients.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his landscaping business.

loans.name: Elen Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Elen Angelica  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien la socia ahora esta vendiedno ropa como pantalones,casacas y chompas, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas,chompas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower Elen Angelica continues tin her beauty products selling business. Now she is also selling clothing like pants, jackets and sweaters. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfume. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell all of her beauty products. She is asking for the loan to but jackets, sweaters and pants. 

This borrower is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Angelica se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member who runs a food business.  She makes different food such as roast chicken, soups and meat dishes.

She works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 6 o'clock in the afternoon. She has been in this business for several years and she is very successful. 

She dreams of having her own restaurant in the future. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

She is very pleased with the loan system and she promises to pay off the instalments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is 41 years old and he lives with his big family in the frontier village Khashtarak of the Tavush region. Edvard works as a driver and he is simultaneously a farmer. His parents are pensioners and they greatly help their son with their farm and cattle care as well. 

Edvard in his farm has cows, calves and chickens. His does many agricultural activities. From his plot of land he gathers cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, greens and peppers. His orchard gives him sweet harvests of persimmon and apple. He sells his farm products such as milk, curd, macun (a national dairy product), meat and cheese and also his land’s harvest during the week at the wholesale market. 

Edvard greatly wants to develop swine breeding in his farm, which will be very profitable for his farm and family. So with this loan he will buy several piglets and fodder for his farm cattle. He will also organize some agricultural work in his orchard.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and fodder for his farm cattle and to organize some agricultural work in his orchard.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Lila and she lives in the frontier village Khashtarak of Tavush region. She lives here with her daughter. Her husband and son are now in the Russian Federation doing construction work. 

Lila has plot of land where she cultivates some vegetables. She also has a business of clothes sales right from her house. The merchandise from time to time she brings from the Russian Federation. Lila and her husband do their best to provide their children with good living conditions. Lila dreams that her husband and son will be finally back and never leave their village again looking for some profitable work. 

Lila’s daughter is a student at the medical college and she is a future pharmacist. She studies at the paid division. This loan of 170,000 Armenian drams she will use for paying her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Olga Nohemi

texts.es: Olga  es madre soltera, tiene 36 años de edad y su hijo tiene 11 años y asiste al colegio. Olga se dedica a la venta de ropa ofreciendo a sus clientas, vecinas y amigas. Olga necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería en ropa. Olga vive con su madre que es costurera, su hijo y un hermano. Olga se ha planteado la meta de sacar adelante sola a su hijo ya que el padre del niño no le apoya en los gastos de su hijo. Olga va a seguir en su negocio y velar por el bienestar de su hijo como toda madre responsable.
texts.en:
Olga is a single mother, aged 36. Her son is 11 and goes to school. Olga sells clothes to her customers, neighbours and friends.

She needs this loan to be able to buy more merchandise.

She lives with her mother, who is a seamstress, her son and a brother. She has accepted the challenge of raising her son on her own given that the boy's father does not contribute any money to his upbringing.

She is going to continue with her business and make sure her son is well looked after, just like any other responsible mother.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
This is Dennis, a farmer in Kisumu. He is married with three children, two of whom are twins. He grows kale, onions, tomatoes and bananas. He then sells his produce in the local market. He encourages other young people in his village, instead of waiting for formal employment, to engage in farming in order to have a source of income. 

Through farming he has been able to expand his farmland from 1 hectare to 3 hectares. His dream is to gain tenders to sell his produce in supermarkets that fetch better prices. He wants to increase his output by buying farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticide. With a Kiva loan he shall be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Kadiatu. She is divorced and has three children, aged 21, 18 and 16 years. In 2013, Kadiatu established her soft drink and bundles of pure water business. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are both men and women.  

Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,105,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy an additional 20 crates of soft drinks and 100 bundles of pure water for resale.  

She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her capital by generating more profit. In the future, Kadiatu plans to improve the business and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional 20 crates of soft drinks and 100 bundles of pure water

loans.name: Erika Estefania

texts.es: Estefania vive con su abuelita ya que sus padres por motivos de trabajo viven muy lejos de Estefania. Ella es una joven muy estudiosa, ya que termino la secundaria y aspira poder ingresar a la universidad. Estefania para obtener algo de recursos economicos se dedica a la venta de productos de visuteria, cosmeticos, cremas corporaley y mas productos de revista. Estefania solicita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de cosmeticos y los demas productos que comercializ y asi mejorar su negocio. Estefania tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos y poder ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Estefania lives with her grandmother because her parents live a long way away from her because of their work.

She is a very studious young girl; she has recently finished secondary school and she is hoping to start university.

In order to finance this, she sells jewellery products, cosmetics, body creams and other similar things.

She is asking for a loan so she can invest in cosmetics and other products which she can sell to improve her business.

She dreams of improving her business and generating more income so she can start university.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.
